5fqK8a1xeIaxzy30sjpD-A.text: Nothing fantastic, but a nice place.  The spinach salad was sparse, pretty much just spinach.  We also had the manicotti which was one of the entrees we liked best. The service was a bit strange. They interrupted conversations, made us feel like we were taking too long, and when we asked for vegetarian recommendations, the waiter said "everything's good".... my biggest pet peeve!  Get the dessert sampler! That was worth the visit!

etA5Dh5BM2sQpLR5fFofIw.text: The service here is amazing.  Very upscale, so be sure to have your dinner etiquette ready.  When you first sit down, they bring out the special which is just giant prawns on ice, so of course that's what I got.  Prawns served with Risotto, you better believe I ate very last bite.    Very expensive, so make sure you account for that.  But otherwise a great experience.  My fiance and I loved it, an you will too.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prawns, out of the shell, with Risotto.

5mgs5HmJXOwrqx2K82wjvg.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas.  A True dining experience with excellent food  and the dining team are truly amazing. I have been there 8 times and never disappointed!!   They make you feel very special.  Don't miss this when in Vegas!  I have been to the one in Puerto Rico as well and consistent experience.  Five stars!

s7bNPgilvKiuDkNFMj-7RQ.text: This restaurant thinks very highly of itself--maybe it should start thinking about its customers. Our dinner was a drawn out affair marked by long gaps between service, multiple failures to bring requested items, servers with attitude issues and food that just didn't meet the mark.

0YvWS1dqhxUVI4ynN-4y2w.text: I've had Italian food at some of the finest restaurants in Italy while surrounded by local friends, but none were any better than Il Mulino in the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace.  Manager Alisha Rosinek presides over her talented "second family" on a mission to create a cathedral for an evening of Italian gustatory pleasures.  She succeeds.  Her head waiters are more like food museum docents as they fire your imagination for each act of the meal performance.  I don't see how the original Il Mulino in New York can compete with it's new branch now that Alisha has been given free reign of  the brand in the desert.  Watching skilled people do what they love to do, create an extraordinary dining experience for you, can't get old.      As soon as you are seated and handed a napkin, a gigantic wheel of hard Parmesan appears at table side and a mouthwatering chuck is placed on your appetizer plate.  From then on, one of many skilled hands is attending to your needs every minute.  Dennis explains that this aroma and taste helps prepare your palate for the flavors to come.  That particular Parmesan is what is used in the kitchen for most entrees.  It quickly become clear that this is a head waiter that loves his food museum.  After that he describe the wines that he negotiated for while he was in Italy directly with wineries--the ones that were NOT being shipped to the US and why he wanted them.  Dennis then explains, from the cooks perspective, how each special of the day is prepared and helps you decide by asking questions.  Pavlov discovered the direct link between the salivary glands and anticipation of food.  Wasn't he really Italian?  Il Mulino rings that bell deliciously.  The appearance of the actual food and wine exceeds your imagination.  These are meals for the senses and those who appreciate the details which created them.  This is a complete evening so don't plan on rushing off to a show.  Il Mulino is the show!

DC0RZ3NEJTgadhs8lAZjaQ.text: I still think of this dinner often. This is the classic traditional Italian restaurant you always enjoy. With an old school classy look and great location this is a must visit for Italian food lovers.  As always you'll get white linens, staff in tuxes, big portions, lots of cheese, and great great wine.

U89QPl5voo0UW6XJj8iITQ.text: Three words: Save. Your. Money. -or- Go. Somewhere. Else.  I made my reservation for 8 weeks in advance. This was my bachelorette party "nice meal out" and I was so so so excited. I had studied the menu for weeks, had picked out the wine I wanted, had planned my outfit. Saying I was excited is honestly an understatement. Of all the things I was prepared to be, disappointed was not one of them.  The service was seriously lacking. For the amount of money we were paying, the service was terrible. Our "captain" was terrible. He was far more concerned with the guys next to us buying wine to understand that we wanted to keep the cocktails flowing and get some desserts. The meal took 3.5 hours. If I thought the service was bad, I surely wasn't prepared for the food.  Horribly over-priced poorly crafted food. The "free" items they give you are flavorless. I've had better buffalo mozzarella from the pizza place down the street.  As for entrees, there were a variety of options at the table including lobster ravioli, truffle cream ravioli, chicken dishes, and some other things I can't remember. None of them memorable, some barely palatable, all of them over priced.   The best part was I had to go back to the hotel room after dinner because I got sick. Great time...in that not at all way.  I would not reccomend this restaurant to anyone. There are far too many top quality restaurants in Vegas to waste your money here. I wish I had gone to Circo or Sinatra instead.

r3q-CpxYU-zoCLWALktNTQ.text: This review is about special events in their side room.  I attended a special event in the side room which has a occupancy rating of 15.  The restaurant crammed 15 guests in the room with two six foot tables; 7 guests per side with 1 guest at the far end and the other far end allows servers to squeeze by.  If you do that math that gives each guest 20" of space which is the same as an economy airline seat.  The experience was far below my expectation of being at a 5 star restaurant.  When I returned to my hotel room I realized 45 minutes in the chair with my arms being pinned against my body has chaffed my sides.  Didn't even have dinner!  Between the antipasto and the primo I got up to ask the Il Mulino staff what could they do to help us out, however, the staffs response was so rude I decided to apologize to my host and leave.

X2gYxRO4kUNyeltOwEBjXg.text: From the old world decor and ambiance to the old style service (waiters and captains); from the appetizers to main course to dessert, Il Mulino New York at the Caesars in Las Vegas is hands down my favorite restaurant!! Once seated they give you two kinds of bread, chunk of excellent parma reggiano, salami and sauteed zucchini (cold) . My wife and I always split a four course meal after learning from our first dinner here about the huge portions and for today's lunch we had spinach with bacon salad, pappardelle with bolognese sauce, baked branzino, and panacotta. The panacotta seems more like a flan but it was still wonderful. We spent $220 without alcohol (includes 20% tip) and it was worth every bite!!

CJET04dOSJwShP11N4_XDQ.text: Went after Celine Dion show.  Waited by the bar for a few and then seated.  Captain Dennis was well rehearsed and knew his 25 specials by heart.  The complimentary appetizer bites were delish and garlic bread was yummy.  Loved the parmesan.  If I aim to please a client or impress some good friends this is my pick.  Be prepared to spend some $$$$.

Jl0VOSUd4YvfSD8Jpj68Kw.text: We have dined at Il Mulino in Las Vegas a number of times now and have always found it to be a great experience.  The atmosphere is old school but lively. The wait staff is very efficient and helpful.  The Table Captains have always been very knowledgeable and helpful in making selections from the extensive specials list and the menu.  The food has been superb.  I would highly recommend allowing Dennis to pick out a suitable wine.  He has pointed us at some fabulous wines we never would have found ourselves while staying well within the price point we gave him.   I would highly recommend Il Mulino.

YBad-hFSqXDlgoBuGgdIRw.text: You pay for what you get.  I love being pampered, but it doesn't come cheap.  Once you're seated, the servers bring out a couple of complimentary appetizers.  Each entree was well prepared and the portions are generous.  It was a great experience.

mPztBK00UFDyCxPBcazF1w.text: I was very disappointed with the food here. Our appetizers were good, but I sent my entree back and my guest was being polite and didn't send his back. I tasted his mushroom risotto. It was sticky and dry with way too much truffle oil. I ordered the linguine con vongole. I usually have to add red pepper. Thank goodness I tried it first. It was so spicy I couldn't eat it. I have eaten in il Mulino in Atlantic City and New York and there was no comparison to the disappointing food here.  I thought the service was good from the bus staff, not the wait staff. I was disappointed when we chose a wine, (a relatively expensive bottle), and the waiter was not able to explain in the least, even though he had said he has tasted it. He said it was good. Thank goodness it was.  When our second bottle arrived, we were not even offered clean glasses and when we asked, our waiter got annoyed and decanted the wine in the same decanter. All in all, not a good experience, and rather embarrassing for me in the presence of my client.

8NlJGuVtVRoOi-rcDUn3Tw.text: Service was extraordinary!  Ambiance was romantic and low key.   Complimentary appetizers were tasty.   Chicken parmigiana was the best I've ever had! Not too heavy just perfect.   Shrimp sauteed in spicy marinara sauce was amazing.   My cappuccino was a perfect end.

DZgEjvAF-uRjd6ym_7_rSA.text: Amazing food and outstanding service. Definitely a place to try anytime you're in Vegas.

A-YPLSewB1tGLaQAMaYYyA.text: The il Mulino dining experience is excellent all-around. At the start of your meal, your server will bring by a spread of complimentary small plates: fried zucchini, an assortment of dry-aged salami and meats; bruschetta, crunchy garlic bread, and a large hunk of Pecorino Romano cheese. It's easy to fill up on the hors d'oeuvres, but you'll want to save room for the main courses.  Seriously, the decadent porcini-stuffed ravioli with black truffle-champagne is easily the best pasta dish I've ever had. The soft, melt-in-your-mouth, freshly-made ravioli in the creamy, luscious truffle sauce is pure ecstasy to the senses. #bestthingieverate

3gxXhubOoHa81HgGPsc-lA.text: Delicious food  ..... Incredible service!!  Anything we requested was delivered...... No problem changing some of the menu items ..... We were definitely" Wined and Dined"  I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.....a beautiful dining room..... Great food and total attention to detail from the staff!!!

t4l0fSofiTluX3k-KcIXew.text: Outstanding Italian restaurant. Very knowledgeable staff, and our captain was wonderful. Free appetizers and bread is brought to the table before ordering. I had their signature mushroom ravioli and it was outstanding. My hubby had the osco busco and he loved it as well. They will also serve you a free glass of their grappa. Watch out! It kicks in fast!  Great dining experience!

k5A-lyca4n02UHHzUbh2Jg.text: Truly fine dining, but I'm going to tell you a big tip. Il Mulino is really like walking into a New York traditional fine dining restaurant. With waiters dressed in full tux' s and bus boys in white jackets. You can dress casual or dress up its still Vegas. The Food. When you first sit down the food starts coming... Fried zucchini, Reggiano Parm, breads,and  bruchetta before you even see a menu, all gratis. The waiter who introduces himself as the Captain rattles off a number of specials perfectly. Here's your big tip about this restaurant. Order just one thing and split all your selections between 2 people. Besides being pricy the portions are huge. The food is excellently prepare and presently elegantly. Service is very attentive. Their signature dish not on the menu is; mushroom stuffed Ravioli with a black truffle champagne cream sauce. They don't tell you but its $50. More expensive I think then any of the printed menu items. Ask for prices on specials. We also ordered the pappardelle with Bolognese sauce (enough for 3 people) which was very good. Oh yes we had their Caesar salad excellent. The food the service very very good. At the end of your dinner they give you a shot of Grappa.... gratis again. It all felt a little 1950's and 2014 all rapped into one, but don't get me wrong I would go back in a heartbeat knowing the tips I gave you. Its high end fine Italian cuisine prepared like u were in Italy but huge portions. One other point I was not familiar with.... When we got our check there was a tip section, and a Captain tip section. I just left the customary 20%.

pmVDtmyA1q7wsDPmCuoYcw.text: Don't know why there's bad reviews for this restaurant. Been here several times and each time enjoyed every bit of it. Be sure to come here with an empty stomach.  Like everyone has mentioned, you start off your dinner with an impressive wheel of parmesan cheese presented to you and shaved at table side. They also serve you complementary fried zucchinis, bruschetta, and mussels.  Then the Captain will proceed to explain an entire book of specials that are not listed on the menu. I kid you not, it felt like an hour passed us by as he explained the specials for the night. Pretty impressive memory. Kudos to him.  I recommend that you don't skip out on the lobster ravioli as an app. It's a very rich and heavy dish, so I wouldn't recommend it for your entree.  Overall, you definitely getting your moneys worth, staff is very attentive, and best of all the food is excellent.

cHBGwZG5q6rQsqWxvn2irw.text: I have been to a lot restaurants throughout the years but II Mulino has the best and most attentive service at a restaurant I have ever been to.  The house caprese was excellent and same with the mushroom ravioli. The ambiance is also very romantic.  However be prepared to spend a lot of money at this place but the whole dining experience is well worth it! This is a must go to restaurant when you visit Las Vegas!

p8Csf0fsQo6zfHlXVSoORA.text: This is a great place and a regular stop for me on every trip to Las Vegas. The staff at every level is focus on their guest having a great experience. I highly recommend asking for Dennis as your Captain, really does a great job of managing the activities of his tables, will make some excellent wine suggestions if you are not as familiar with Italian reds. I highly recommend a fresh Ceasar Salad, Veal Parm with a side of pasta with a good red wine and you will be leaving in a food coma!   Enjoy-

GINaqR2Mk9T4p-DpNpOosw.text: We had great experience at Tokyo in Japan same as il Mulino.They are very great food and great service.  Anyway I ordered Two-layer veal with garlic,and then the veal was totally had been burnt! I ate and just burnt taste!! It was just burnt food. Unfortunately had burnt both sides. So I ate only one bite and call the waiter and I returned the cuisine, because I don't want to get cancer by the burnt food. After that My appetite was gone at all. However, our waiter said to me "The veal has some burning because this meat was charcoal grilling."  Excuse me?Of course I know what is the charcoal grilling, but this is just BURNT!!!!   My husband ordered Carbonara which was Ordinary taste and Ordinary taste reached also appetizer. I was too bad because il Mulino where is in Tokyo was more great and delicious foods. I never visit Il Mulino in Las Vegas.   Anyway, My merciful husband said: the staff was very attentive and friendly, they quickly apologized for the veal, and the carbonara and red wine was great. I like the outside terrace and will go back.

xot-5UUPLyYE7tAUsyyB6A.text: If you want a True Italian dining experience in Las Vegas that won't do the same damage to your wallet as the craps tables, go to Il Mulino.  Now I mention the pricing only because I was shocked at how reasonable it was, not to infer that this place should only be visited if money is tight.  I expected (and was willing) to pay $400 for my date and I's meal and was surprised.  Total wasn't even half of that.    The service is impeccable.  Drinks and water ALWAYS full.  Knowledgable table captain plus at least three other servers bringing a constant barrage of delicious breads, fresh Parmesan, and antipasti.  All before you have even gotten to look at the menu.  Then the food comes, huge portions of delicious authentic Italian cuisine.  I am a big eater and when I order tortellini or pasta at an Italian place the portions always leave me hungry.  Not here.  I had to take a to go bag.    Make this a must-eat on your next trip to Las Vegas.  You won't regret it.

FdivU60A6d7z9dCjNQYYRQ.text: The service was super  The food better than the service  glutenfree and friendly options !!!  great staff .....our captian was Fernando,  in a word  " Exceptional "

khcj9oOyAEZ_VxzT9RgDLA.text: Il Molino is my absolute favorite restaurant... EVER.   My first experience is at their restaurant in New York City. When I found out they had a restaurant in Las Vegas, it was great news. Every single visit to Vegas, this is a must stop!!  The wait staff is crazy good attentive. The food is out out of this world. And the atmosphere is elegant and charming. It has a great outdoor patio with a beautiful view of the strip.   Seeing that I've been here countless times... I've had the privilege of trying so many delicious dishes! Things I recommend:  Chicken Parmesan Veal Parmesan Carbanera Veal Pork Chops Any pasta with Bolognese sauce Shrimp scampi Mushroom ravioli  Now, this restaurant is not cheap. However, the portions are huge and they shower you with a lot of food - so you really get your moneys worth. When you sit down, before you even get a menu... They give you a fresh chunk of parmesan cheese, sauteed zucchini, fresh garlic bread, fresh bread basket, sliced salami, muscles, and bruschetta.  Did I mention that the bruschetta is out of this world?!  Now, I've never been to Italy (but it is on my bucket list!)... But I have taken people here to eat that of been to Italy. They say this is just as good as any food you will have there.  Do yourself a favor, stop in for the best Italian food you will ever have! I promise you won't regret it :-)

P7hy3GeZ4hXi08k-SS9E_Q.text: Excellent food and service!! Our water was refilled after every sip, and we were constantly attended to to make sure everything was ok. The prices may be high but all the food they bring out before you even see a menu makes it so worth it. I had the chicken Parmesan and my boyfriend had the rigatoni bolognese and both were excellent. I had mentioned it was my 21st birthday to the hostess and at the end of our meal, our server brought out a candle and flourless chocolate cake which was absolutely impeccable and delicious!!! Would definitely recommend coming here!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C0zT6CKzWoEypo9sR36Lpw.text: Wow. What a meal. Really great. Loved the fact that they served you bread, cheese, and wonderful antipasto before they bring the menus! Great service (everyone in white tie). Food was delicious. Lived up to the other yelp reviews. $400 for 6, but worth it (esp. Since I didn't pay ... Thanks mom!)

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their social media coordinator? Great guy!
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dining room.

LMAr2zvEmbbWD8vTPs6hiA.text: Took my wife for her birthday dinner. Service was very good... almost too good, we felt like they were trying to rush us and turn our table. Burrata appetizer was outstanding.  My wife had chicken piccata and I had veal Milanese. Both were very good, but not exceptional. We got 1/2 orders of spaghetti bolognese and bucatini amatriciana , my wife loved the amatriciana. Our drinks were excellent, the Mulino Manhattan was terrific and my wife's Old Fashioned was excellent. Cannoli for dessert was excellent. They also sang happy birthday to my wife and gave her a complimentary dessert, which was very nice. The complimentary grappa at the end was also a nice touch. Overall a very nice meal, but a questionable value for the price.

nEIuGiiZG0r9pq1xAEJIaQ.text: Great service and great food! I don't know why this place is not popping during lunch time.  We came in on a Saturday during lunch time and the place was empty.  They first serve you with a hunk of cheese straight from the cheese wheel.  Then they give you salami, spicy zucchini, and bruschetta.  Our server i believe his name is Daniel, was great!  The way that he explained the specials drew a picture in my mind. I didn't even need the menu when he was finished.   Tried the classic caprese , excellent.  The porcini raviolli was great in the truffle sauce.  Loved the veal chop on the bone so so so good.  When I'm in Vegas I'm definitely coming back!

1VPW3zLGhoBsGG9Ow1GmgA.text: What a difference a few hours makes. We have previously eaten dinner here and loved it. So, the last Vegas trip we decided to try lunch and made a reservation for noon. We walked in at noon after they opened the doors, girl working the front barely acknowledged we were there. Going to the table we noticed how dirty the carpet was, at dinner the lights are lower. The waiter did not seem happy to be there, big difference from the guy we had before. The food was excellent as before but there is no lunch menu, the portions are the same size and price as dinner options. It was no wonder that the place was empty for the 90 minutes we were there, only one other couple. We will go back but not for another $150 lunch.

3jGhwLdbwB12r0Bd3s2vRA.text: We have come here for the past 6 years. It is a MUST GO for us every time we are in Vegas. We have brought several people there and even locals that didnt know ot was tucked away in. The shops at Cesars.   Consistently great food and service. You will never leave hungry. We have ordered a variety of items and have never had a mediocre meal. This time we made room for dessert and had the chocolate covered icecream....DIVINE! Best dessert I have had in a very long time. See you next time.

yj8Bj6_uR9nZ_NVMOGIWdQ.text: If I could give more stars I would... Hands down an amazing dining experience.  It WILL exceed every expectation you have of fine dining.   As you sit down you are presented a myriad of menu choices, all handmade pastas and again, it's an amazing dining experience.   The antipastos and cheese selection and drinks and food all to die for.   When you go, go with an appetite and be prepared to be rolled out of there.

qW_qK45k2X5jOz835rrp2w.text: Not at all what I expected for the money. They have ambiance but servers were stretched and literally running through the restaurant. The food had zero taste. NOT WORTH THE MONEY.

76x_aO7_bXa3OK_-ctcOtw.text: This was a magnificent meal... Also the fanciest meal I've ever eaten. Come with an empty belly because the amount of food you are served is huge. The chef even sends out multiple small plates before you even order- all complimentary. (Sauteed zucchini, a block of fresh Parmesan, salami slices, bruschetta). We ordered the chicken parm, which was literally the diameter of my Plate, manicotti, and fresh gnocci with pesto. Absolutely the best Italian meal we've ever eaten. We finished off the meal-somehow- with a fresh piece of New York style Cheesecake which melted in our mouths. It was THAT good. Finally we were served a complimentary small glass of homemade grappa with a good luck raisin in it. Come dressed to impress and leave the flip flops and athletic wear at the hotel for the evening. Also be sure to make a reservation ahead of time. You will not regret this meal. It was fabulous!!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York style cheesecake at Il Mulino. Yum!

ZqqcUT0Vf8qSm2FifIMqPA.text: When we walked in to a nearly empty restaurant on a Tuesday evening (7:00) we were told we "obviously don't have a reservation" while this delightful host surveyed our attire. HA! should have turned back then.  Free starters are good but actual entrees are horrible!!! definitely nowhere near the quality of the NY location.  I ordered a "special" aka old ingredients they want to be rid of as soon as possible. "Maine" lobster. So chewy and hard I could not even cut the lobster with my knife. not to mention it had NO FLAVOR, just awful dish. when we got the bill, this entree ended up being $90 too!!!   My boyfriend ordered the fruit de la mer (the ocean) a seafood medley pasta dish. scallops and shrimp were old and hard and fishy. there was also no sauce. just a clam water at the bottom of soggy noodles.  Treated like shit and was stared down the whole time by the host.  wtf. either the chef is awful or they hated us. weirdest attitudes from waitstaff.   should have sent the food back but didn't want to make the bad time even worse. felt violated walking out of there. and now we are sick to our stomachs from the old seafood. you would be better off going to Olive Garden.

PaOWfxSjbVGbUtfSmh4I1g.text: great place and great service would highly recommend, located in Ceasars

cI-jfnXIh-i2r8oYWh2C2A.text: Fantastic dinning experience!  Excellent service!  A little hard to find but well worth it once you do!!!!  Try the veal!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster was very, very good....
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The veal was amazing!

JDDTHNc1iPVkmsfjfzkriA.text: Could be the best restaurant that I have ever eaten at. Bali, our captain, was awesome and suggested a great variety of items for the dinner. They start you off with a big piece of parmesan cheese and good bread assortment. Caesar salad was great. We had the stratechetella soup - it was good but too much egg for me. The chicken parmesan was amazing and so was the dessert we had. Service was impeccable. Check this place out if your looking for good Italian food in Vegas.

bUVInlSUjjpHhhmEEOVJcQ.text: What an awesome experience! I don't remember it being like this for the one located in Orlando since it took me a while to realize I've been to. Love how the service starts with fresh cheese and some zucchini. Then the menu comes. . .orders come family style. Well we order several dishes and they split them for all of us. Food was great but the starters were memorable. Its makes you relax and take your time. At the end of the meal they bring a huge barrel (it seems) to give you a glass of a traditional after meal drink. I would like to say it was lemoncello? It was so strong I couldn't drink too much of it.  Great experience and worth the price.

jWidW50OgJrSaOPyprJJ0g.text: The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because I liked the mascato... The staff was too uptight and the room is far too small. The food was mediocre and the waiter aka captain had as much sense of humor as the overcooked veal ... Save your money and go to the cheesecake factory :)

JISdMluzIAyq0F1BJlgB6Q.text: We went to Il Mulino in Las Vegas because it was recommended by the concierge desk in the shopping mall.  Staff were very friendly and the big cheese they served us was really good.    But we had to waited long time for our pastas... when we finally received our food, we were all dissapointed.  Carbonara was extremely salty, clam pasta (Vongle) was bland, and Risotto was just not good at all.  Only thing that was good was Lobster Ravioli.  I am not recommending this restaurant to anyone.

It7nbEmFr4ZscWwlJi3lkg.text: Michael M. is totally right about his review.   This is the BEST Italian restaurant ever!  My friends and I spent about 60 box each but it was totally worth it. You will never regret about hitting this place.

o0wyzwz9pRPjX1gn-KcYdg.text: After a good run on the craps tables we thought we'd splurge on a good meal.  Unfortunately, this place was a real disappointment.  While it had a nice atmosphere and great service, the food was very mediocre and very expensive.  I would rate it a few notches above diner food, for about  1000 times the price.  If you're going to be in Vegas, you can do better.

rdA_uYp1pR5bVv78-GJ5Tw.text: Amazing food. Service was good overall but a little on the snooty side (too stiff and robotic). Very expensive food and alcohol!! Then they expect a tip for the "captain" on the bill in addition to the gratuity for your server... All the captain did was come over and tell us the specials.

PKwEBshxnJxpt9aVNb7evg.text: Very good Italian choice in Las Vegas.  The best items on the menu are the appetizers and the daily specials.  Menu entrees are good, but generally too heavy.  Service is very good, and they probably have one of the best sommeliers in town.  Location is not my favorite; it is essentially in a shopping mall.   As good as it is, the Las Vegas restaurant is about 1 star less in overall quality than the NYC home restaurant.

ohdA77IKFsu-p2sjJZc6jQ.text: Loved everything about this restaurant.  The ambiance, food, and service were all excellent. Our wine and water glasses were never empty and the food, even things that I don't love like mushrooms were incredibly flavorful. The restaurant was packed but we were treated like we were the only diners there. We will be returning anytime we are in a city where they are located.

iLsWiox65mZGcl2u2kjKVg.text: We dined a Il Mulino last week.  It was so disappointing.  We have been there  before and they always serve the same appetizers gratis.  But this time, the garlic toast was so soggy and oily. They must have made them way ahead of time to be that bad.  The zucchini was also soggy and oily. Yuk.  We ordered the eggplant rollatini stuffed with seafood.  You had to hunt for the seafood and it was terribly heavily sauced.  We then ordered the ravioli with truffles.  No truffles to be seen, just a heavy cream truffle "tasting sauce"  We think they just used truffle oil.  That dish was $50.  A ripoff. Then we ordered the rack of lamb.  It was very tough and the mustardy gravy did not help, as it was also dumped onto the very uninteresting potatoes.  Our waiter, however, was so very nice and accomodating. Not his fault.  The captain sent us a dessert to make up for the bad food.  The dessert was delicious and the best thing we ate.  We will not go back as it was a very expensive dinner for not so good food.

9vhOE0h7niAhBjjkpcrx5Q.text: It was a toss up between checking out Batali/Bastianich's B&B Ristorante at Palazzo and Il Molino at Forum Shops.  We chose Il Molino because we were turned off by B&B's menu of offal such as sweetbreads and lamb's brain.  There is no way my husband will eat oxtail, rabbit, wild boar, or duck liver.  Too authentic for us, I guess. But Il Molino ended up being a great choice.  The romantic classic dining room was warm and inviting.  When we were seated, tuxedo-clad waiters (more than one) promptly arrived to set down napkins and menus and carved chunks of aged parmesan from a giant wedge for all of us.  Additional starters included thinly sliced fried zucchini, sliced salame, beautiful rustic bread, outstanding bruschetta, and mussels - we didn't order any of these things.  It just came.  Our waiter spouted off a long list of specials and even brought a tray of langostines to the table to show that they were part of the specials.    We ordered veal rollatini with prosciutto and mozzarella, pappardelle bolognese, angel hair with tomato and garlic, lamb osso bucco with saffron risotto, chicken picatta, and fettucine alfredo.  Of course, we were all full from the appetizers by the time the giant-sized entrees arrived.  All of our dishes were very good but not outstanding or incredibly memorable.  The cuisine is classic Italian, so the menu, although it has terrific variety, isn't incredibly inventive.  However, seeing familiar dishes makes the food very accessible.  We ended with a dessert sampler which included pieces of tiramisu, molten chocolate cake, zabaglione with berries, and ricotta cheesecake.  Again, everything was great. In my opinion, what you pay for at Il Mulino is the stellar service.  Not sure if any cappellini pomodori or fettucine alfredo worth $26.

YdsHCoyL12xfZKoclEl1PQ.text: Went here in early 2008.    Service: Very condescending, made us feel uncomfortable throughout the dinner.  I think he was upset we did not order wine or appetizers.  Busboy was very nice though  Food: "free" appetizers were excellent. Dry cheese and a zucchini dish.  Main courses were not enjoyable at all...Shrimp al diablo and Canneloni. Portions were very large though..if only they tasted good :(   Price: Extremely overpriced  On our first trip to Vegas, this was our one really nice meal.  The place was recommended by a group of guys on our flight in who told us they went to Vegas once a year for the past 7 years.  We were extremely disappointed and felt robbed.  Perhaps it was our meal choices....  Would only go again if meal was free.

gD1QnCpDjUTGr59380RlNA.text: We went there and I told the waiter I am Vegan. The waiter gave me a decondecending dirty look, and tries to make fun of me. He "Craig" mentioned that those recepies were from 1930's so I ask if those two chefs still alive, so I could ask for a Vegan dish as a skilful chief would do it easily. He did not have an answer for that. I just find insulting when those "fine" restaurant do not train well their stuff! Respect should be in the list!

km40eoQl2eo5xnU2HhMVhQ.text: Yum although not perfect this time -- appetizer was cold (wasn't supposed to ) and ordered risotto was only a so-so.

SFZUSNPRkYLFgQXubZOzig.text: Not as wonderful as the New York Il Mulino. Food was good, not great. Far, far too expensive. Four guys; about $110 per guy. Menu is hard to read: prices are in that curly font where 5s suspiciously can be mistaken for 3s! ("My entree is $54 dollars! Damn! I thought it  was $34!) Service was also good, not great. (I love hispanic waiters pretending to be Italian...but then, who doesn't?)  Had to ask for menus three times. The decor is very nice: low-light, warm colors, dark wood. Did I mention that this restaurant is far too expensive?  There are better Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. One that comes to mind rhymes with Schmalintino...also expensive, but almost worth it.

brDYNcPkXHTAHE2eJIPJMA.text: Had an amazing dinner... the service is great!  Had the fillet and couldn't go wrong with the Shrimp with pasta. Like the reviews said... the appetizers beforehand can be a little much. Plan on being really hungry when you arrive. You won't go home hungry.

uCTQP-N7bd_iF_F1dz3iWg.text: ur group was in the mood for Italian. Checked the reviews and thought we'd give it a try. One of the best food decisions of the trip! Dined early. Service was attentive but not hovering - excellent balance. Great suggestions from captain and waiters. Complementary appetizers were excellent. Resist the temptation to fill up on these! Meals went through final stage of preparation near table, fun to watch. No feeling of being rushed although the room was jumping. Wish we had time for dessert, but had to head to a show. Can't wait to go back!

pfQ1RcD_MdO7xd87fmcjwg.text: Alright, so I'm going to be completely honest here and say I worked here from 2008-2009 so I know the idiosyncrasy of this restaurant. I was a hostess and a bartender, and I really need to address a comment a reviewer made.  Seating: Just because you make a reservation on Open Table does not mean you are going to get an amazing table. Let me give you the gist of fine dining restaurants and table preferences, Il Mulino has a lot of very wealthy regular clientele that like to sit at certain tables just like most fine dining restaurants do. Just because a table is open currently, does not mean that it will be in 30 minutes or an hour. The average dining time at that restaurant is an hour and a half for a table of 2. Therefore, you can't get seated at a table you want if it has already been requested by another customer, especially if that customer was a regular. A reservation is a guaranteed seat in the restaurant, all table requests are as such, they are requests that can or cannot be accommodated at the maitre'd's discretion.  Anyhow, I haven't worked nor been to this restaurant in over  a year. I ended up walking in on Saturday evening with my date after our little adventures at the Bellagio and we had dinner here. To describe the restaurant a little, it's a gothic, romantic atmosphere with black iron chandeliers, plush red velvet curtains and dim lights. We got seated and enjoyed the sunset menu which was an an appetizer, 2 entrees, and a dessert. Upon sitting down we received the chilled sauteed zucchini which hasn't gotten any better since I worked there. It's drenched in oil and honestly just not that appealing. We also received some bruschetta and mussels, salami, a chunk of the huge (and my favorite) wheel of Parmesan cheese with a bread basket. All of that is complimentary before we even got our appetizer. I just had our captain order for us and he did an excellent job except for the appetizer, which was polenta and sausage. It was bland and salty. Our starting entree was a sampler of the mushroom ravioli which I died for. It's a porchini stuffed mushroom ravioli in a champagne black truffle cream sauce, yes it sounds amazing and it WAS. I so missed that. Following that, we had the main entree which was steak pizziola, sauteed spinach, and some amazing shrimp. I wish I remembered what they were called. They didn't have them when I worked there. We were so full but we still had to have the dessert which was PHENOMENAL. We had the tiramisu and finished off with some cappucinos. Oh no, just when you think it's over they brought over lemoncello and grappa. By the time we left, I felt like lying down and passing out. Everything I received in the restaurant was just the same as any other reservation regardless of me being a past employee, except for the double helping of free alcohol which is usually lemoncello or grappa and we got both. Honestly, i've dined at a  lot of restaurants and the customer service continues to be excellent and above par with a lot of other restaurants i've dined at. You might assume I'm just bias, but I think you can tell from my other reviews i'm a pretty honest person. Anyhow, if anyone wants amazing romantic Italian on the strip, this is your place.  P.S. I lived in NYC and both of the managers did as well. No the location is not the original in NYC, it's bigger and has more seating but most of the patrons said that it was comparable to the location in NYC :) So take that as you will, from New Yorkers.

gxwrSZHjPLn5p-PFz6JQog.text: The best dinner and service I have had ever!  Great ambience!  You must go and experience Italy!!!

uZOYJjK-d8NMZnGNHG1Vhw.text: Come starving...they automatically bring house appetizers before you order your drinks and the food is beyond filling. Romantic but great for a group of friends/family to share a amazing Italian dinner. The following are a must order as they all melt in your mouth: caprese salad, red snapper. We also had rack of lamb but I was too full from all the appetizers...it was more filling than a buffet. Pair all courses with wine as suggested and you will come out a fan!

N-X1rzIUFsudH8M2enu4sg.text: This is place is incredible. This is the best Italian meal I've ever had -- beating everything I had in Italy as well.  DECOR, SERVICE, and FOOD are all top notch.  Highly recommended.

03l-xz1DpfjTkhaZkdvAng.text: My husband and I were eager to try Il mulino, unfortunately it did not live up to our expectations. We were in italy last summer and were hopeful that this would be True italian cuisine, but instead we got americanized mediocre italian food. We sat down and were greated with garlic bread and Parmesan cheese that was broken off of a large block of cheese. They then brought fried zucchini and another type of bread basket. Everything was overly drenched in olive oil. We ordered 1 glass of wine each which was very flavorful. For our main course I ordered chicken Parmesan which looked more like a flat pizza smothered with an excess amount of cheese. It lacked flavor and texture and the chicken was pounded so flat that it had no taste. My husband had the veal Parmesan that looked identical to my mess on the plate. It looked more like 2 frisbee's on our plates then meat. The food quality picked up with dessert. I had the tiramisu which was delicious and my husband had peanut butter ice cream coated in a hard chocolate shell, it was fabulous. We also had  cappuccino which was very tasty. We have traveled all over the world and have had some wonderful meals, but this does not make the list. The price did not justify the quality. For 2 people the bill was over $300.00 with tax and tip. If you want an outstanding, unforgettable meal in Las Vegas go to Gordon Ramsey steakhouse at Paris hotel or Otto ( italian food just like venice italy) In the palazzo by the canal.

RaCngsfaL_SBKnfVcx9pSA.text: Much has been said, but I have a particular recommendation if you're inclined towards seafood. The Dover sole is not to be missed. You'll thank me later.

r9nmiptaCeXBCayfZoB4Rg.text: With every visit to Vegas, there is a visit to Il Mulino.  This is my favorite Italian restaurant of all time.  Italian food is my favorite.  This is more than great food.  It is truly a dining experience.  Table 54 is my favorite spot in the dining room as you get a panoramic view of the entire restaurant.  There isn't even a need to order appetizers because they serve so many little appetizers, all included with your meal.  Amazing cheese, bread, etc.  Fantastic wine list and very knowledgable bartenders.  Everything I have had from here is amazing.  I always get a pasta dish with bolognese and it is consistently amazing.   I make it a point to try everything else that those I am with get.  Haven't ever been disappointed.  I wish there was and Il Mulino in L.A.!  Highly recommend Il Mulino @ the Forum Shops in Vegas.

BY_StfupUjaA1762Gl04ZQ.text: I was treated like a Princess. The waiters were very respectful, and mini bowed when I walked by to use the restroom. The food was spectacular! Great unique flavorful options. Definitely a 5-star dining experience! Next time I am in town, I will definitely stop in!

v-9zzha9QiA31rQsr8-e-g.text: Hard to find at Forum Shops but well worth it! Second time there and was just fabulous. The food, wine and staff are all 5 star. We even arranged for an outside cake delivery and all went off without a hitch. If you like Italian food bring your appetite (HUGE PORTION). They will assist you with choosing a fantastic Italian wine to accompany your meal.  I will be back....

OXEUwU66a7dT5RGR5CK8Ww.text: Thanks to Yelp, we were able to go NUTS at this restaurant without worry.  Reading about the crazy bottled-water charges, we simply avoided bottled water (duh... :) and went on to have one of the best meals of our lives!!   And thanks to the truly delicious food, I'm not even taking off a point for a few of the staffers who were a little on the bitchy side (many men wait on and service your table throughout the meal, it's those cocky, little pretty-boy ones who are a little much -- or, shall i say, a little lacking in their servicing skills).  Our actual waiter, however -- Fabio [ciao bello!!] -- was a consummate pro (making up for those bitchy weasels, luckily)....and was certain to look in on us throughout the evening -- a True charmer!  DO watch out though -- this food is soooooo delicious you may find that you overdo, so don't be afraid to split dishes.  WIth all the extras they bring for you, splitting will help not only with the bill (which will be high, but well worth it),  but with the ability to walk [vs. roll] out of the restaurant.  We'll definitely do a split-fest for next time (so that we can actually go OUT after dinner -- i mean, this IS vegas [baby]:).........we'll DEFINITELY be back !!!

mzuCe7znhQBtno9Cf3m6vw.text: This was my first visit here and well, what a nice experience! we showed up rather early and they were still able to seat us even though the place appeared to be rather busy.   They start by serving you a huge chunk of Parmesan cheese. They also bring out a few small apps. We then had the escargot and the gnocchi with diablo sauce. Both were great.   No one in out party of 4 was particularly hungry so we only ordered two entrees. They halved the portions and plated them for all four of us.   The food was good but the service was impeccable and that's really what the 5 stars were for. We'll be back!

COK0It2ME4nSHWBRdv9RtQ.text: The best thing about Il Mulino was the anticipation.   The reality of Il Bumino is that it's excessive, for no other reason than to be over-the-top in price alone. I really don't mind paying more, much more, for all the right reasons that include simple desires like high-quality food and a great wine list. However, Isle Mul-I-tink-NO's wine is way way over priced and their food is just good (not great).  Don't be fooled fellow Yelpers. If you have a ton of cash burning a hole you in your pocket, and you're not spending it at all the Craps table, then I suggest you go somewhere else to eat, where you'll get something more then a premonition to look forward to....

0wSR6S1Q_AqPH1wko_ZZzg.text: I love this restaurant. From the beautiful interior to the outstanding service top to bottom, to truly excellent food, it is an experience that can't be beat. Much already has been written about the voluminous and wonderful antipasto you get even before you are handed a menu. Yum. Everything was wonderful, though, including the best Dover Sole Meuniere I've ever had, roasted whole, shown at the table, then filleted perfectly, not a bone. Damn was that good. But, again, it was all so good! Wonderful roast potatoes, some of the best spinach I've ever had (sauteed with garlic), my friend had a divine salmon with what we all thought were some of the best mushrooms we've ever had... I could go on and on! I will also note, though. the beautiful simplicity of the lemon sorbet, frozen in a whole lemon: divine. And the best Affogato I'ver ever been served. All of the service was splendid. Our captain, Bali Kovary, was the best I've ever had. He is supreme. Give this place a try, ask for Bali, sit back and let them do their work. You will enjoy a long, wonderful meal.

Ml7_U8c30RzZZ59SvMk7fw.text: I've not been to Il Mulino in New York and I'm not going to respond to those purests that will (accurately, perhaps) point out that the Vegas-Version is a distant reflection of the original.  It's hardly relevant because if one is in Vegas and looking at eating here they want to know what it's like HERE, not New York.  Right?  I wasn't buying.  My largest supplier was.  And it's a good thing, as it was in the upper stratosphere of prices for all restaurants.  But whoa!  They start bringing you things to munch on before you even order anything.  No, not the requisite breads.  But instead, fresh cheeses, prosciutta, and I can't remember what else.  Between the waiters and the captain of the table (another person that needs a tip, by the way) the service was outrageous!  Wow!  I had the rack of lamb.  I devoured my yummy sheep, picking wool out of the teeth (joking) with a big smile on my face (not joking).  The experience was one that everyone should have once.  Make sure your credit score is in good shape before you go, though.

Mh_jH6JW8orQQYuwugs_EA.text: Our friends who live in Vegas wanted to take us to this upscale Italian restaurant, which they had experienced a few months earlier. When we arrived, we were impressed with the white tablecloths, the atmosphere, and the serving staff.   As soon as we sat down we were offered a chunk of cheese off the biggest wheel of parmesan I've ever seen.  It was very tasty and a nice touch to begin your meal.  After about five minutes, the server brought over bruscheta for each of us, but I found it overwhelmed with garlic, which took away from the tomato and basil tastes normally associated with this appetizer.  At this point, we hadn't even ordered our meals yet. Our friend wanted a wine that he had tasted on his previous visit, but it was no longer on their wine list. That was no problem, and the sommelier immediately turned up with exactly the wine we wanted. We were impressed!  Unfortunately that's where the great experience stopped. We each ordered something different and were surprised that everything was ala carte. I ordered chicken parmigiana and got one plate with a huge chicken breast covered in marinara. The parmesan cheese was sparse. White it tasted satisfactory, I was surprised that an Italian restaurant would serve any kind of parmigana without pasta to accompany it. To be honest, I can't even remember what everyone else ordered because all of our meals were pretty unmemorable. We were quite disappointed to have paid so much for so little.  This place is definitely classy, but for the price, I'd say you can find something much better somewhere else on the Strip.

aw2N_cvMmEmqHwNdAKe0dA.text: I love this place. I have been every time I have been to Vegas. Service is slow, but tasty, tasty, tasty food.

wkEFapwY1SD0KIhm80Eg8g.text: I yelp'd this restaurant before we actually went to see what to expect.  GREAT reviews.  The minute we sat down The big hunk of Parmesan was sitting on the table and the captain started cutting pieces off for us.  Then the flood of food started pouring onto our tables.  It was awesome.  The fried zucchini, bruschetta + mussel.  Good nibbles before the real deal came.    The captain came over introduced himself and proceeded to give us the specials.  We all joked that we needed subtitles because he had a thick Italian accent and we had no clue what majority of the specials were.  We caught seabass, ravioli and veal hahaha.  It was a good time.    I ordered  the beef carpaccio for my appy:  Thinly sliced tuscan style beef served with arugula, olive oil and lemon.   After passing it around to everyone at the table for a taste, I had one bite left....it was a delicious last bite.    For my entree I had the mushroom ravioli. OMG DELICIOUS! I was so full by the time my entree came, but I forced fed myself because it was so good.  I also tried a bite of everyone else's to add to that. *ugh*  but it was all worth it.  On the table we had Ossobuco "the manly dish" lol (my friend Princess ordered this and the waiter looked at her wide-eyed and said wow, that's a manly dish) lol.  Lobster Ravioli, Sea bass, Lasagna, and Veal.  Every last dish was delicious.    Even with all this food we still found room for dessert.  Gelato, Tiramisu, flourless cake, and cheesecake.  HOLY CANOLI they were all good! The Cheesecake was the best cheesecake I've ever had.  The Flourless cake was awesome too.    Overall Food was great, service was great.  O I forgot the grappa was extremely strong, but apparently it's suppose to be like that.  Loved the restaurant, it IS quite pricy, but for me it's well worth the treat once in a while.

u-_mSo-pbwUglUpzhyH8AQ.text: Every time you dine here it like dining at a friends house.  As soon as you sit down they bring Parmesan, salami, zucchini, brushetta and two baskets of fantastic bread.  Cesar salad is made to order and it has a great dressing.  I've had the veal Parmesan, which is a giant portion of tender veal topped with marina and cheese. It was amazing. Also tasted the special, which was lobster ravioli. Which was fantastic.  Great service.  A little expensive, but as the saying goes, you get what you pay for.

5zGq-7rVUapUJ87QhwJ8GQ.text: I always visit this place when I'm in Vegas.  On top of Caesar's, the staff and countless variety of tasty and delicious dishes makes this a MUST check in!  The lobster ravioli (seafood/pasta) always seals the deal.  Highly recommend!

pBW7np3lK6FHMFwcUr6OSQ.text: Great italian restaurant. Was def. a highlight of my last trip to Vegas. The service was impeccable. Our waiter was great. He knew all the dishes and specials perfectly and our water, bread, was never empty. Had the caprese special and some eggplant/crab dish to start. Both were phenomenal. The mozzarella was soo fresh in the caprese. For main course, ordered the lobster ravioli and mushroom ravioli w/ truffle oil specials. Both were spectacular. I was so full I couldn't really appreciate my meal as much as I would have liked. Do not eat the bread! You'll regret it when your pasta comes. If you're looking for a great Italian meal in vegas, would highly recommend this place.

IF0px98gTzJnA3V-6D0GdQ.text: Oh my goodness oh my dayuuuum. This place is delicious. There free appetizers are better than most places entrees. A must eat place when in vegas or new york. Lobster ravioli was amazing.

kMpOos0hFavGTbZIcWj2pg.text: This could be one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever eaten at. I went there with a group of nine people.  The service was incredible as was the food.  It truly is a dining and culinary experience.  While Il Mulino is not a family style restaurant, everything was so good and unique that we turned it into one. We were sharing Grana Padano (cheese), bruschetta, garlic breads, country bread, focaccia, chicken Parmesan, veal, ravioli, shrimp fish and more.   A bit on the pricey side, but well worth the experience!

23y1OFdxsf1DWL_ZfRCFaA.text: For upscale Italian, you would be hard pressed to beat Il Mulino in Las Vegas.  The mother ship is located in NYC. The original is rather small and difficult to get a reservation. i always enjoyed the food there but never liked the cramped quarters and snooty attitude.  Basically, this is a clone foodwise of the NYC location but with all the things I didn't like about the NYC location improved upon. The food at the Las Vegas location is on a par with the NYC location but the attitude is gone.  Also, the restaurant is spacious.    Before you even have a chance to look at the menu, you are served large chunks of parmigianna cheese, chili soaked zucchini slices, various breads and other treats.  The menu selection is generally traditional and extensive.  Everything is well prepared and generously portioned.  My major complaint is that their wine list is a joke. The mark-ups are so high it is insulting.   If this was not typical for all the top end restaurants on the strip, I would have taken off a star for this alone.

30ng6U3PW1wT9XTabbTq3w.text: Good food and service.  Food didn't wow but it's worth the visit, especially if you are shopping.  Plan to spend $130-$150 per couple.

7H7gkYAkCpcyGJtSxe5yGA.text: Should be spelled "ILL" Mulino.  What have you done?  This was a tremendous disappointment!  Il Mulino in NYC is in my top 5 favorite places in the world.  This Vegas impostor had 1 thing in common with it's NYC location.  Very high prices.  I should have known when I was able to get a last minute reservation for 6 on a Sat night.  The food was probably better then average but I held them to a higher standard.  Do not think this is what the downtown NY restaurant is like.  I would call this brand dilution and I hope they are making plenty of money because they sold their soul to do it.  Go to Rao's instead.  Also not as good as the original but a better representitive the "ILL" Mulino's

5JdM27W3HEHHtWig853Kyw.text: I've eaten here once before and I thought it was alright but quite over priced, does not compare to the one in NYC.  I was on the strip today and decided to check it out for lunch today, did not make it past the front door. The host must either totally hate his job or simply be one of the dumbest people ever. Was super unhelpful, when asked about the pre theatre menu was told it was available in the evening... when I asked for more details he said it was available whenever at some point in the evenings.   He could not have been any less helpful or less welcoming. I will not be returning.

L9wLb4s0VBL4ONhORUVtew.text: I cannot fault this restaurant. My husband and I visited last night to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The service runs like a finely oiled machine. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The complimentary appetizers including fried zucchini were delicious. We shared an appetizer of mushroom ravioli which was amazing although very rich. My husband loved his filet which he said looked so beautiful he didn't want to cut it. My dover sole was the biggest I've ever seen and was tender and sweet. The trio of desserts also did not disappoint; the baked cheesecake is a revelation.

Zz9ju-ysVm3CZX9esmS80w.text: I've been to New York, Miami, and Las Vegas, never had a bad meal, nor disappointed with the service.  If you can afford to go, highly recommend it.

kQbExw2OTKdPwamE5oRyow.text: Incredible dining experience. From the moment we were sat to the dnd of dinner it was simply divine. They bring you a huge chunk of fresh parmesan, some fresh bruschetta and a zucchini mix that are all so filling and delicious. I had the porcini risotto and the portion was huge. The risotto was cooked to perfection and accompanied with a side of pasta with marinara. All of it was fantastic. So...when in Vegas make sure to come here you will be glad you did!

CkNg9SFm7GQuLrW7N_RSoA.text: The food is strong, but the service and and experience leaves me wanting more. Dining twice at this restaurant cements my sentiments.  The truffle mushroom ravioli is very good, and it is described as as "special" found on the menu. Both times, the waiter listed it as a "special", which leads me to my major problem with how management is running this restaurant. The waiter introduces him, and then begins listing off a thousand different entrees and dishes as "specials" not found on the menu. By the beard of Zeus, I can't recall this many items when deciding on dinner. Do the customer a service and put the items on a menu!!!   Other gripes:  - I inquired about a side of saucy potatoes that are served with the lamb chops. I wished to order these potatoes as a stand alone dish, but I was curtly informed that this was not possible. Dinner was served and the waiter surprisingly presented me a side of these potatoes with a wink of the eye. How nice of him, I thought. Later, the bill is presented and I see that I'm charged $12 for some chopped potatoes. GUY, AN EYE WINK WITHOUT DISCUSSION OF PRICE IMPLIES THE DAMN POTATOES ARE ON THE HOUSE. Poor form, very poor form.

2WcEHHih7wZ5DdvA92N2wQ.text: Went there and Thought it was closed,  looked at the menu no one greeted us, so we stepped inside and got sat down, we got parmesan cheese, good selection of bread and very yummy bread, the FOOD was EXCELLENT and service WAS GREAT TOO, WILL BE GOING BACK AGAIN ASAP

boYGkjUX_P8c-4PTQMV3aw.text: Always a great experience when dining here.  My boyfriend and I had a 5:30 reservation; it was pretty empty at this time and the service was on point.  We were immediately greeted with a huge wheel of Parmesan, among other appetizers.  The fried zucchini is one of my favorites.    My boyfriend ordered the shrimp francese and I got the capellini arrabiata.  Both were delicious!  I received a pretty huge portion of pasta, so I was able to eat it after the nightclub.  I thoroughly enjoyed my leftovers as well.

NtMc67NQYKobCAvRwYyQZg.text: Friggin incredible. The service alone warranted this five star review, but our food was spectacular and the ambience was cozy, classic and romantic. Highly recommend!

AzSFeewSJO4eXkXVHIOGuw.text: Every time we go shopping at Forum Shops, we eat at one of the restaurants there. We've been to almost all of the restaurants at Forum Shops/Caesars Palace. For some odd reason, we didn't try Il Mulino sooner...we've been missing out on a great place. Who doesn't like a good Italian restaurant?  As soon as you get seated, a "mob" goes to your table offering you complimentary grana padano, spicy garlic bread, focacia, bruschetta, salami, sauteed zucchini, mussels and more bread. The garlic bread is oily? Who cares? It's delicious!  They have a lot of specials that aren't on the menu so your "captain" would have to recite the specials to you which could take up to 5 minutes - if you have a short attention span, you might be in trouble. Good thing I came here knowing what I already what I want. They cook their pasta to a perfect al dente.  Tortellini alla Panna: Meat tortellini, black truffle and peas in cream sauce. Excellent tortellini and the cream sauce was perfect and not thick. 5/5  Ravioli: Ravioli filled with mushrooms in champagne and black truffle sauce. The sauce is what makes this dish. It's creamy and truffle...and oh so yummy! I can eat this all day. 5/5  Tartufo: Half chocolate, half vanilla gelato enrobed in chocolate, served with whipped cream and zabaglione. I'm not a fan of whipped cream but zabaglione, I do like. The gelato has bits of cherries. Yum! 5/5  To end our meal, we were given complimentary grappa. It turned into a 2-hr dinner but it was wonderful.  If money is an issue, it can get pricey. It's about $60/person which includes entree, drink and dessert. But if think about it, after all the complimentary stuff we got and a fantastic meal, it was worth it.
