Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli with mushrooms in champagne and black truffle sauce
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

Ozo7y3Uboef4T1aCRAeLPw.text: Best meal to date at my favorite restaurant in the world.  Thanks Greg for the breadsticks and Alisha is amazing!! Thanks for letting me go out to the balcony

2c7sznFCxIeNUXj3iYjjlw.text: What a great time we had a Il Mulino - when you are seated, they bring you a chunk of grana cheese, bruschetta and fried zucchini - wow! And then they ask if you want an appetizer! I started with a refreshing negroni-like drink with proscecco. For dinner, Hubby got the veal osso bucco with risotto, it was just excellent, tender and full of flavor. I opted for the stracciatella soup, which bought back fond childhood memories, and the arugula salad. The soup was good, but very salty and the salad was light and fresh.    This is a very old school restaurant, there was a small army of folks serving, very proper (in a good way!) and the room was classic elegance. It was a Friday night, but there were not many folks in the restaurant, which was too bad. They are located in the new section of the Forum Shops at Caesars. We really recommend Il Mulino - it's worth finding.

MrzgqYGU19IMP7ud0gGHNg.text: amazing service.  Fabulous menu with a great variety.  Our group shared tuna carpaccio, beef carpaccio, seafood stuffed eggplant and black truffle ravioli for appetizers.  Truly exquisite!!!  Our meals carried from prosciutto stuffed veal shank, whole fish, risotto with langostinos, chicken, etc.  We finished our amazing experience with cappuccinos, tiramisu and Grappa! 4 days later our group of 9 is still talking about the fabulous team of servers, attention to detail and fabulous food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YGmefITGMrSADWkbqAN3OQ.text: This restaurant is expensive but never ceases to impress me! The waiters are great and know the menu basically by heart in detail and will like off about 10 specials for you when you sit down. They bring you an array ofcomplimentary appetizers before you even order. If you want to keep your bill down I suggest requesting tap water.   Every dish ive ever ordered here has been plated well and tasted delicious. Its a beautiful upscale restaurant and a romantic candlelit place to take a date for a special night out. If your there at the end of the night the waiter will let you take the rose from the table as well :)   PS. The sea bass is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AaWekScc44GA-DeMqrzcoQ.text: My husband and I came across this restaurant randomly. This is one of the top three restaurants we've been to with service and food quality. We had the langoustine risotto and the Dover Sole. Great find! We will be coming back to try the rest of the menu.

1KrjHpT93qwBP2uaRfVZig.text: Tonight was a complete disappointment.  I have been coming to Il Mulino on each of my visits to Vegas. It has always been top notch. Tonight the food and was just bad and the service, middling at best.   The usually delicious parmesan was not crumbly and deep in taste, but rather soft and bland. The zucchini, a soggy, oil laden mess.  My son ordered the mushroom and truffle ravioli as an appetizer and the sauce was think and bland. So disappointing. His veal chop, which was the special and well cooked, was really just bland.  At $75 for the chop, I would have expected a bit of flavor.   My dinner was sent back. I ordered pappardelle bolognese, which the captain highly recommended and mentioned was the most popular pasta dish. The dish was a bowl full of pink sauce with clump of overcooked broken pasta. There was not a single ribbon of pasta in the bowl. When I mentioned this to the waiter, he was very apologetic and noted that if they are "too rough" with the pasta in the kitchen, all the ribbons get broken. Really?? At the price they charge for pasta, I think it would be fair to have someone check the dish before it is served. They replaced this mess with linguini with clam sauce that was so over salted and spicy it was basically inedible.   Service was somewhat attentive, but there was a stream of different servers all night. I never saw the captain who took our ordered again nor did the same person ever deliver more than one dish.   So sad to see such a great restaurant fall to this level. You have certainly lost a customer. I am sure I am not the first.

_M6s7lBFiElV0CKDHxUn0A.text: Best service ever! Amazing food, complementary apps bread and lemoncello. Great ambience

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IiM7Ui0IKtC8wT_TCBYO1A.text: We came here with a business group and ate in the private room. Great authentic Italian experience! It was just like sitting in my mother in-laws dining room eating a homemade dinner with fine Italian wine.   We started off with the aged Parmesan cheese wedge with olives and prosciutto followed by a few appetizers (sorry can't remember them), and then the main course. My husband and I ate the chicken Parmesan and the truffle raviolis. Both were very good. For dessert the group tried a little bit of everything (choose the tiramisu) and we finished with limoncello and espresso. Overall, the group loved the cheese and the wine the best but still very much enjoyed their dishes.  For anything, go here for the authentic and old world, not rushed experience. Vegas lacks that feel and this place delivers. The wait staff was probably the best I've ever had in Vegas as well.

n2Nq9kzkFEP7_erhfzjbeQ.text: This my worst Italian food experience ever, and Italian food is one of my favorite food. Ciao Il Mulino

Px03vCXnjCf_mddIcwqcig.text: We were referred to this place by a close friend who had eaten here the night before. She gave a great review to us, and we weren't feeling picky so we made a reservation and looked forward to a good meal.   Good meal doesn't come close to the real experience that happened at this establishment. I was blown away by the service, food, and ambiance. We had an incredible meal of the veal, bass, spinach, and peas along with the delicious starters of garlic bread, zucchini, and bruschetta.   I look forward to eating here again as soon as possible!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A delicious experience we will never forget. Cannot wait to go back!

BoAkAaXQ3xxY8X0sX5jzDg.text: This really is a classy, old school-Vegas fine dining experience. The service was fantastic and attentive. We loved the antipasto, which included a hunk of the best Parmesan cheese we had ever tasted, a selection of bread, a zucchini dish, and salami. One person had Caesar salad for an appetizer and another had lentil soup--both loved these dishes. For the main course, we had the sea bass special, the gnocchi with pesto special, and the Capellini all' Arrabbiata. All of the food was wonderful and the staff was great about adjusting dishes for dietary restrictions and preference. The experience was great and not rushed at all, but something was missing for me just a bit. I think that might be due to be fact that there was a semi-limited number of vegetarian options and that Italian food without meat is going to be quite simple. Although we enjoyed our meal, we likely will not return when we chose to splurge on a meal in Vegas. One thing to also be aware of is that there are two separate lines on the bill for the tip--one for the captain's tip and one for the tip for the rest of the staff. That division just threw us off guard.

L6htCiPNeURvqlsTIuPRhQ.text: My wife and I visit Vegas every year and always seek the finest dining experience possible. Mullino was indeed that. She had the truffle ravioli and I had the Gamberi alla Cabanara. It was superb! The service,ambience and food was second to none. We parked in valet, tip only, steps from the escalator and were there in no time. We were quickly greeted professionally, seated at a beautiful table and were treated like royalty. Even the bread was like nothing we've ever had. Daniel was our "captain" and was the epitome of promptness and attention to detail. The portion was pleasing and delicious. We will definitely go to Mulino again!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner at Mulino&#39;s. Superb dining experience!

o-ggGul7gRJEajfqw1eDKQ.text: This use to be such an amazing Restaurant.  They would call to remind you of your reservation. They do not call any more. They use to serve an amazing combination of complementary appetizers.  They no longer serve salami with the cheese, bread and bruschetta.  Greg the waiter said they got it from a local who no longer makes it so they no longer serve salami.  Another waiter said it was cut to bring down costs. A third waiter said he had no idea what happened.  Tension between the waiters and the manager was obvious.  Something was going on which was upsetting the waiters...   we order four different dishes and a couple of appetizers for a party of four.  The speciality appetizer of crab with egg plant use to be amazing with large pieces of crab. This visit it was mostly breading.  One dish was sooooo salty it had to be sent back.  Over all it was ok but not the usual amazing experience.  We worried the restaurant may be closing?  It is a little out of the way but in the past it was worth your time as the food and waiters were outstanding. We went on a Monday night so maybe it was just an off night?  I hope this is the case because many people would miss this restaurant if they closed.

dSgZ5bopyXDRM7pLy20ADw.text: This is where my husband asked me to marry him 3 years ago. The food is great and the waiters are fun!  We started with a few appetizers that were complimentary. I was amused by the big ass block of cheese they put on the table. The cheese and the other complimentary appetizers were really good. I don't remember what I had because I was really drunk at the end of the dinner but I remember I liked it very much. It was some kind of pasta with red sauce.   When my husband popped the question, busted out the ring, and I said yes, a few  waiters (like 5 or 6) came out of the the kitchen and brought a big jar of limoncello. It was complimentary and all of them had a toast with us. That was so freakin cool! What's even more awesome is that every time a waiter passed by our table, they would have a shot of limoncello with us. It was surely a fun memorable night!

F-NTjDQplvecvvvoXSuCCg.text: Best restaurant meal I've had all year.  A very special place.  The second you sit down, they bring you fresh cut Parmesan cheese, crazy delicious grilled very thin focaccia bread, garlic bread, bruschetta, and grilled zuccini.  All were amazing.  We had the pre-theater special, a great deal.  It included three courses (we had Caesar salads, grilled salmon + pappardelle and the dessert plate -- all extraordinary) and grappa at the end.  The service was impeccable in every possible way.  We decided that we would go back to Las Vegas JUST FOR THS RESTAURANT.  It's that good.

iRP0x2MelxfFF76oGxxlvw.text: One of the best meal experiences I have ever had. Starting with the delicious amuse's you receive at the beginning (the olive oil soaked zucchini is simply one of my favorite flavors of all time- always trying to recreate it!), to the way they course out and present the dishes if you are doing a family style shared meal, to the complimentary limoncello post-meal and the superb service... I just love this place. Italian food tends to be weirdly expensive anyway for the most part, so why not take it up a notch. Il Mulino never disappoints and even as a local Las Vegan, I'll always return for special nights out.

mYS4rOYs1G7iy_OoVA8uXg.text: Way overrated for me, sorry.  The gratis appetizers and Limoncello at the end were nice touches, and the extensive all-Italian wine list was a nice surprise.  The Caprese  salad was very deluxe but the Mozzarella was meh and the pasta Bolognese was even more so,  if that's possible.  Service was a notch above average, but I've had better.   Was hoping for much more.

vZg8peBM8XzH8dDccuTY3Q.text: I scanned the reviews before our visit (of course). If you are like me you'll notice there are a lot of five star reviews for this eatery... and a smattering of somewhat scathing reviews.  After experiencing Il Mulino for myself  - I  re scanned the reviews for my own edification - to better understand what the two-star-and-below crowd could have possibly been pissed about this place.   After reading their complaints, I happened to notice the percentage of "bad" reviews in the mix roughly mirrors the average percentage of those among us in society who are, sadly, diagnosed as having a mental illness.  So if I were you, listen to the glass half full gang on this one.   I could go on and on about why I believe this place deserves high acclaim.   Service was impeccable...they held our table for us during prime time on a Saturday night cheerfully while we tracked down a drunken poker renegade in our party. Then it was game on - It was flight of the server bumblebees the whole meal. Never waiting, never lacking. Yet we weren't smothered. Il mulino, you are the perfect girlfriend.   The ambiance was elegant and intimate without being pretentious. The food...well... You can't go wrong. From apps to the ridiculous tiramisu - made and served to you with a commitment to food excellence.  We will be back.

AAfEA57-FlcUtT2DhEAbNw.text: I went to Il Mulino on Veteran's Day, which is also my Birthday. Things started out pretty rough. I went by the restaurant for a recon two days prior to see if it lived up to its reputation for atmosphere and decor (it did). I also took this opportunity to ask one of the waiters questions that I did not want to ask at the table in front of my guests, which was beneficial. But when I told the girl I wanted a reservation for 4 on Veteran's Day, she said she didn't know when Veteran's Day was. To say I was not pleased is an understatement; I went from 0 to 60 in about 2 seconds. But my wife hit me and told me not to make a scene and make the reservation. I am glad she hit me and I'm glad I made the reservation.  The meal was one of the best I have ever had. Service was impeccable, staff was friendly and the Captain made us feel at home. We ordered some of the specials and some off the menu. It should be noted that Mulino's has what I assume is a pretty set group of specials they offer every night, which are not on the menu. They don't tell you the prices unless you ask, which can be embarrassing. All are a little pricy, but not out of line.   We had an eggplant and crab dish for appetizer along with some buffalo cheese, Italian meat and tomatoes. Both were delicious. The two ladies each had a fish dish, one was a fish cooked in rock salt, the other I forget. The men both had meat. My friend a steak (that you could cut with a fork) and I had a chicken dish. All were delicious. They gave me a special dessert for free because of my birthday.  One of the most impressive things about the restaurant - or at least  about our Service Captain (Raul') ,- is that he stopped us from ordering too much food. He could have easily made another $125.00 had he said nothing and just let us order. But it would have been WAY too much food. And he told us that. He even recommended we split the side dishes.  One thing to be careful of.....Italians have an after dinner aperitif that they will tell you "cleanses you digestive system."  Well, it cleanses a LOT more than that. Baby, that is one STRONG DRINK. I had one made out of pears; I mean after all, how strong could something made out of pears be??? I forget what everyone else had. Then Raul' insisted I have some Italian brandy (or something) he brought around in a copper tub. He called in "Italian Moonshine" and that it was "special" and was free to me because of Veteran's Day.  DEAR GOD!!! I could barely find the door!!!  A wonderful night. Great food made even better by a great staff.  NOTE: The bill comes with two places to leave a tip, which I had never seen before. One place is for the "Captain" and the other is for "Service." They don't tell you what to do unless you ask, which is embarrassing. But the "Service" tip is where you give your standard "tip" of whatever you want to give. The "Captain" tip is an extra amount that just goes to the table captain for outstanding service.  So if you do it like you are supposed to, your total tip could be as much as 30% of your meal cost. It's up to you.

n6oWEftU2_1ZKZA-pgFGlA.text: The food was OK but for the price I expected much much more. The snacks that they serve gratis before the meal were better than what either of us had for dinner. For 50 bucks a person that should not be the case. The food tasted like that one good Italian restaurant you enjoy any city USA (except 5 times the cost). We ordered a side of potatoes for 15 dollars and what we got looked like a serving of homestyle potatoes you get at say a Dennys. The service was impeccable but should be considering there is a captain who also expects to be tipped (FYI there is literally a line for the captains tip!). Don't know if that is a New York thing but I have never come across that and I've eaten at Michelin star restaurants. Save your money, way too many options on the strip to bother dining here.

XELH3wVR2iPxsjDTCW76UA.text: This was the best Italian meal we have ever had. We did the 3 course menu with wine pairings. The food and wine was incredible. My husband and I would come back just to go eat here. The service was amazing!! We couldn't ask for more.

l8hNT3N59rWLLS_eOg-u3Q.text: Il Mulino is the Italian restaurant that every other fancy Italian restaurant in America wants to be like, but can't compete with. Over the years we've been to the now defunct Washington, D.C. location, and the original NY mothership. Without fail the service is excellent. The staff are attentive without being pushy or annoying. The food is exceptional classic Italian-American fare, and they plow you full of free appetizers before even thinking of handing you a menu. You pay for the service and the food, but it's worth it. If you're going out for a special occasion -- and what Las Vegas trip isn't complete without a fancy meal? -- make Il Mulino your go-to destination. You won't be disappointed.

Z08ZkyTBLhgoI9A1uYxzKA.text: Bone in parm is incredible. Come back every time we go to Vegas. Atmosphere is definitely not impressive but still nice. Staff is very friendly

OAO9WAVnIJDX4SF0gAbvPg.text: This review is a bit overdue. An associate of mine recommended we check out Il Mulino after a disappointing dining experience at L'Atelier Robuchon. We were told that the service would blow our minds and Il Mulino did not disappoint. The captains and all the servers were checking up on us constantly and all the recommendations were great.  We had a party of 8 and we almost got full off the house appetizers. We made it party style and ordered the branzino, pounded veal chop, mushrooms, shrimp with risotto, and the sea scallops. Our captain advised us that the portions were large and that we should start with these 4 dishes (we actually did get full off the 4 dishes!) The wine recommendation paired well with the food. As testament to their service, 3 servers took each dish and split them for us in our room.  If you're looking for great food and great service, check out Il Mulino!

8xP1e30Svd7yLyg5FYk23g.text: Great appetizers and great atmosphere .... Over priced (like most in vegas) ...... Have cone here for years and quality has dipped significantly!!! Very very disappointed when I order a burrata and tomatoes and it is served chilled!!! The tomatoes tasted like they came straight out of Costco's fridge!!! And the maitre D tried to argue the point .... Sad!! This used to be a favorite but I will not go back....

Pj7B7su66MB3uGfbcAhmtg.text: So this is a difficult review because it has so many good things that start up front that are free. I love the zucchini, parmesan, bruschetta but then after that things just get so average and slightly overpriced. Yes it is impressive that the waiter can rattle off 15 specials but at the same time why not just add them to a menu as it's hard to remember and know which ones sound good and their price. I've had 6 different dishes here over 3 visits and all are very average, the first time I was wowed by the appetizers and still think they are excellent but it's stopped making me love this place. Also, the lunch crowd is very small which means service this time wasn't great as the servers weren't overly interested and there weren't many of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the free appetizers they give you upon arrival

xDaT06h0yLYB-7uWfLX_xA.text: Last night we had dinner at Mulino for the first time and I will say that the food and service was exceptional!  I eat at a lot of great restaurants and this is one I would come back to.  The service was perfect in every way.  The wine recommendations were great, the staff was attentive to every need.  Your water was always full and your every need was being tended too.  When we first sat down, within a couple of minutes we had bread, water, bruschetta and Cheese at our table without asking for anything.  I mentioned I like a meaty pasta and they brought me a sauce they made not on the menu which was delicious.  This restaurant deserves great reviews with the service and food they deliver.  I will be back on my next trip to Vegas.

0T8LMEYqg6opRwP76pXRMg.text: Il Mulino is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas.  Upscale + old-school Italian = my kind of place!  My family always makes it a point to dine here when we come to Vegas.  We LOVE Italian food.  Pasta, garlic and vino are diet staples!  The waiters are charming and always refer to the ladies as "bella".  So sweet!  As other reviewers have mentioned, the service is spot-on.  From being served the complimentary apps of bruschetta, garlic bread, salami, garlic bread and the most delicious aged Parmesan, you know you are in for an experience.  I really enjoyed my penne pasta with marinara and ricotta cheese.  Unfortunately, I was a bit of a piggie and overindulged on apps, so I wasn't able to eat all of my pasta.  I ate as much of the pasta as I could because it just tasted so yummy!  I still can't stomach the complimentary grappa that is served after the meal.  I wish I could, but it is just way too strong for me.  Oh well.  The food and service keep us happy and ensure that we will be repeat customers.  Buon Appetito!  ;)

nqRmNol75iI3i5LLds5-rA.text: We came here based on a suggestion from friends who come here quite a bit. She's one of those Italian-Americans and claims that this has some of the best Italian food you can find (probably outside of NY). So we decided to come by and give it a go.  Unfortunately, we were still a bit worse for wear from the day before, so dinner had to be a bit lighter than we probably would have done otherwise. We were amazed at the number of free nibbles they hand out: three types of bread, a hunk of aged parmesan, bruschetta, a mussel and fried zucchini. They were all really well done, but it does fill you up a bit at the beginning. They also don't do corkage, so the bottle of wine we brought from Santa Cruz had to be held on to to have when we got back to the hotel.  To start, I had the fresh buffalo mozzarella with red and yellow tomatoes and the other half ordered the langoustine starter. For mains, we both ordered a porcini and truffle ravioli that was on special. The starters were great. The cheese was really fresh (I assume it's made in house) and the tomatoes and asparagus it was served with just went great. The langoustines were perfectly cooked and melted in your mouth. The mains were also really tasty, but the other half couldn't finish his. We skipped dessert as we were both really full, and nothing really jumped out at us (they have very traditional Italian desserts).  All in all the food was great and the service was outstanding. The ravioli ended up being incredibly expensive, so if I could do 4.5 stars I would. Although it's not more than we've paid for meals at other places and the delicious pre-starters really made up for it. They also have a decent wine list and decant the wines into pitchers which made for interesting conversation. It's a pretty solid place for a great Italian meal in Vegas (although it definitely seemed more like Italian food I've had in the US than Italian food in Italy).

yX0yhZ4Z50nTJgnU5_rNPQ.text: Had the capellini musellini and it was delicious! The wait staff are extremely attentive. This is a classic New York style Italian restaurant that has transposed to Las Vegas and done a great job.

tjZIiXOODImN6YEiWcOK5g.text: I visit Las Vegas twice a year on business and on the Tuesday night of my trip my work group enjoys an amazing dinner at this fantastic restaurant. We all look forward to this night to have the plentiful and immediate house appetizers, my favorite are the little olive oil soaked breads!  The porcini mushroom ravioli is to die for!!   The service is always amazing as well making it a 5 star dinner every time.   I love in Florida and can't wait to soon visit il mulino in Miami.

7A_7UHShqd-ZCaws5wKmyA.text: One of the best meals I've had in the US. Only topped by a tiny place in Tuscany. Fresh Burrata & beet salad and Mushroom & truffle ravioli were mouthwatering and delicious. The chicken piccata melted in your mouth. Calling it Chicken Piccata doesn't even seem right... this is next level.  Waiters were fabulous, all the complimentary snacks at the beginning were outstanding and set the tone for how tasty everything would be throughout the meal. The giant block of parmesan was a dream come True. This experience is worth every single penny. Lovely, civilized, not too loud. Overall, divine. Cannot wait to return! Deserves 10 stars.

vBWMSU_65tS17Y7qbKS5FA.text: Best Meal Ever. From the minute you walk in there it's an experience. A must try. Delicious. Escargot amazing. I shared a pasta and fish dish with my friend. We considered canceling our reservation at the neighboring Nobu to go here one more night before we left Vegas... if that gives you any indication.

Tv57sy1OtFTA2KsyEqDiPw.text: I strongly believe first impression are everything... we arrived at this restaurant about 30 mins earlier.  When we arrived the young lady was very gracious, but the guy was a little rude..... his tone made both me and my husband feel unwelcomed... now I know we were there early, but it does not call for a comment like this: " we don't do anything before 8:30."   Now reading it does not seem bad, but it was in the tone in which he said it!  Because of his tone my husband did not want to go back!    We went to Joes down stairs and their food was awesome!!!!

NSVukf9vSYA7Yrca245DiA.text: This past weekend, we enjoyed a four-star meal at Il Mulino in Las Vegas at the Forum shops.  The food, service and ambience here are unsurpassed.  The moment we were seated, we were treated to mouthwatering starters--including parmesan cheese, slices of salami and marinated zucchini.  We ordered cocktails and began perusing the menu.  Oy vey!  So many choices and so little time!  I started with a traditional Caesar salad which was delicious.  The waiter said the dressing is made fresh in the kitchen and it was splendid.  My second course was Pasta of the Day with Bolognese sauce; it melted in my mouth.  My main course was Osso Buco which you could cut with fork.  Wanting to pretend I was eating healthy, I substituted the risotto with spinach--sauteed to perfection in garlic and olive oil.  Dessert was a scoop of chocolate and vanilla gelato that made my eyes roll back into my head.  We completed the meal with a complimentary grappa and then had to be carried out of the restaurant.  Il Mulino is our idea of food heaven.  We cannot wait to go back and try some other dishes.

4QX3Vj5lDlYtq1B4Ohg9YQ.text: The food was great. The price point was spot on target. I'd give it 5 stars if the service was good. The service was average but they all seemed very stuck up and a bit rude. I wanted to remind them that they were not someone special themselves.

YzGUrGKvYXZ2tsMi2ggvgg.text: I dine here at least once a year,   and yes.   Its dining.    Its always an amazing 2+ hour epicurial experience.      The food is outstanding.   The service is perfect.   The atmosphere is understated and again,   perfect.        Its always worth every dollar.     So take your guy or gal here and thank me later......

Fyags8KHu7e0t0mZeYbtaQ.text: Excellent restaurant with very attentive service and fantastic food! Lovely complimentary antipasti and bread to start followed by an outstanding porcini ravioli and veal saltimbocca that was melt in the mouth tender.  Wine list very pricey

9v30g32apWaCU08nIzIYug.text: In short, YUM. Went here while in Vegas recently with Lauren B. It came at the high recommendation of someone else and their kudos were well deserved!   Arrive hungry as this place brings you lots of food even before you order. The service was amazing with a full team paying attention to our table including the captain (which became confusing at tip time as there was a separate line for tip and captain tip, which we weren't quite sure how to handle)!  Upon seating, a large 20+ pound carcass of Parmesan cheese was brought to the table and we were each given a heaping scrape from it. Then, we received a small plate of meat, bread options (go for the buttery looking one - you won't regret it at least in the moment!) and crispy zucchini. We ordered the special Burratta as well, which they split into two plates for us. The Burratta was amazing as were the other items we had to start. I opted for the special Pappardelle alla Bolognese as I rarely turn down a homemade Pappardelle or Bolognese sauce. It was amazing. Seriously great taste and a heaping portion. We enjoyed some wine with our meal as well - a nice Italian Chianti. We were both so full we couldn't even consider dessert, but they will bring you some grappa to the table as a post-dinner treat.   Make a reservation - definitely a popular place and worth planning ahead to go there. Just be sure you are ready to mangia!

r4vFTK8n1zXnCK2HAO-P6Q.text: Wow, we use to love this place. Had a reservation, waited 10 minutes, got the chefs "prepared offering."  Waited 45 minutes, no response for anyone until we waved our hands.  Left to seek other meals.

lcPUTteh1jVFJ7zWYT0Lcw.text: Had a great dinner Il Mulino Las Vegas.  The service and food is very similar to the Miami South Beach location.  The terrace outside is really pretty with nice views of the strip at night.

ZFQ28tkRR4A6vGlYiVQ_hg.text: The restaurant is located in the forum shops at the caesars palace, the ambiance was lovely, it's good for a date night, the wine selection was extensive and service was great.   We had calamari app, beef carpaccio, and the buffalo mozzarella app along with variety of mains, the food was good, It is on a expensive side so you get what you pay for, I would visit again not frequently but when in mood for good Italian food, oh the portions are huge, you can easily split between two people.

snBGcZ_GFPSXCkfS0sOjOg.text: Is it my favorite Italian restaurant, I was so happy to see it on the top floor after I finish a day of shopping at the mall.   I highly recommend El Molino because of it's personalized service and excellent food quality. It has great collection it has an excellent collection of wine.   If you're only going to eat at the restaurant and not go to the shops I will recommend that the best way to get into restaurant is from the front entrance of the Caesars forum shops if you enter the form shops from the casino side you need to walk a bit long to get to this place well worth the walk either way.   The atmosphere was very good I think the food was amazing and the staff was very attentive especially Denis but be careful with the one price the price in generally I think more expensive than normally but it's worth just make sure you know the price before you order you'll be surprised that even the water is charge on the bill.

ThCVqmTHwYRQJRQ7Mqtdzg.text: Honestly, for all those following my reviews in Yelp, will be used to my 'straight to the point' and 'I don't rate service as people comes and goes' kind of policy when I rate a place. In this case, I will have to do a little bit of history, so I will break my 'straight to the point' policy. As Italians, my family and me use to dine a lot at IL MULINO, especially the one in NYC. We also used to come a lot to the Vegas one, and in our last 3 or 4 times, we had a superb service and food.  I will have to start my review this time by praising the service at this place, what I found it did not decline even a little bit (hence the 3 stars). Unfortunately I cannot say the same thing about the food. Let's start with the fact, we are still on vacation time (beginning of August) and even if the shopping mall is full of people this restaurant was not as busy. I remember other times where reservations were a must and even with them you had to wait (sometimes over an hour) to get your table. That should give me a hint of what was going on (I have to clarify, my last visit to IL MULINO in Vegas was in 2014).  Let's start with the wine list. It is way shorter than I remember and, guys, did you jack up the prices in it !! As a fan of Malbec, I asked for one bottle of the 2 they have in the list (being an Italian restaurant and you have only 2 selections of Argentinian Malbec, a country founded by Italians, pretty much, is kind of unacceptable). To my surprise, they were out of them (really?). I order a barbaresco instead. Guys, that bottle in the stores costs about 55 bucks, wholesale I adventure, around $25 (normally markup is about 300%). Pricing the bottle at $380 is kind of ridiculous, anyway, I ordered it. Now we comes to the menu. It is the typical 2 pages (it always has been), but then the waiter came with about 10 different specials for the night. Ok, guys, can anyone of you tell me how can we remember 10 different plates by hard when we want to decide on our order? What about printing a small card with all those 'specials' for the day guys? Just an idea. We were 4 in the party that night. We have a sea bass (full sea bass fish just oven roasted with salt), which I have to add a side of roasted broccoli myself (at a charge of course), we also ordered Spaghetti Arrabiata, truffled risotto and spaghetti vongole. Traditionally the Vongole sauce is made with Cockle not with Clams, but we can overlook that, as they are both in the same 'family'. Sill the taste is not the same. The truffled risotto, was creamy (which the menu did not say) and also cooked thoroughly, unfortunately the person eating it likes the rice 'al dente'. The spaghetti Arrabiata was good and super hot (as in the opposite of cold), so I suggest you take your time letting it cool down a bit. The person who ate the risotto, was fascinated with the taste of the truffles, but not impressed with the plate in a whole (and we are talking about an Italian mamma, who knows how to cook, capisce?). We finish our plates, I ordered and espresso and asked or the bill. Since it was someone's birthday, the manager sent us a small chocolate cake plate with whipped cream as a birthday cake which happened to be, probably, THE BEST PLATE we had in the entire night. We just munched it all in less than 2 minutes. Ok, guys, don't get astonished when you see the bill in this place. All that above, plus a couple of Pellegrino water bottles, plus tax and service charge (mandatory and added to your bill), was almost $700. Yes, you read right, almost seven hundred dollars. As I mention in all my reviews, since I know it is an expensive place, I do not complain about the price. If I cannot afford it, I won't sit down to eat there. But if I am paying big bucks, I want big 'returns' for it. I did not get that at IL Mulino, in Vegas at all.  Recommend the place? Yes. I will recommend it, but I will say, stay away from the wine list (if you can, order by the glass which are more decently priced) and stay away from elaborated plates, stick to the italian classics, the pasta. Cheers.

lK8SxWVA7DUSr6Xz5DmYog.text: Outstanding establishment! Truly, probably the best service I've ever had. I came with a group of girls and was expecting a nice, Italian spot but it was way more than that. We were instantly served bruschetta, an assortment of bread and this pan-seared zucchini that was delectable. We ordered some drinks and took in the ambiance of the restaurant. Our waiters were very friendly and sincere. I ordered their Cappellini Il Mulino. The vodka cream sauce and the mushrooms were outstanding! Such a savory and flavorful meal. I couldn't eat all of it! Wish I could've taken the leftovers back with me :(

9TYRlR175yBwSJEVx9a6fg.text: A wonderful authentic Italian dining experience. The ambience was elegant and suave. The waiter was friendly, attentive and informative. Now the food itself didn't exactly blow me away, my tomatoes didn't taste fresh. But I did enjoyed the grappa and the hot waiter that was serving me. It's nice to have a little eye candy with a hearty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pHsCo7exl814mFIL1l1iNg.text: Three of us had dinner here yesterday for Vday. I would rate the food more towards 4 stars and the service 2.5/3 stars. The start of the meal was great, had the cheese starter and all the other small plates that came were nice. My mother ordered a cocktail and I got a glass of wine, and that was the last time we were ever offered a drink for our meal. Dinner started at 6:30 we left around 8:45, so during the whole course of time our waiter never asked either of us if he could refill our drinks. By the way, they have so many people working in this place, every other person besides our waiter came to our table, like I have no clue who our waiter actually was, I know there are bus boys, runners blah blah blah, but where the F is our waiter?...Any way, parents both got the burrata salad and they didn't like it much. I started with the oysters, which were fresh and nice, but they weren't shucked properly, so I had to use my tiny fork to get them free. I had the salmon as my entree, it was moist and lovely, so A+ there. My mom's veal chop was perfect, where as dad's was mostly fat, but the side potatoes were fabulous. So long story, not so short, pretty good food, crap service, I still want another drink btw, but I'll go back for another try.

60-IaSJPIOrPpP4WN2mTXg.text: Before a show at the Colosseum at Caesars, I came here for an early dinner.  Opening promptly at 5 PM, I was seated and soon a bevy of servers brought a number of different starters to the table.  First, a large wheel of Grana Padano cheese and gouged a chunk out and placed it on a small plate.  Then came Italian bread, focaccia, garlic bread, sauteed zucchini, and bruschetta with one mussel.  This before any menu was offered.  It was almost overwhelming that items kept being brought to the table.  The captain then told me the specials for the night without price information and he left me with a menu.  I ordered an iced tea which was soon brought and was kept refilled during my dinner.  When the captain came back, I ordered the Stracciatella alla Fiorentina soup, sometimes referred to as Italy's egg drop soup.  For the main course, I got the porcini mushroom stuffed ravioli in and black truffle and champagne sauce.  The soup was very good and very hot.  With the choice of breads I had been brought, there was a wide variety to go with the soup.  A bus person grated cheese and ground fresh pepper for the soup.  The white of the eggs were evident all over the top of  the soup.  Very nice.  The ravioli was good.  Again I was offered freshly ground cheese and cracked pepper and I chose both.  The ravioli were good but the mushroom taste didn't make it.  The pillows were unevenly stuffed and the flavor came from the delicious sauce.    For dessert, I got panna cotta with orange sauce and very thin rind.  It was a light ending to a heavy meal with all the bread and the number of ravioli that were served.  For the most part, service was good.  However, for a restaurant of this caliber, I would expect them to patrol the table a bit more and remove used sugar substitute packets.  This is one of my tests for the best of service from a high end spot.  The dinner was good, but Il Mulino is certainly charging Strip prices and there are better Italian restaurants on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stracciatella alla Fiorentina.
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Place setting.
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta and mussel.

rYQrDadRgBDYZERCgrC_FQ.text: The food and service here are both excellent. The servers are nice and very helpful. We were seeing a show at the Coliseum at 8 pm so they made sure to pace our meal accordingly, so we'd be out with plenty of time to walk over.  The desserts were amazing, especially the cheesecake and flourless chocolate cake. The cheesecake was the best I've had.  They are also generous with small bites before your meal - Parmesan cheese, bruschetta, fried zucchini, etc.  The reason I didn't give it more stars is because we brought in a bottle of champagne that we'd been drinking on the way over from our hotel room (in Caesars), which had been a birthday gift for our friend. We just wanted to finish it before eating, since he had no way to save it and it was a nice champagne.   The servers kindly offered to put it on ice for us - and then the manager came over to let us know it was a problem. She lectured us for a few minutes and then we got a $50 corkage fee on our bill.   Meanwhile, we ordered apps, entrees, desserts and a bottle of wine, so the bill came to almost $600 without tip. We also were all staying at Caesars, and were seeing a show there (she asked, so she knew).   It just left a bad taste in our mouths to have our lovely evening marred by the manager's making a big deal out of something so minor and then adding a pretty ridiculous charge to our already substantial bill.   It's unfortunate because we'd probably all be recommending this restaurant to friends when in Vegas, but that incident made us all feel we wouldn't want to return.

kLj4BiYN-ESSMu9HMv_Ckg.text: OUTSTANDING food - service - wine.   Make your reservations and be prepared for a full dining experience.   Nightly specials sometimes exceed the main menu items. Hard to choose, but nothing will disappoint.  My favorite is always the lobster ravioli and gnocchi.   Each pasta order is cooked to order and served HOT !   The wine list features the best of the best from all regions of Italy.  This is always my go-to restaurant when we visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d65HEGMT9ZD6SekqWR8oFw.text: Il Mulino is a fantastic Italian restaurant.  Classy, delicious, exceptional.  I've dined in both the Miami and Las Vegas locations, and they are very comparable.   Excellent service, delicious food, great wine list.   Spectacular Grana Panada cheese and balsamic reduction as the complimentary appetizer.  All in all this is just fabulous restaurant - one I will go to any time, at any of their locations, when I have the opportunity.

6fycGVnxmGOfnAoS9cx3QQ.text: I had such high hopes for this restaurant ... we were there last Friday night (11/14/14) for my husbands 70th birthday (a very young 70 I must say!) we made an early reservation as we were going to a show at Caesar's immediately after dinner . It started really well, good service, a very nice Captain, the appetizers were great, my husband loves pasta and I asked the Captain for his recommendation ... he told me, and I quote, "the chicken parmesan is the best I've ever had" ... being a fairly good cook myself and that being one of my specialties .. I took his recommendation.   My husbands dish (spaghetti & meat balls) was good, not wonderful, our salads were ok, wine was ok, but my dish was just AWFUL, I could not eat it, it was tough, overcooked and drowning in too much cheese. I nibbled around the edges but could not eat it, literally.  I sat for the longest time, waiting for the waiter to come, he never did .. when he did finally come by to pick up our plates, I told him it was not good and I could not eat it. Expecting at the very least to have him offer to bring me something else or remove it from our bill ... BUT, nothing. I was stunned.   They brought my husband a desert sampler and even sang "Happy Birthday" in Italian, which was thoughtful, but sorry, I was ready to cry ...   As I said, I had such high hopes ... I don't understand why the Captain was so dishonest, it's as if the cook screwed up and someone said, "push the chicken parmesan"  .. if it had not been for this truly awful dish the dinner would have been fairly successful.

Q-NFw_8m1k2cxvBzB3JLNQ.text: Everything about Il Mulino is special.  From the complimentary appetizers to the waiters to the delectable French martini to unbelievably good entrees, everything says that this is the place for special occasions.  Other restaurants should take note of how impeccable the wait staff is and how from year to year, this restaurant stays True to be reliable.

cbunZNFFHEYP7Jb7gM4FGg.text: This place is out of this world. Worth every penny. Loved the complimentary cheese, zucchini, bruschetta and mussels. I was blown away by it. Ordered the Sole and it melted in my mouth. Perfect combination of lemon and other seasonings. The desserts are to die for so make sure you save room. Great place for a celebratory dinner or romantic evening.

DOkAOgJuK8Et4xvojKM9qg.text: Amazing food, best service I've ever experienced; hands down. From the moment we sat down, we were bombarded with amazing food. I don't know what the eggplant complementary appetizer was, but it was literally one of the best things I've ever tasted! Great wine and cocktails! Definitely fits the bill for a very special occasion.

j221jihJq8tZEtTwvHd4-Q.text: 08/09/2013  We were there for Dinner, we were seated right away, numerous delicious items were served right away. My wife had the Caprese, I had the Shrimp Oreganata, and it was so good I said wow and I never say Wow! Homemade pasta for my wife, a classic Osso Bucco for me!  Everything was perfect!  Exception job! We will be back!

BpTvzPpzPu3wNc_T7Fv5Vg.text: It's OK Italian food. Pretty pricey but it is located in Las Vegas. We had a party of 12 and they were able to accommodate us last minute since our reservation at a prior restaurant had mysteriously disappeared.   We sat down and the wait staff was very nice. Our server did make us comfortable while taking our time to order and asking if we would prefer a different pasta. That was a plus. The only thing I would recommend for the restaurant is to not have so many specials. The server basically read us the whole secret menu because the other items that were not on special was posted on the regular menu. Too much to absorb.  I had a great time, but I probably wouldn't come back unless I was craving Italian food in Las Vegas.

PorQDWyroLKgDWetd3qfQQ.text: Yum!  I love fancy atmosphere, fine dining experiences, and in the lovely world of Vegas, I enjoyed this dinner very much.  I got the frutti de mare and it was delish!!!!!!!  The portions are HUGE, so you're definitely getting your money's worth.  The leftovers made a great late late night snack.  The complementary appetizers were good and tasty with plenty to go around.  You can get sparkling or flat water...I prefer the flat.    I particularly liked how the waiters call the girls "Bella" cause it made me feel pretty :)  Could have been 5 stars but: 4.4 stars, and I rounded down.  0.6 stars knocked off because I asked them to box up someone's dinner and they misunderstood and threw it away.  What a waste of food.    If you're still hungry after this grand, luscious meal, you can go outside to Serendipity and get some yummy dessert.  Viva Las Vegas!

6a5fv_yFcK6yFwoxcjD5rQ.text: Want great service, great food? This is a great spot for a romantic dinner, or just some great grub before a night on the strip. Been twice, different meals each time and EVERY TIME GREAT!!!! Little pricey on the drinks, great value with the food, considering the 20 items you get before you even get a menu. Cheese, bread, something else I didn't try, and even some muscles!!! AWESOME PLACE!!!!!

is004SPE8J-Yg_ke4ID76A.text: I was here last week with a large group of girls (bachelorette of course) and the wait staff was very helpful.  They repeated the nightly specials and even made 2 special requests for some finicky eaters.  We paid about $60 each but it was well worth it.  I loved the Parmesan cheese chunks served with warm bread. Just to warn you though, portions are huge!  I'll know next time to share the main course, or order family style.  I swear the pasta dishes had about 1lb of pasta in each bowl! The captain was very nice, he even took pictures of our group on the outdoor patio!

C6TyqfvWjUwxOdhFe4ttJg.text: Has to be one of the best, if not THE BEST Italian in Las Vegas!  Highly recommend it!

G7ToaAQr--wPWIkogLFh_A.text: We were surprised that the first service of Pellegrino Water was on our bill at 16.00 per bottle. We were not told at service? Everyone was very disappointed. Every starter was that was ordered was to perfection. The Huge Parmesean Wheel of Cheese was extronaire.  However, be careful we were served more than what was ordered. My husband ordered a special and we were not given market price, however, a whole fish preppped in rock salt was worth every penney.   One veal entree was overcooked and gritty. A poultry entree was dark meat and dry.   The desserts rocked. The service was first class. The Amuse Bouche was wonderful. Again, the service was extrodinary.  And they sang Happy Birthday in  Intalian!  All six of us enjoyed our dinner despite a few hiccups.

r6jaxtETbLr_G0MAhGK8jQ.text: Ok so this place is far from inexpensive but...    From the moment you arrive you are greeted with culinary magic.  The Parmesan chunks, the excellent breads, the paper thin zucchini and mushrooms with delicious olive oil (that in itself would make a meal and are all brought to you while you decide on what you want for dinner at no extra charge).  The wine list is amazing and in a leather bound book. (They had wines for as little as $80 and as high as $29,000.  Yep it is no typo 29K for a bottle.) All the pasta is fresh, ravioli amazing, appetizers are diverse and delicious.  Everyone at the table enjoyed different items from Gnocchi to Mediterranean Sea Bass and all were amazing.  The food kept coming for over 3 hours and by the end we were too stuffed to even contemplate dessert.  If you win BIG in Vegas and are looking for an experience that will be remembered, then set aside about $400-$800 for dinner here and enjoy.

-64e_XTGief6JNbzjkJ6GA.text: If you love Italian food and you're in Vegas, do not miss this restaurant!  I know it's hard to justify a 10,000 calorie meal when you're planning on hitting the pool the next day, but isn't decadence part of why we go to Vegas?  To spoil ourselves a bit?  If you haven't been to Il Mulino before here's my advice: skip lunch, grab a date, wear something not-too-tight, and show up ready for some serious, fabulous carbs.  Beware that the assortment of free munchies comes out before they even deliver the menu, so it's easy to get overly-enthusiastic about the fried zucchini, garlic bread, parmesan chunks, bruschetta, and spicy toasts and fill up on those.  Delicious as they are, it's worth it to save room for the ravioli.  Personally, my better half and I split a Caesar salad (an attempt to throw a vegetable into the mix), then split an order of the ravioli (which is always a "special" and not listed on the menu), then he gets the chicken parm, and we finish off with a dessert of berries and cold zabaglione.  It's a meal worth savoring, so take your time and enjoy.  You deserve it after losing all that money in the casino.  ;)  A note about the staff - they are always amazing and incredibly attentive.  And a note about cost - I believe the ravioli dish is $50 per order, which seems crazy, but if you split it and factor in all the freebies you ate the minute you sat down, it doesn't seem as bad.  Make an evening of it (particularly a romantic one), and it will be worth every cent.

y_wIcpibYG8WG2nYRtEgRw.text: Ah, I'l Mulino - I knew you when you were a star in fabulous New York.  I marveled at how knowledgeable your waiters were; how hard it was to get a table at your cozy little place; and your paste... well, it made me want to have a Lady-in-The-Tramp moment.... with myself.  I couldn't stop eating the fresh goodness that was coming out of your kitchen! I was in love with your food!    You can imagine my surprise at my first visit to your sister resto here in Las Vegas -- yes, the waiter's memorization of the entire menu plus specials was impressive... but the splendor stopped until we got to the desserts and lemoncello. The trio of  house-favorite pastes that our table ordered to share came out like mush... and didn't go down well either.  The pesto sauce coating the gnocchi was flavorless (albeit extremely green), and the red sauce for the other paste course was also bland.  Well, the salted branzino will be the star of the show, I thought to myself.... but, I was (sadly) disappointed.  The fish was entirely too dry.... so that I was wishing I wasn't so quick to reject the scorned paste.    Yes, I'l Mulino Las Vegas, your dessert (especially the tiramisu) is spectacular, as are your servers... but I do not think I can visit you again until you take some lessons from your East coast sister.

Zm7CWFtaPA9jIjdw80WyHw.text: I visited Il Mulino while on a business trip and dined there with a colleague. It was the most romantic, most delicious, most indulgent dining experience I have ever had. I make sure I tell all of my friends to visit Il Mulino when they travel to Vegas.  I ate at quite a few of the "best" restaurants in Vegas and this was by far my favorite. It's a sure thing for a fantastic meal!

OGzVuwLImtfF0riRvXJ12g.text: After reading some of the other reviews here, I decided that I need to cast my vote. We dined here the weekend of 3/14. After eating at some other restaurants, including another "Italian" place, we decided this was easily the best meal we had in LV.  As other people mentioned, the staff brings you several mini appetizers to start. They are all traditional Italian preparations. Nothing flashy, but simple ingredients and well executed prep make them shine. We went to Italy for 3 weeks last year, and I would say that the food here reminded us of the real stuff.  I had the double cut veal chop that was on special. It was delicious. My wife had a combo of two different pasta dishes which the server was happy to assemble for her by halving two entrees. (I do wish he had mentioned the slight up charge for doing this. It was $2, but it's the principle that matters.) This made her very happy, and the portions were quite large. Service was well-paced and the "captain" did as good a job as one could expect. After asking him to repeat the specials a second time, and then asking him what he would recommend, I feel he certainly did us justice. As far as tipping goes... I have never seen a separate line for the captain's tip. So, I simply ignored it. No big deal. This was a very nice dining experience, and we would go back again.

jfeD-s7awfbNKikQeRaKJQ.text: Good food, Good service.  Not a ton to say that hasn't really been said already...  The free shit that they bombard you with is plenty to fill up on, and it's all delicious. Though, I've been here a few times, always hoping and anticipating something different, though it never is.  Many of the specials are the same, (though, perhaps Its because I find myself in Vegas at the beginning and end of summer, more than any other season, so perhaps its just dependent on what's in season... That's a fair thought, right?)  I have genuinely enjoyed every meal that I've had here, and typically shove too much food in my face.  It's all very flavorful.  The complaint that I would have with this place, is that their wine menu is stupid expensive... Their mark-up on them is astronomical... Probably 500%+, But, I can accept that, getting hunks of parm, bruschetta, zuccini, mussels, grappa, a selection of breads, salamis, and whatever else I may be forgetting, as compliments of the house.  They have to pay for the free shit, somehow...

dRZGZ_WNeWxkt89zkiD3rQ.text: First off, if the weather is nice, sit on the balcony! The view is great and I'm not sure why the dining area fills up first. The food was good and about equal to other nice restaurants around Vegas. I ordered sea bass which they filet for you after allowing you to view the fish. The Italian cheesecake for dessert was great, and the "italian moonshine" after the check was brought was very interesting. The weight staff was friendly, polite, and not at all "stuffy" as I've read in some reviews here. It's a fine dining experience, so expect a staff of higher caliber.

SnCDir0GerLS64dvNAMN9A.text: Ate with a group of six. Nothing special about the service. Food hit or miss. Adequate, but nothing that would make us want to return.

Km5K4tFUIOSwNYdpo63VAg.text: Lunch gave us impeccable service and life altering food.  Parm, bruschetta, salami and marinated zucchini upon seating just like dinner.  Life altering sound a bit exaggerated? Try the scampi francese with risotto and tell me your world didn't get a little happier.

bXJwHcU_cj9b2TPEBzl-Kw.text: I am writing a review trying to reach out to the manager to ask what kind of moscato you guys serve. I was in there a few weeks ago with my friends and we ordered a 75.00 dollar bottle of moscato and the server had told us it is the only one you have. I am curious to know the name. Best moscato I've ever had!

pqDD4bpXcvK9K4E2lMpV1g.text: Excellent food and service.  The salt crusted branzina was absolutely amazing.  Big enough for two to share and they filet it right in front of you.   Service was super fast and service staff was very friendly. Real team effort provided great service.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

AFuGU3Xuquq9Etx1hp39Vg.text: One star because it is a nice dark room in the traditional sense and it fairly well appointed.  Also, there's something behind those walls that understands restaurants, it's just too bad that it falls into the hands of those that have lost their passion for the people that patronize the place. And finally they Yelp won't allow Zero stars.  Decent bar to grab a glass of Champagne and the hostess seemed nice when I said I wanted to have a drink there and hold the table for 15 minutes.  Needed the time to grope and fondle my date before we stuffed our faces just in case it left me incapable of getting my arms later.  Very supportive of foreigners that come here to work and the attitude of professionalism they normally bring to the art of service.  But these "Captains" had to be kidding me.  "No meat" ok?  At least 15 times without so much of leaving me feel that he understood.  No bacon, no veal stock, chicken, do you understand? No? Yes? Yes but you didn't hear me and brought it anyway?  Which.  The bill was only $400 for two so I'm not doing the high roller thing but I expect some decent treatment.  bring us the salad why we look at the menu.  No?  You can't?  The chef doesn't allow that?  What?  No?  Are you kidding?  The salad came.    Take the tired apps you sent out.  Yes they're free but they lack any assemblance of special.   This was an aggravating dinner when I should have been able to just keep my hands under the table without worry.  Super Tuscan was good but I guess they wanted me to apologize I only dropped $175 when anyone worth their salt would have went for the other bad selections at triple the price.  I know wine. I know it costs, but this wine list is so out of touch.  Great, it's expensive with lots of overpriced stuff.  Once a list like this establishes itself as expensive they think they can go off the chart and get double what other expensive lists get.  Romance the pouring of the wine.  "We will jam 10 ounces each of wine in your glass and we know you'll buy another. " Please you freaken idiot.  I ordered a bottle of water to quench and hydrate.    Caesar was OK.  Lamb dish the babe had was off the chart she said.  The pasta with seafood I had was so bland and so tasteless and so ugly, that I actually asked for lots of Cheese.  i figured I was drunk and I need to eat.    yes, I think we should all be tough on Il Mulino.  They charge big, live on a stellar reputation.  They are not Olive Garden.  But truthfully the babe digs Olive Garden more.  Easy uncomplicated, what you expect.  Just give me what i expect and don't make me work for it.  No big deal.

Ybdl9qluKyzVAepH12ebXQ.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas. Everything is amazing. Get the meal parm. It's like candy. The food here is 15 stars. Don't miss out

plPefSzdxluFAMraPBNkyw.text: Caveats: I was here for a private party and didn't pay.  All the food that I had was really, really good but I have to hone in on the zucchini.  Probably one of the best things I've ever eaten (but you have to get past the oily-ness of it).  I'd go back for that dish alone.

YVA3QiCd_s_yE-1LBsDV7w.text: Delish as usual!  Flavors, herbs, spices even olive oil, really stand out in the food here.  The shrimp taste you are eating here is shrimp, not 'fishy". Most likely one has been eating flavorless shrimp that has been freezer burned. Or washed in lord knows what to extend the life of the food not its flavor.   We are foodies, we notice things like this. We like to pay for a good meal, money is almost never an issue for us when it comes to dining out. I almost regularly seeing the bad reviews as a money issue. Not everyone likes to pay for a gourmet meal.  To each his own.  The other thing I notice is classless behavior on the part of the reviewer. Really, that's how you act in a nice restaurant? This isn't a Hooters.  . Guess I could of got bent out of shape with the following issues. Why would I do that, they are just small hick ups in life.  I don't go through life thinking people are just trying to F* with me.     Didn't like pushing bottled water. Used to be done quiet often at strip restaurants. Most have quit doing it. The local water is horrible. Trust me they are filtering it. Without doing that, food would not look as good. Cooked greens would look icky. Never mInd, the mall would be replacing water pipes as the build up of metals in the water would eventually ruin the pipes & they'd break.  I asked for a Pommery champagne. The server came with another brand, half empty. saying this was what was being served by the glass. Recognize this as a very expensive brand.  We were first table seated right after opening for dinner. So that bottle was either opened at lunch or the night before. Said sorry not interested. Manager - might want to stop thinking your customers are stupid & that we'll just  'go along.'     I ordered an appetizer size of the prawns. Stated it a couple times, waiter stated it too.  Brought me the dinner size. I can't eat that much & These prawns would not taste good next day.  Sent it back, no big drama.   Hubs says 'oh you gotta be on your toes when you eat here.'  I agree but the food is so dang good I'll put up with it.  IF the food wasn't good, it'd be a different story.    Life is about balance.

1NClzPRiyCfvgaahOJfmBg.text: The meal was delicious and expertly crafted. The atmosphere romantic. Quite a bit of complimentary food at the start. Bill was excessive. Way over priced. We were quoted $36 for a pasta and charged $38. 3 glasses of wine @$18 does $48. Service charge $37 and tax $20. Surely the service charge us tips?? They expected tips as well. We're Aussies and felt ripped off. It didn't help that the bar waiter was rude to our adult kids.

pihGSqL4O0j_bjWY21PnIw.text: The best Italian restaurant in NY is the Best Italian Restaurant in Las Vegas!! Incredible experience!! The food just keeps on coming!!

gX-hQq15iPWntGIy5B77JQ.text: My parents (I took my dad here for Father's Day) HATED this place, but I liked it. Very much.   However, I gotta admit, everything was a little overpriced and I just couldn't get over how salty some of the dishes were. I did thoroughly enjoy my beef and veal fettucini dish, but my dad hated his cannoli (which was apparently doused in salt) and my mom couldn't really eat her tortellini.   The meal started out very well, with a server hoisting a huge wheel of parmesan cheese, along with complimentary fried zucchinis, salumi, bruschetta, bread and mussels. I have to say the zucchinis were a little too salty for my taste and the mussels didn't taste fresh at all, but the bruschetta and salumi were very good, as was the artisan bread.   Wine list was extensive and quite an eye opener.   I wish I had tried their tiramasu, but maybe there'll be a next time?

noG2CoarSMLVI0eprI9wJA.text: This is a hidden gem on the upper level of the forum shops. We had very attentive service. They were all very knowledgeable of the menu selections and recommendations were spot on. They have lots of little touches that make the experience enjoyable. The mushroom ravioli is great   Thank you!

NFKkA1kooBTZSmcZlWtr_Q.text: Complimentary Hard Cheese, (Grana Padano)Bruschetta, assorted bread & more all before even seeing menu! Service is impeccable, very attentive! Bacon wrapped scallops are out of this world! Crab stuffed eggplant was very good! The Lamb is fall off the bone tender & delicious!! Can't say enough about the EXCELLENT Service!

_ecXr8NHXqBGW-mE_A6rFg.text: Journey to a trendy Italian-style Manhattan Bistro while visiting Vegas!  Beautiful decor and ambiance.  Never felt so pampered at a restaurant before!  The service was attentive without being overbearing.  The waiters took care of us without ever interrupting conversations and only made themselves known when we needed them.   Before I even had a chance to put my purse down they set a GIANT hunk of cheese in front of me and started carving it out.  They also brought out salomi and delicious crusty bread.  All complimentary of course!    The appetizers and main courses were delicious and we finished every bite!  The cocktails were well portioned and you didn't feel like your martini wasn't stiff enough.    They even brought out an after dinner drink - Digest-if to round out meal. Not sure what the check looked like (it is Vegas afterall!) but I'm sure it was worth every penny!  Will definitely be back to this place!

zHlpkjmYGCHlav0ZMnCLkA.text: Amazing SERVICE, FOOD and fair prices  From the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out, they have their act together.  Pros: service, attentiveness, value, free appetizers, salads, chicken parm and shrimp diablo,   I am a tough reviewer also.  This places leaves me without a complaint which is difficult.  What is also interesting, certainly not cheap prices, but for the value, I have absolutely no problem paying for what we got.

IV4EDLi5Be7rVkOUSTRmUg.text: We were given plethora of complimentary foods, which was tasty, unexpected and a little too oily. The main courses were amazing, our "captain" was superb however the help in the white uniforms, specifically the nice lady was over bearing at wanting to remove before we were done eating. My suggestion is for management to ask them to slow down. Otherwise, don't change a thing.

1crW-oCfgQL0T28Jhk0tQg.text: Great food by all standards!!!  Obnoxious young "sommelier" type trying to upsell.  $72 charge for water??? Crazy, no one tells you that.... They removed the charge for us (party of 10--probably hoping no one would notice or even look at bill).  keep an eye out for that.  Kind of snotty response when we questioned them as well.    Service otherwise really good.

OMYpf7gaHFkuGLVvlbz-XQ.text: I have been to the one in NYC and this did not disappoint.  Great service, great food and great decor....best meal we had in vegas.  We started with the parpadelle with ragu  and the clams casino (although they don't call them that on the menu).  The pasta was awesome but the clams were a bit small and had too much breading on them.    For the main course I had the Veal Milanese which is my go-to-meal provided it is on the bone and not cutlets.  It was one of the best I have ever had.  Huge portion, perfectly breaded and fried.  I ate 2/3rds and then my wife had some.  My wife had the Salted Branzino which was moist and excellent.  She said it was one of the best fish dishes she ever had.  We ordered a beautiful bottle of Italian white wine but it was advertised as an 2008 and they brought out a 2010.  It was still excellent, but I am always surprised at how many restaurants advertise one vintage and then bring out another.  In this case it really didn't make much different, but it just goes to show that you should always read the label.  Given the portion sizes along with the free apps (cheese, fried zucchini, etc.) you have to pace yourself or you can easily get filled up before your main course arrives.  Yes, it was expensive, but meals like this are always pricey, but, hopefully, worth it.  It was a great experience and you will not be disappointed.

8Xq8z02FpDliodHpssy6uA.text: Service is great, food is very good, they keep bringing appetizers so keep that in mind when you go to order on trays . Very good wine list., very nice experience did not feel rushed at all very good service

yI4ao1DjJ78XXc0iieI6CA.text: Overpriced, average food and awkward service.  Soon after you're seated the quick waitstaff set complimentary appetizers before you.  Nice touch, but the service is so fast, no words.  The appetizers were below average - salty bruschetta that was prepped too early because the bread was soggy.  The generous cheese was tasty though.  $40 for seafood risotto that was salty, risotto was clumpy, and seafood was a bit rubbery.  We ordered an Amarone we've had before - overpriced and warm (really???  Not even room temp.  Sad.)  Better $$ at Otto for the same wine.  I'm giving it three stars because my husbands fish was better than the risotto.  Not great, but not bad.  Certainly not worth the $$$$.

btghpKpKX9SyhcnJcq7kFA.text: One of the most enjoyable dining experiences we've had in years. It was a wonderful evening from beginning to end for the three of us.  Superb, fabulous, and attentive service.  Our dinners were decedent and as good as a Michelin rated restaurant.  We continue to relive and comment on the evening and dinner. Well worth the trek from the Encore. Dave H. Orange, CA.

XjufqSRjNKYvI9MspEitzg.text: I've eaten here twice and both times I had a great experience. I love how they (several people each with a separate offering)  show up with appetizers as soon as you sit down (Cheese, bread, olives and bruschetta).You have plenty to eat before your cocktail arrives (sorta). They have a great blend of Italian dishes from pasta to fish. They have so many specials you really don't need the menu. Service is very good - some of the best I have experienced in Las Vegas.  It's a little hard to find, but when you do you won't be disappointed.

pA4EDYQKRLtkcz6HuGHR8Q.text: Best cheesecake ever!  This place is fantastic. I have been to 5 of their locations and every time I am pleased. Yes it is expensive, but the quality and service are top notch.  Did I mention the cheesecake?

U5xzmb5Ntu_IqFESB27idQ.text: Staff was extremely efficient and professional. Appetizer parmigian regiano cheese and breads were a great way to start an outstanding meal. The only reason I pulled the star down one was due to the inability to understand the accent of our waiter when describing the menu items. The other problem was when they gave me a white napkin on my white suit. Being a high end restaurant, you would think they would have dark napkins for dark clothing. White cloth leaves lint on the jacket. Food was outstanding though.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb was outstanding. Flavors on putter layer were crisp and a bit of spice. Inside was juicy.

qMdppqCT4viA1LR340Y3YQ.text: I'm pretty sure this is one of the best rack of lamb I've had, very good service and the food was great!

vkckBoUGHETtnXUk0066gA.text: Terrible mean. The only good part was the welcome bread. Should have known given there were no patrons at dinner time. Hurts to give this review.

5Prv620CZ8nN-zR70y_QUA.text: Had a very good lunch at Il Mulino on a Thursday.  We had a reservation for 1:00 and there was only one other party in the restaurant, which is criminal, because this place is solid.  As other Yelpers note, they bring you a load of gratis appetizers:  parmesan chunks taken directly off a massive wheel, salami, a bread basket, probably the best zucchini I've ever had (dried and served with hot peppers and garlic), and garlic toast.  They gave us a ton of the zucchini too.  Of the breads, the spicy toast was my favorite, but the garlic toast was a very close second.  You could have bought a bottle of wine and just had a great lunch with all the stuff they bring you as soon as you sit down.  Speaking of wine, Il Mulino has an above average list with prices you would expect for a restaurant on the Strip.  So, not cheap, and no real deals to be found.  But, they are not out of line with other Italian joints on the Strip.  Italy is heavily featured, as it should be.   Even though we had all of the free stuff mentioned above, we decided on the calamari as an appetizer.  Very classic, fried crispy with no greasiness whatsoever and served with a nice tomato sauce.  This was not revolutionary or a departure in any way from traditional fried calamari, but a really strong example of what the dish can be.  For our entrees, we all went with specials.  I had the lobster ravioli, and my 2 companions had eggplant parm stuffed with crab and sausage and pappardelle with bolognese.  My preference was the ravioli, the eggplant, and the bolognese pasta.  Nothing was bad mind you, it was all very good pasta, but that is the order of my preferences.  The ravioli was stuffed full of lobster and the flavor came through.  It had sort of a pinkish sauce that was seasoned very well.  All of the pasta was cooked properly.  Service was great.  It was a bummer for the restaurant that it wasn't busier, but it was great for us since we basically had a waiter to ourselves for nearly 2 hours.  Had a couple of bottles of wine and it was a very good meal, better than I was expecting given some of the reviews I'd read prior to dining.  I would absolutely return.
