m5_USLWwXJjNXU_Z7mPwjw.text: Second visit - made a point of securing more comfortable seating and it made all the difference. Eggplant involtini stuffed with shrimp (special) was excellent. My husband loved the octopus appetizer. Best thing of all was the thin crouton like bread that came with the complimentary appetizer, so ask for two of those! We shared a dessert sampler and that was a fun way to go. Everything was delicious and the service was very attentive. Glad this restaurant is one of our host's favorite places to dine.   Classy ambiance and very good food. Our companions are regulars there and our group had many dishes including appetizers, soup, salad, pasta, fish, and chicken. All were delicious. Dessert was the stand out - a fruit plate prepared table side. Oranges were sectioned and fruit was complimented by a bit of Grand Marnier.  The reason I didn't give five stars was that my chair was in a very uncomfortable spot. We were at a round table and I was stuck between a pillar and the table so the servers couldn't reach the person to my right except by serving over me. There was no simple way to fix this problem for me as it was our host's favorite table. I just endured which put a tarnish on an otherwise lovely experience.

vWU_TQeslUxjbSJyl-RD4Q.text: Perfection. Had business dinner and all 6 of us left very happy. Beautiful restaurant in Caesars , attentive wait staff and the food couldnt have been more delicious. Great pasta, meat and appetizers. Ended with the panna cotta dessert and felt it was something special.

qKpUhllUf0IsuJ3iYPY_3g.text: Dinned here last night and the experience was amazing! We were supposed to have a party of ten that changed to a party of four at the last minute. They were flexible and quickly adjusted things for us without any attitude. Every member of the staff ( bartender, hostess, chef, all of our servers) were kind, engaging, and went the extra step to provide top notch service. The food was fantastic- everything!! The atmosphere and ambience was very romantic. Would highly recommended to anyone staying in Las Vegas!

cjOqk5MZJsA_afFLoUoPAg.text: Wonderful dinner great service Found il Mulino in Caesars and didn't realize they were affiliated with The one in White Plains. We had a great dinner. Started with a antipasto that they brought to us. It was parmigiana cheese bruschetta fried zucchini Wonderful We had the Calgary and Caesar salad. For dinner I had the chicken scarpillo which was superb. Paulie had the papadelle bolganaise and Frankie had the special ravioli a mushroom truffle. Danny the waiter was excellent and great personality. They aim to please. Alicia who is the owner and hostess Was very personable and gracious. Pleasure to come there. Will be back next year. tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

mVwFE0ljHf1gSxuRG1FX5Q.text: Great bar.  Excellent service. Beautiful selection. Flavors beyond reproach. Small intimate and very quiet.

ZQxPPFgucTgp8foCVKAryQ.text: Always a go-to spot when in NYC and Las Vegas.  Very professional, informative, helpful, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Amazing menu with beautiful dishes that are delicious.

XfJNKc15-pZANICqO2gW6Q.text: I had high exceptions coming to this restaurant. It exceeded those expectations.  From the moment you walk in the door, you feel special, welcome, and completely catered to every step of the way.  The evening starts off with choice of water (sparkling or still) and offers of drinks. While settling in and looking over the menu, we were brought a chunk of rich parmesan (cut off the huge slab at the table) crusty fresh bread, and sauteed mushrooms.   Some in our group ordered appetizers (the mushroom ravioli was fabulous). I ordered the mozzarella and tomato salad. It came with a huge chunk of soft, creamy cheese atop thinly sliced heirloom tomatoes over a bed of fresh greens. All was drizzled with a rich Balsamic Vinegar dressing. It would have been a perfect meal by itself. For my main dish I had the Sole Meuniere with a side of asparagus. The beurre-blanc was light with just the right balance of lemon to enhance the delicate fish, but not to overwhelm it. The fish was cooked to perfection and filleted table side. Yes, I had dessert. Out table ordered three different items to share, but I must admit, I ate most of the Tiramisu. It was light and creamy and not overly sweet.   Service was outstanding - attentive but not smothering. Very professional and gracious. The timing and presentation were perfect. They were able to choreograph the entire evening to allow a leisurely experience while keeping us fed and attended to without intruding.   A dear friend recommended this restaurant to us. Unfortunately he passed away a few days after we ate here. My only regret for this entire experience was that he and his wife were not here to share this amazing meal with us.

280Pz4MJZEp-n-39I6QqVw.text: Fabulous experience. Got full before the meal came with all of the appetizers.  Awesome service!

6Qz15B9kvFG6uco-XcMZgQ.text: I've been coming here for years. This is one of the top 3 restaurants I've ever been to. Anywhere in the world. Get the hint? EVERYTHING about this place is 6 () stars.   The experience begins with the wonderful greeting by the host/hostess. Every client is made to feel special and welcome. Once seated, someone with a giant half-wheel of Parmesan comes to carve out a small chunk and places it on your plate. Next comes bread, salami, zucchini and the best bruschetta you've ever had!  Every minute detail has been thought of and executed. The service is impeccable and perfect. The drinks are tops. The selection of Italian wines unrivaled.   I've had the Capellini Alla Arrabiata, Fetuccine Alfredo, Chicken Parmesan, and Branzino, just to name a few. Every, EVERY dish is amazing. EsPECIALLY the Branzino.   The desserts are to kill for, the coffee spectacular, and the grappa at the end of the meal just classy.   If you are looking for a world class experience, look NO FURTHER. Do NOT pay attention to any uneducated, jealous or bitter people giving unsatisfactory reviews. They're CRAZY!  , Il Mulino & staff!

ZDwaO0jMqwszgdQvetcyhQ.text: I have to say first of all the service was excellent!! Enjoyed the attention to detail, well trained staff. There were 10 of us. Some of the favorites were the rack of lamb cooked perfect medium rare and a great tasting piece of meat.  The mushroom ravioli, very rich but so good with a hint of truffle. The portions were good sized, no need for a starter. They start you off with a variety of bread, cheese and eggplant all very good. A very pleasant way to start off the evening with friends!

1wozVaazweA7BbTO52kxxA.text: I was really excited to try this place out and experience their menu. Unfortunately my friends and I were walked out of the restaurant due to being under dressed... I have never been so insulted in my entire life. The hostess came up to my party and pick us apart... "you're dressed fine, im sorry you're not cause you're wearing a t-shirt, you're not cause you're in jeans and a t-shirt... etc etc". Update your standards.

pyi8Gi7QkVgDKQjopUvGqw.text: This Restaurant was exceptional! My wife and I like to try different places around town for special occasions and this place is easily one of the best places we've been! The service was above and beyond great! The food and drinks were memorable! Bali was our Captain for the night and his expertise clearly carried over to all the staff that he was in charge of! Thank you for making this one of the best dining experiences!

cXLg5Zs5CiOiH8grvEi_-w.text: In a few short words, Il Mulino is a beautiful fine dining Italian restaurant with delicious cuisine and classy ambiance.  Located on the second level of the Forum Shops at Caesars, it's right next to Tommy Bahama. It's quite a long walk from the parking garage or the room towers. Boyfriend and I were here for an early dinner. We were greeted and then led to our table. The minute we sat down, they started to bring us all these goodies. We got our choice of bread (the minute he said the word spicy, I said oh i'll take that!), salami and cold sauteed zucchini. YUM! What a delicious opener.   Then we were introduced to our captain and he told us the specials of the night. What caught my attention was the lobster ravioli. He said all pasta dishes can be made into an appetizer. Sounds good to me, small portion so I can get a taste of it. My lobster ravioli came with four. May not sound a lot but it can fill you up....I was already half full by that time. (Plus I still had an entree coming.)  For entrees we ordered: -Pollo in Crosta which is chicken sauteed with lemon and white wine in a parmigana crust. -boyfriend got one of the specials of the night: soft shell crab. It came with a bed of spinach and mashed potatoes.   I thought my chicken was alright. Very, very light flavoring....didn't really suit my taste buds. Which is understandable since my palette just had some lobster raviolis and those were fantastic!! I would get the raviolis again but not the chicken. Boyfriend thought his soft shell crab was good but he actually enjoyed my chicken more. Different strokes for different folks. Next time, I would definitely try their chicken parmesan or another one of their pasta dishes. There WILL be a next time; we really enjoyed this restaurant. We were too full for dessert but they gave us complimentary grappa to cleanse our palette.

gK_3ufTqOWA9BplCdEIreg.text: I didn't have a reservation when I walked up to this lovely little spot but they took great care of me anyway. I was by myself so I ended up eating at the bar. Harry was the bartender and he was great. He never forgot about me despite making all the other drinks and tending to everybody else. I will definitely be back for the full dining room experience. Wonderful spot.   Update:  I know eat here regularly and always sit at the bar with Harry. This is my favorite place in Vegas.

hzRaITuZq3Hx5YA7J0hOqA.text: For the price, I expected a lot better food & service. We spent over $300 for wine, 2 entrees and dessert that was pretty standard Italian fare. Good, but not great. We also felt rushed to order by the "captain" who then never visited our table afterward (but of course gets a separate tip line on the receipt!) Overall I would recommend looking elsewhere. There are so many great restaurants to try in Vegas, this one just doesn't make the cut for me.

pglDKLW0iKr-jfWkF_Kq7w.text: This place is kind of hidden on the top floor of the mall, I had a hard time finding it.  I would not recommend their pasta it's a little dry. Salami bread is good.  I personally would not go back again but I think my friends enjoyed it.

tuYtMCvM5mKbUQdau18RjA.text: The food and dining style at Il Mulino is the closest to authentic Italian style food and dining that I have had outside of Italy.  Each course is delicious and so well made.  I don't think that I had any problems with anything that I ordered or tried.  This will be a long meal and you will be beyond full afterwards, but it really is so worth it.  This restaurant is pricey, but I do believe that it is worth the price.  With that said, this is not a restaurant to go to for a quick bite before the show or going to the clubs; this is a nice place to sit, eat, and relax.  Take your time and enjoy it.

XznTqIwoy7ANb7Cg6lqECQ.text: Why I hated this restaurant.  I' m allowed one rant a year and this will be mine.  This is the most uppity, insincere restaurant experience you're likely to have.  Yes the atmosphere is over the top faux Italian and the waiters all wear expensive looking tuxedos but leave the attitude at your next failed acting audition.  Our set of waiters were so arrogant, smug and lacking in warmth.  An Italian night out should be about warmth, appreciation of the customer and genuine food.  Our main waiter made us feel cheap or lacking in taste every time a person didn't want an appetizer or wanted to split a dessert or was going to pass on that $40 glass of grappa.  Here's an excellent example.  I asked for the second cheapest bottle of wine on the menu--Chianti Classico for $80 a bottle.  Yeah it offends me that I can buy the same bottle for $12.  The waiter said, "You'll really prefer the Riserva."  "oh, how much is that?"  "It's $300".   Well, thanks for the offer of letting me pay $300 for a $25/bottle of wine but I'll just plug my nose and drink that over-priced $80 bottle of banal Chianti.  Ok, the food is good--no question about it--but not outstanding.  I thought the cotoletta milanese was good and my wife enjoyed her simple papparadelle a pomodoro.  They made a grand production of the Limoncello and that was both fun and tasty.  Here's my humble conclusion.  Unless you are prepared to spend $200/person, expect to be treated like you're Jed Clampett on the Beverly Hills Hillbillies--coming from a waiter who probably earns 20% of what you do.  It simply wasn't a fun, edifying evening out.  Che peccato that we didn't go back to Parma which I gave 5 stars.  3 adults and 3 kids, one bottle of cheap wine, 2 appetizers, no dessert, 3 glasses of limoncello = $640

5AFxXoNjkIhaHh5eFEe04w.text: I really liked the Il Mulino in NY when I went 6 years ago so I thought that the one in Vegas would be comparable.  No, it's not.  The food here is basically a step above Il Fornaio but 2x as expensive.  I would probably have enjoyed my meal better if it had been more reasonably priced.  They start you off with a lot of fresh bread, fried zucchini, and some fresh bruschetta.  The best part of the start is when they bring a giant wheel of parmesan to your table and shave you off a little chunk.  This was delicious!  I thought this was a promising beginning but then each successive course sort of made me a little bit more disappointed.  The creamy fresh burrata I had to start was good and the portion was really large, but there wasn't any original or particular distinctively about it.  My boyfriend started with the fresh pappardelle in a meat sauce - I had a bite and it tasted pretty good to me, but my bf suspected that it seemed like the pasta had been microwaved since the temperature was so high.  For our entrees, I had the roasted whole branzino my bf had a lemony veal dish.  My fish was pretty good and very big, but I got tired of the same monotonous taste after awhile.  My boyfriend enjoyed his veal, but again, there wasn't anything special about it.  Service was very very fast.  Each successive course appeared within two minutes of the last one.  We were done with our meal in about an hour.  Our meal ended up over $250, which is similarly priced to a meal at, say, Babbo, but nowhere near as good or as memorable.  I would have been pleased with this meal if it had been about half the price, but as it stands, this place just isn't worth revisiting.

Co27fgIcv-RMkrEEP8t1iA.text: I have been to Il Mulino a dozen times or more over the years and haven't been in about a year until a week ago or so an I was really disappointed.  The 5 star service I was used to was still great, but not as good as the past.  The free appetizers were still really good, but everything else just wasn't as good.  I don't know if they got a new chef or just are buying not as good of ingredients, but especially for the price I would not be going back to Il Mulino.

CNW2DN4B0ztYMWttcINidQ.text: Full disclosure:  We have never dined here during dinner.  We have only gone during lunch when the tables are WIDE OPEN.  We don't know why this is, but at dinner, the place is packed like anchovies in a tin, yet at lunch, you can hear echoes in the place.  If you want great service and very attentive waitstaff, go at lunch.  It's the same menu.  When you sit down, you immediately get salumi, cheese, and a few other items to get your juices flowing.  Then you can order drinks, wine, or whatever.  (If you are like us, you order two drinks and munch on appetizers and more cheese before even thinking of a main course and wine).  The bolognese here may be the best in the country.  Yes, it's that good.  And second full disclosure:  We've been to the NYC outpost (the original) of this restaurant, and this place is a perfect replica.  We return time and time again just for the bolognese.  The chicken parmesan is ho hum, but that's about the only negative we can think of here.  Everything we've ever tried on the menu is prepared and executed and presented without flaw.  Skip dessert but do let the waitstaff get you whatever limoncello is in the jug today.  It may very well be laced with crack - it's that good.

QB2nkI8SdJGTnvGqXl7-pQ.text: The Porcini Mushroom Ravioli with Truffle oil was fabulous, just the perfect texture and flavor. My wife had the Branzino (Italian Sea Bass) with Spinach. The captain was very helpful in deciding from the numerous specials they had.

0xRkqyABw8uxye1VqMsYOw.text: Consistent old school italian in caesars.  Free appetizers help control check.  Nice wine list, good service and always excellent food.

7_dKSSLvo8HcT44Uu2Kw1w.text: TERRIBLE! DO NOT DARE DINE HERE!!! Rude, ignorant manager who was more interested in flirting with  a man at the bar than tending to a choking customer and party of 6.  My friend choked on a huge piece of grizzle in her veal (veal shouldn't have grizzle) and the restaurant staff did not call for emergency help! She was given the heimlich in the dining room by another in our party, and the staff was more ashamed that she was disturbing other guests than concerned for her well being. Once able to breathe, she continued to choke on the poorly prepared veal for two hours in the restroom. Entrees were removed before being eaten, and the staff proceeded to produce a $700 bill for the table before she even recovered from the choking incident. This supposed high end dining experience consisted of a fast food drive-thru level of customer service. There are too many wonderful restaurants in Las Vegas to waste your time and money at this joke of an establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grizzle that choked my friend at dinner
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grizzle that nearly killed my friend at this dinner, veal shouldn&#39;t have grizzle!!!

kvHSk0nk8Wq1p88Y73gseQ.text: Went there on 12/28/2015 for a belated birthday dinner...for me!  Heard excellent things from a colleague and decided to give a go.  Everything everyone else said about the appetizers; the cheese; the grappa...all True.  The appetizers come as soon as you sit down.  Lots of different starches- garlic bread; regular bread, bruschetta, etc.  There was a eggplant appetizer and salami.  All very good.  The Captain goes over the specials- all of which are not listed on the menu he hands to you after he's done describing a list of specials.  So...pay close attention otherwise you  have to ask him to recite it again.  I had the mushroom ravioli and my husband had the seafood medley pasta.  Both very good.  I wanted to try some of the other specials, i.e., duck, fish, etc., but because everyone said to try the ravioli I decided I should try it in case I never get back there again.  We ordered dessert... and they gave me another one for my birthday.  My husband ordered the tartufo which was very good.  I  never saw it cut in half so cleanly before.  I had the lemon sorbet- very refreshing and a very generous serving I might add.  The "free" dessert was the chocolate cake which while sounded heavy it was actually very light.  Service was impeccable.  We never really saw the Captain again after he recited the specials and took our order, but the other waiters were all readily available to "serve" at a moments notice.  I would definitely go back.

RQ288eG0lBqji1dxz_yCxg.text: One of the best fine dining experiences Ive ever had..  The service is beyond compare, the ambience is wonderful....quiet and cozy and so Italian.  The food is insanely delicious.   Before you even order they serve you some parmesan cheese cut off an enormous wheel, a selection of bread and foccaccia, salami and cooked zucchini.   We stayed in Vegas five days and ate here twice.  Loved it.

p7zscQyj9n7gI8q59iWk8w.text: This place is very expensive but it is worth it!   When you are seated, complimentary appetizers are brought out... a chunk of parmesan chisled right from the wheel, breads, bruschetta (I didn't care for this, was a bit soggy), a mussel, and my favorite, some zucchini concoction.  They were very thinly sliced, and I think sauteed or fried, with some olive oil, and served cold.  YUM.  There are little stoves set up at stations at various parts of the restaurant where they do some cooking, I guess finishing your dish because you can see and hear flames going up while you are there.  We started with the Caesar salad, which they made at one of the stations, it was great, one of the better Caesar's I have had.  (there was enough to split between two people)  For dinner I got the porcini ravioli with champagne cream sauce.  Amazing!  Hubby got the langoustines (grilled I think), which is kind of like a small lobster or large prawn.  I was afraid to order this, because I am picky about seafood, sometimes it is too fishy tasting for me.  Wow, I was pleasantly surprised!  They were tender and sweet, and the mushroom and pea risotto that was served with it was wonderful!  They make some of their own alcohol with fruit, I can't remember if it was brandy or not, and they also make their own grappa.  Unfortunately we had a show, so we were rushed and didn't have a chance to try it.  We will definitely be back on our next trip and make sure a show doesn't interfere with our dining experience!

BE2Wtc34mNCFCzR4PMfnwg.text: Food and service were impeccable! Can't wait to come back for more. Special date night with my man--he ordered a pink sauce penne pasta with chicken and I ordered fettuccine alfredo. My dish was the best pasta I've had. The pasta and sauce were so fresh and not too heavy. A perfect dining experience!

oQq99HCsIiP6s2VEaFo9NA.text: We had been to the other Il Mulino in NYC and love it and the one in Miami which is fair. I have to say this one was fair as well. The actual ambiance is terrible the restaurant being a high end restaurant that requires you to dress appropriately(no shorts or sandals) had a cold large buffet room. The appetizers are great as the classic Il Mulino gives you delicious complimentary cheese, salami, and eggplant appetizers. Those were good. We ordered the clams casino which were ok very small and more bacon. My husband ordered a veal piccata which was also ok. I ordered pasta vongole with clams in a red sauce. That was also fair. We ordered an orange sorbet that was delicious. The service was very good though. The staff Cleared the tables at the right time. Waiter was attentive and knew the menu.   Over all it was average, I was expecting and hoping for the NYC experience.

F79nL-6QB7in45jSgtqY0g.text: You enter an elegant dining room and sit down. Immediately, you are asked which type of water you prefer as a different server comes by and places a hunk of Parmigianino Reggiano on your bread plate. As soon as he leaves, another server comes by with a plate of fried zucchini as another with a bread basket with garlic and other varieties of bread. This is the perfect accompaniment to the fresh tomato bruschetta and broiled mussel that is just placed on your plate. Then you get the menu. Enjoy!

vwJ4i5R83Pu6IulgQW-wtQ.text: Simply the best in Italian food! I love the pre-dinner snacks of fresh parmesan that cut off the block for you, the fried zucchini, the meats & bread. My fav entree is the Dover sole- delightfully light & delicious!  No need for more dialogue it's just the best, make reservations!

T2MLKLLLRZM4yD-2KAy17Q.text: Amazing! First visit to this resto and I'll be back. The food was as delicious and satisfying as it gets. The service-impeccable and extremely attentive. Everything was perfect!! It is located in the forum shops at ceasars. It has a lovely terrace overlooking the strip. I can't recommend this place enough!

Lg2i3eoEbx1UoAXa362B0Q.text: I can tolerate bad food when there's great service, and I'll deal with awful service when there's amazing food.  But at Il Mulino, we paid $100/person for above-average food and below-average service.  You can do better in LV.  FOOD: Il Mulino starts you off with some tasty complimentary appetizers.  The parmesan cheese was great.  The bruschetta was decent, but I've had better.  The mussels were not fresh, but they're free.  None of the main courses wowed me, and at the price, they definitely should have.  The osso bucco ($48) was tender but bland, and came with a saffron risotto that was dry and gloppy, not creamy and luxurious the way it should be.  The lobster ravioli ($40ish) was overly cheesy and tasted nothing like lobster.  The veal chop (not sure) was totally dry and tasteless, like an overcooked pork chop.  The capellini with truffles and pancetta ($30) was the best main course, but I couldn't taste any truffle at all, so there was nothing too special about it.  SERVICE: Started great, ended pretty badly.  From the minute you sit down, servers swarm you and start throwing free food at you.  Awesome.  But our actual waiter was snide and inattentive.  When my mother asked him to repeat some of the specials, he scoffed, "Really? Do I really have to do that again?"  He forgot to bring out one of our dishes, which would have been forgivable had we been able to find him to tell him.  Instead, after taking our order, he disappeared for the rest of the meal.  We ended up grabbing a bus boy to get us our spinach.  Glasses went unfilled, plates uncollected.  I've had better service at Olive Garden.

zzhTlvUNhWaTUr7ehUVB1A.text: We celebrated my husband's birthday with dinner at Il Mulino. On their web site, Il Mulino boasts of world-class elegance but as far as ambience goes, I don't really see it standing out among other fine dining places on the Strip. We did enjoy the giant wheel of parmesan cheese being passed around from table to table and the staff being able to recite a long list of specials from memory.   They had complimentary bread and a side of zucchini, which were both way too oily. For our appetizer, escargots on mushrooms in a spicy tomato sauce. The escargots were tender although some had grit in them and doesn't make for a pleasant bite. The tomato sauce didn't do anything for me either. I had the roasted duck special with sweet potato mash and mixed berry sauce. The sweet flavors complemented the savory duck. The meat was moist but a bit on the chewy side. My husband had the bucatini and ordered a couple of glasses of Chianti Classico which they poured for us. I did notice that the wine bottle did not have the signature Chianti Classico black rooster seal. Not sure what to make of that. Anyway, the wine was OK so we didn't fuss. The bucatini was al dente and delicious. I have yet to meet bucatini that I didn't like. For dessert, we split the cheesecake. It seemed like a cross between cheesecake and pudding in flavor. It was surprisingly yummy. At the end of the meal, they offered us some grappa, which I would describe as Italian moonshine.

WE7D9jiYJcHKhcV0XeyRYw.text: If you are looking for a gastronomic orgasm, this is the place. We went there for lunch a few days ago and man the food was to die for! Service was excellent, the waiters are very courteous. Absolutely loved eating here, their pasta cooked in champagne based sauce infused with truffle oil is the best I have tasted so far. Food is a bit pricey, but what the heck, you are in vegas, instead of feeding the slot machines your money and inhaling all the dirty smoke you may very well put it here and enjoy food that is exemplary..

eG6RsNh_ynvCAmBdEANQug.text: So after all the walking and shopping inside The Forum Shops, I decided to hop on opentable and book a reservation for dinner in the area. I've always seen this place pop up so I figured "What The Hell, Why Not Try It Out Now" and boy am I glad that I did!!  II Mulino New York has officially made it to my "favorite fine dining" places to eat list! Looking for an elegant, romantic date night? Look no further! You can tell even before you walk in that this place really prides itself on exceptional customer service! From the time we walked in to the time we were wrapping up our meal, I can't think of one moment while dining that an employee didn't stop by and check on us. Our server was amazing, the staff who brings out the huge block of cheese was amazing, and even the person who was cleaning the plates off the table was great!    Since it was my first time here, I always like to pick the brains of whomever my sever will be to learn about the restaurant specialty cocktails and entrees. The menu had way too many good things to choose from but like the saying goes, "When all else fails, go with what you know" and I did exactly that! Our app/dinner selections were:  Complimentary Bread & Cheese  Oysters:   Pollo alla Parmigiana: Pounded, Breaded European Cut Chicken Breast Topped w/ Imported Cheeses and Marinara Sauce.   Pollo in Crosta 40.00 Chicken Sauteed w/ Lemon And White Wine Sauce In a Parmigiano Crust  Overall, everything was BEYOND exceptional and I really can't thank them enough for keeping that same level of service only an hour before closing! That speaks volumes to the moral of the management and team. I will be back very soon as I would love to dine out on their patio! Talk about VIEWS!!!!

tqFZQLEJkO9xVUv4F3wJ8A.text: Great restaurant, but extremely expensive for what you get. I LOVED the staff, the service & I thought the flavors in the food were great, but 50.00 for 4 ravioli??   I'm Italian & I know what goes into "fatto da mano ". ( hand made) but really?? Unless these raviolis were made by the hand of god ... they were overpriced.  Plus 90.00 for a cheep bottle of  Oscar bay wine?? That swill is 12.00 a bottle. (No I didn't drink it) I just noticed it on the menu.  I am all for nice,  fine dinning, but sucker punching clients with laugh out loud rip offs like 35.00 glasses of wine & ravioli that cost 50.00 is just more than I can tolerate.

Q9gixH6Mz-VuZV6CEi2V8Q.text: Ambiance and decor is beautiful, and service is excellent. However, the food was unimpressive and some of it was inedible. They greeted us by serving a large chunk of cheese off of a large block, and offered us a choice of three types of bread. The fried French bread was full of grease and very unsavory. I took a couple of bites and left it alone. They gave us complementary bruschetta, which was good. They also served some type of potato or eggplant dish, which was fried and reminded me of soggy French fries. We took a few bites and left the rest untouched. One of the servers cleared it later, and did not seem surprised that it was uneaten.   My husband ordered one of their specials, pasta with a bolognese sauce. It was good, but unfortunately made him ill by six the next morning. It was a combination of three types of meat within the sauce. I ordered the mushroom ravioli and ended up sending it back after one bite. I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo as a replacement, which was good, but I have had much better. We were disappointed that the restaurant is so beautiful with superb service, but the food was so poor we will not return.

LanGf2Cmk4T0VbFvf3goPQ.text: We enjoyed a wonderful dinner which included complimentary starters which was a generous slice of parmesan cheese...assorted breads... pickled zucchini.  I ordered the Brazino which was so moist and delicate which was deboned at the table and served with a lemon butter sauce....my husband ordered the double rib veal medium rare and prepared perfectly. Our host selected the veal parmesan which was enough for 3 people and a side of angelhair and marinara....outstanding. The service was impeccable and loved our captain Fernando....he was attentive, knowledgeable and ready to please...a very special place indeed...then to top it off a complimentary after dinner raisin grappa....a night to remember!

RZfbL8pokqDWj4YxPZqYag.text: This review has been long due.. I have dined here so many times and it's been amazing each time. Attentive and exceptional service, fantastic food and super awesome chef's complimentary appetizers like Parmesan cheese right off the wheel, zucchini chips, salami, tomato bruschetta and assortment of breads.  As soon as you get seated, before the menu is offered, you are treated to these amazing appetizers. My kids literally ask me to go here for the hunk of Parmesan cheese from the barrel.  Pasta is cooked a few feet away from your table, so it's served piping hot!! I love love that. I went for the vodka cream capellini with mushrooms and hubby chose the chicken Parmesan both were delicious! We also tried the 12 oz filet Mignon which was ok, the other Italian favorites are better.  The specials are on the pricier side, for eg mushroom ravioli in champagne cream sauce is $50, so better to ask the price of the special before ordering. They also charge split fee. For dessert we went for tiramisu which did not disappoint.  They also finish in style with complimentary grappa (alcoholic Italian brandy like beverage), apparently a digestif.. Perfect way to conclude a fantastic meal.

j9_5d78Tf7NUvyNGhMszXQ.text: Exactly what you would expect for a fine dining experience!  Quality service, great food, and cozy/romantic atmosphere to complete a perfect date night. This place is located in the Ceasar Palace Forum Shop. We came here on a Saturday night which was very crowded. We made sure to make reservations ahead of time and the restaurant also called us to confirm our reservation the day before.  They started us off with some parmesan cheese. I'm not a big cheese fan but their parmesan cheese was surprisingly good. They also offerred crackers, salami, in-house bread and fried zucchini. We ended up only ordering the main dish and drinks because their "pre-appetizers" were already plentyful.  I ended up ordering the lobster ravioli which was very mouth watering. It was rich and have just enough lobster that you can taste it all. The portion was quite large for me so  I'm glad I didn't order any appetizer.  I would come here again for the delicious food and awesome service. The waiters were tentative to us the whole time despite how busy they were.

MrdA3lupiJ1CDmqs77QP2A.text: Based on Las Vegas KTNV ABC 13 News, Darcy put them on blast on their Dirty Dining - ktnv.com/search?q=Dirty+... They came on Dirty Dining because they failed the county's health department inspections. They even said that one more failed inspection and they would get a review on future operations.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty sad for this fancy restaurant.  We actually left after the appetizers and paid for that.  They ruined our evening.

MQaO7twLLb_IHKMpMcR5gw.text: Fantastic lunch. They brought out a nicely prepared zucchini. It was like flash fried and sauteed. Some charcuterie meats and a wonderful langosta. The sommelier served me a nice Pinot. We had great memories of coming here before. Exceptional service My wife's ravioli in vodka was "amazing" according to her. We r definitely coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli was insane!!!

bxrRQGcnZp6SOPzIcqvRXw.text: Il Mulino is one of my all time favorite high end Italian restaurants ever! Dating back to my days in NYC. Had to take the wife here in Vegas for Valentines Day dinner. It was awesome! Impeccable and shall I go as far to say as perfect and attentive service. A bit too many off menu specials to take in, but I grasped onto the Rock Salt Encrusted Whole Branzino. A few complimentary appetizers is standard Il Mulino but was a pleasant surprise for my wife and other couple. My problem is, I want to try everything! Food and service worthy of the price. My only disappointment was my Old Fashion cocktail was made with soda water and not fragrant, smooth or flavorful.

Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Bucco

O9zODDcgrgyjTjnpzgN7GA.text: What a wonderful experience! Great attentive service and thoughtful wait staff. I love that they give several tastes prior to your entree/appetizer. That block of parm, I have dreams about. Also they are really nice if you ask for another chunk!   After going to Il Mulino several times, peak and non peak, the service is 100% regardless of how busy they are. Do plan on giving this place over an hour to eat at. This is a slow moment to enjoy the experience, not to shove food in your face and move on. Appetizer wise, the burrata and roasted red pepper was meh. I didn't like that there was only one slice of prochuitto. Entree wise, the clam pasta was just okay. There wasn't enough flavor from the clams, I found the garlic overpowering. Although those two dishes are advised to avoid, the salt crusted branzino is excellent. My most favorite dish here is definitely the squid ink pasta with crab. Giant pieces of crab and luscious cream sauce, no appetizer needed! Dessert is also great. Lemonchello tiramisu was fresh and light.  Price wise, it's as expected but you can clearly see where the high cost goes to. The wonderful staff, high quality ingredients, and beautiful ambiance. Would definitely go again anytime I'm in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata special appetizer. Pricey but great quality ingredients. Bell pepper and capers was interesting. Only one piece of prochuitto
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and clams. Honestly, I&#39;ve had better. Not a lot of clams. Just a lot of garlic.
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemonchello tiramisu. So light and citrusy. Great contrast to normal tiramisu

1QaDYotBVbBpCp8vdlDlPw.text: Where else to go to celebrate your 30th birthday other than Vegas?!? But I knew I didn't want the raunchy Vegas - I wanted an "adult" vegas. No hangovers, exquisite dining, and quality Vegas shows. This restaurant was highly recommended and we made reservations prior to dinner. This restaurant is nestled into the corner of the Caesar shops and just a skip and hop over from The Mirage. If I could imagine the most romantic, service-forward Italian restaurant - this is it.   This is TRULY a dining experience. Come hungry, and come ready to be serviced :) The meal starts with the legendary wheel of Parmigiano Reggiano and a few samples of appetizers. They really want you to enjoy the experience and take your time. They didn't provide the menus until after we had time to enjoy the cheese, bread, and appetizers which was SO refreshing. It's always nice to take time to reflect on the simple things in life such as fine wine, and the company of your friends.   The menu is sprinkled with traditional Italian fare and woven with house specials. We order a little bit of this and a little bit of that - you should too. If you're ballin' on a budget ... look elsewhere but if you have the cash to spend here .. do it. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pKYXtiygh8BOT3db6p-rHw.text: We had dined at NYC flagship location while our son was very young. All he remembered was the veal chop was the size of the Tennis racquet and the impressive free flow of appetizers!  Our son is all grown up and wanted to treat us to a nice meal. Both my husband and I now live in Vegas and this was our 3rd time dinning here.  The fried zucchini was a little soggy and chilled. However, the bruschetta was delicious.  We ordered fried calamari and clams oreganata for starters. Both were good. Main courses were Osso Bucco, Clams Vongole, Lobster Rivoli, Buccatini Amatriciana and Spaghetti Carbonara. The Osso Bucco was excellent but the risotto was kind of blend. Clams Vongole was tasty and so were the rest of the pasta dishes. Service was impeccable.  Overall, cannot be compared to their Flagship restaurant in terms of food and ambience...

Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

alRHRzjk77RdupbZfROrUw.text: Surprisingly underwhelming.  To start dinner, a wheel of Parmesan was brought to our table and the waiter cut two chunks for both of us. Great presentation, but the Parmesan we buy from Whole Foods is better. The Parmesan here didn't seem aged and had a soft texture.   The server then comes by, pours us a glass of water, and asks if we would like a wine menu. Our answer is of course "yes", so he says he'll bring the wine list.   Immediately following this interaction, small plates of food start coming out rather quickly. It was interesting. Could've been interesting in a good way, but it wasn't. All of the food that came out was SO COLD. It was evident everything delivered to our table was pre-made and had been sitting in a fridge. Everything was flavorful, but I couldn't get past the temperature.   So... four or so of these shockingly cold dishes come and go before our waiter comes back to our table. His first question, "What would you like to drink - a cocktail/wine?". I respond by stating we're still waiting for the wine menu. My statement was met with attitude from the server and he further asks if we're going to order glasses of wine or a bottle of wine.... I ask to see both options, but in my head I'm thinking wtf is going on herethere are so many people working with only a few tables seated and the service + food had all been subpar at best.   The wine list finally gets to the table and we put in our order for bucatini al'amatriciana and the veal chop. The bucatini is served with pancetta, not guanciale. The veal chop is massive.   For the price tag, I hoped to receive better service. The bucatini is nothing to write home about and the veal chop could have been better.

GAnOPndTaA6AyxIjcMrIOg.text: My favorite Italian restaurant anywhere and a Las Vegas Favorite!! Have eaten here multiple times when in Vegas. From the moment you walk in the service is as exceptional as the food!   I'll Mulino never disappoints.

9H90Wh_XAhl5B8YIFFSx1A.text: I think I enjoy Il Mulino in Vegas more than NY.  It's the same incredible food / impeccable service but with an incredible view of the strip & even better people watching clientele! It's 5 star food & service with free entertainment!! The staff always finds a way to make you feel special & the glass of grappa to end the meal sends you out the door energized!! Jet fuel...LOL!!

5tPIVUbo4jFUok1lRSAPyA.text: Maria and I love this place. Within three minutes of sitting down, there is this huge cheese wheel that descends upon the table where one of the servers carves off slices of cheese along with other appetizers that converge on to your table even before they take your order for food. This is a special place in Las Vegas, kind of hidden on the third floor of the Caesars Palace For him. If you want to special Italian dinner in Las Vegas, this is the place. We got the tip from our friends, Mike and Jessica, who come here regularly. Thanks Mike and Jessica for the great tip!

y3qh3ENLX9PBFrZCMCwurw.text: Incredible Food, stellar service. Kudos to the maestro for his fantastic hospitality. As for dishes, here is what I recommend:  Entrees: Branzino, Veal Valdostanna, Black Truffle Ravioli   Dessert: Tiramasu w/Cappuccino  Il Mulino and Andiamo are the two best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. Hands down.

J7tCtSYgNxAmb9aRHDLtJA.text: The food was exceptional and abundant. The service is what puts this place over the top. We've spent many meals at lots of nice restaurants over the years. This one has the best wait staff by far. Courteous, accommodating they served us at every turn without ever being intrusive on our anniversary dinner. They served us with a variety of options that were compliments from the chef. My husband said the flourless chocolate cake left him week in the knees. It really was that good. It was not very busy in there, but we believe that's due to their location. They are sort of hidden upstairs.

zyN_dqFAo3rpP_R-ElupGA.text: Not only was the food great, the staff was super friendly and welcoming. From appetizers to main entrees, the food did not stop coming. The pasta is cooked FRESH right in the back. Great experience.

4KbQKX-Qe9byUTABiNfqrw.text: Had the gnocchi special with pesto sauce.  Very good.  The restaurant is dimly lit which creates a nice ambiance.  Staff were all great, would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi Ai Pesto

KovlSiyUa-fncTJKh7zp4g.text: You have to judge a restaurant against what it tries to be, and what Il Mulino tries to be is an "experience".  A very expensive experience.  A very expensive experience with food that is only good, not great (with exceptions).    But Il Mulino does succeed is being an experience.  The decor is elegant and "rich".  The staff, for the most part, polished and proficient, but not fawning.  You start off with complimentary breads including garlic bread, bruschetta, grilled zucchini, fabulous aged parmesan cheese.  All this before you order.  And you end the meal with complementary grappa.  The meal is well paced, the clientele interesting, and the food "good enough".  Since the main course portions are more than adequate, and you are already half full from the freebies, you can probably skip the appetisers.  Listen carefully to the long list of specials, recited at breakneak speed (interrupt if you need to), because a lot of the good stuff is here.  The bronzini baked in salt is much like signature dishes in fine restarants in Spain and Italy -- spectacularly good.  All of the pastas are good; don't order half portions as they are almost the same price as full portions.  Some of the meat dishes are only ok.  The bill will be high -- about $100 a person with a glass of wine, tax, tip, and maybe a dessert and side dish.  But if this is what you expected from Il Mulino, you will go away happy.

_8zKBMWkoaaGjY3JabAmgg.text: Absolutely over the top! Wonderful atmosphere, delicious food. The service is exceptional. They bring Parmesan cheese, fried zucchini, mussels & bruschetta before you even order. The chicken piccata and lamb chops are scrumptious. The filet mignon honestly wasn't spectacular. Escargot was great!

pJHc1kh-ezW3V1n2joeYIw.text: We were so excited to go to Il Mulino. My friends have been raving about it for years. Maybe our expectations were set too high, but it wasn't the best of times . . . it wasn't the worst of times.   What we liked.    No attitude at the door was a real surprise! The hostess was genuine and warm and we were seated at our table promptly at arrival.  The captain and waiters are all so gentlemanly in True Italian fashion. They never missed a beat!   The antipasti and assorted breads were the best part of the meal. That hunk of parm was one of the highlights for me -- so creamy and fresh.  Please sir . . . I want some more!. The amuse bouche was a tasty bit of bruschetta and yummy oyster and that was followed by a small plate of salumi and some delectable zucchini. The breads were simply decadent, the garlic one in particular. I could have stopped here and would have been completely content.  But no . . .   My husband started with the calamari fritti.  He is a calamari afficionado and was highly disappointed. The calamari was a little rubbery and flavorless, and the sauce bland.  I had the special of eggplant rolotini which came stuffed with crab and shrimp and a little cheese on top. It was so-so. It could have been so much better had they stuffed it with some ricotta inside and had a tangier tomato sauce. For a main entree, my husband had the Veal Marsala which he claimed was good, but not great.  While the service was elegant and attentive throughout the meal, they seemed to forget us when it came time to pay the bill . . . I thought that was rather odd in the US, but not so odd for the Italians who don't offer you a check until you ask for it.  As I said, it wasn't a bad experience; it just wasn't as special as I hoped.

crPHTSp69qefagKevaevJA.text: Superb! Excellent! Unexpected service and the quality of food was unmatched by any other restaurant in Vegas including Gordon Ramsays. I highly recommend eating here for lunch or dinner.

1h4mCZHxM8g-7xKlSr2Tqg.text: WOW the best italian in VEGAS. I can fairly state that since I have lived here for 14 years and being from the east coast all I wanted to find was a good italian spot. Now this is on the pricey side, but the food is so worth every penny.  They always bring out a little appetizer with sliced meats and fresh cheese which I love. They also always end your meal with a little lemoncello, which is a nice touch.  I've ordered so many things from this place and have loved everyone of them! Eggplant Rolatini is to die for! I also had a papdelle pasta with a bolognaise that made my mouth water just looking at it. I've never been dissapointed with the food.  Why only 4 stars? Okay eveytime I have dined here I have gotten the same waiter.... he lists off about 30 specials they... half of them are on the menu, so i don't know why he describes them. The are litterally described word for word on the menu. So after he tells you 30-40 specials you can't even remember the first thing he said. he also really needs a mint... his breath is killer... makes me gag everytime. The good part is he does his rant for about 15min and that is the last time you see him. The bussers and his backup server does the rest.

CZhwSEzTkuXjUxXGxEmNtg.text: I guess we just didn't get it.  They chiseled off a hunk of parmesean cheese onto a plate. Not sure what we were supposed to do with that. Tortellini was bland and the bill was outrageous. With so many restaurants in Vegas, I think we can do better.

G8VezhZwZK5ZvBmw9zC4AA.text: I was going to give Il Mulino 5 stars, but the end of our dinner experience left a lot to be desired.  Off the bat, the hostesses were in on the little surprise I had for my two colleagues and they worked with me to execute it perfectly.  This was greatly appreciated!  And the assorted breads they initially brought out to our table... oh, these were the best breads I have ever had!  Fresh, buttered, and very flavorful.  They were accompanied by delightful little plates of fried zucchini and salumi.  One of the staff members went around with a huge, aged wedge of parmesan cheese and hacked off chunks onto our little plates, which we rather enjoyed.  Our food was near-perfect.  The calamari appetizer was done very well, though the amount of marinara greatly exceeded the available calamari.  I loved my porcini risotto which had the right texture and rich mushroom flavors, and my boyfriend's veal was probably the best veal I've eaten (we split our dishes so we could each get our grain and meat).  Dessert was delicious too.  5 star food.  The interior is not huge, but it filled up after 7PM.  White tablecloths and dark wood with higher ceilings and expansive views of the strip from the top floor of The Forum Shops gives Il Mulino a masculine yet intimate vibe.  They didn't seat anyone on the grand patio that day, but we could still see outside very well.  It was lively in there as there were at least two larger parties with a hint of drunkenness interspersed.  But overall it was very nice.  4 stars.    Complimentary grappa at the end was like hot jet fuel going down my throat.  The way they served it was fascinating: from a large urn-like container that was completely coated in a 1" thick layer of ice, they ladled it out into tiny glasses.  It was super strong.  The taste is nothing like the complimentary ouzo one gets at the end of a Greek meal, but it was served with the same generous spirit of "welcome and thank you for partaking in our meals."  Fumes rolled around in my head for awhile.  So why only 3* overall?  Two paragraphs:  The servers put on airs that I'm not a fan of.  It didn't help that our "Team Captain" of the servers acted utterly confused when I asked him if there were non-alcoholic house options (I was on meds).  He seemed mystified but apparently communicated well enough to the bartender because he brought back a delicious concoction containing  lemonade.  Still, the attitude of the servers was rather off-putting, and maybe they're used to serving rich foreign tourists because most of the fancy places we've been to don't have snooty servers like these guys.   Then the last half hour of our experience, the staff forgot us.  We were ignored after having been waited on very well for the first two and a half hours.  Look, Il Mulino, the last part of our meal is what we're going to remember the most, and it didn't help you guys just darted around us.  We had to actually raise our hands and say something for you to come over.  Second, the girl acted like it was a major inconvenience to split the check... and it was just four of us.  Do they not get conference-goers in town who are living on a per diem as paid by our individual companies???  Finally, nowhere did we see that they did not accept Discover credit cards.  Come on, a place like this doesn't accept Discover?? Not the staff's fault for being the messenger, but they should've put stickers up or something.  I'm glad we came here to try it, even though it's a chain, because the food was excellent.  I give it a lukewarm recommendation, but personally, I do NOT think that WE will be back, at least for dinner.  So many other places that probably give more bang for the buck.

nFGckDMfepg1bVBFDxd3og.text: Out experience at Il Mulino was nothing short of spectacular! Service was top notch (and we have dined at many top restaurants). Ambiance was petite and warm with a low hum of the patrons. Upon entering we were quickly seated and a gentlemen bearing an enormous wheel of aged Parmesan and a fresh bread selection. It was an impressive start of a meal we will never regret. Throughout the dinner, our table remained clean and staff were beyond eager to remove used plates to maintain a pleasing presentation as we ate. Cocktails were handmade and wine list was impressive. I had the pesce pomodoro with white wine sauce that was the most balanced dish of this type. My husband had the branzino (Italian sea bass) cooked to perfection, filleted table side and covered with a delicate lemon butter sauce that complemented the flavor of the bass so well. The portions were more generous than most high rated restaurants in Vegas. Even though we were already so full after eating most of our entrees, we still couldn't leave without dessert. I had the creme brulee (my favorite). It was creamy, sweet and the mandatory brulee crisp cracked perfectly. My husband had the tiramisu, it as well was made with flavor that wasn't too rich and the texture was ideal without it being soggy. Once we finished up, our leftovers were packaged neatly and more fresh bread included. The bill arrived, the prices overall were much more conservative than it's peers. A captain's tip along with a generous server gratuity was given and we were on our way. The only con I can provide is that this restaurant isn't 2,000 miles away. I could eat here every day and have the elite service consistently. Needless to say, we will be back here for another amazing dining experience next fall.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A delightful presentation!

gTtj384rS_Ys86FWYKh8gw.text: Fine dining at its best perfect wine great hospitality mi casa su casa family style very personable thank you Dennis Grazie!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fine dining 5 stars
