3Tsl21f5fmW5EY1IgLS3QQ.text: Il Mulino is our favorite upscale Italian Restaurant in Las Vegas!  Starting from the Host/Hostess, the table server and captain, to management, the service is superb!  Upon arriving, you are immediately served complimentary fresh Parmesan cheese, bruschetta and mussel, marinated zucchini and garlic toast.  The servers allow you time to enjoy with wine/cocktails.  The wine list offers an extensive variety of bottles and wines by the glass.  The menu is mouthwatering with an amazing selection of appetizers and entrees.  In addition to the menu, the table captain will make your stomach growl even more as he tells you the specials.  On our most recent visit, my husband and I started out with the shrimp scampi appetizer which was mouthwatering.  I had Dover Sole to die for!  My husband had whole fish Branzino that he says is the best he has ever had!  Their pasta and veal dishes are off the charts too.  And if you have room the desserts are a must!  And it doesn't end there, at the end of your meal the table server will offer you Limoncello.  If you want to experience Italian food at its finest, a trip to Il Mulino next time you are in Las Vegas is a MUST!!!

sDlibf3SefZdbhqOLCZ-nQ.text: Go for lunch. Better service and drinks than dinner - period - no discussion. One of the best lunches in LV. Split all orders. Take advantage of 1/2 orders of pasta to taste interesting menu items. Canaloni great. Eggplant Rolantini w/shrimp/lobster - killer. Mushroom risotto - da best Any desert - all outstanding Any house Grappa - always ask for this complimentary treat. House coffee - (wish I knew where to buy this coffee - seriously) Go back to hotel and take a nap.

OHPJvL7b4A7nq4NVHNu-Jw.text: This restaurant got my heart! We arrived almost 20 min late but they kept our reservation . From the host (Chelsea) to the waiters we received great service (polite and knowledgable). We asked for a table outside (with a great strip view) and they set it for us in 5'! The welcoming amuse bouche were a nice surprise. Our waiters were very nice and they present the menu specials with every detail (except of the prices!) also 3 waiters sang the "Happy Birthday" in Italian for my 3 years old daughter and she blowed her candle full of happiness!  We had a really nice experience at this restaurant and we definitely visit again!

I15d4oXlmJde38lTdtJinA.text: I was unimpressed. Nothing was outright bad, with the exception of getting something different from what I ordered. The whole dinner took around 3 and 1/2 hours which felt very long. Nothing was particularly fantastic. The bread was OK, the appetizers were fine, the entrees were standard, my cocktail had almost no alcohol but it was fine. I honestly don't understand the hype. I wouldn't go here again, I have had really good food on the strip and if asked try something different.

Dau5jtCFSYiMGQUPpGj2AQ.text: While we had a nice meal at Il Mulino I have to say that I am disappointed with our overall experience.  On vacation in Las Vegas, we decided to dine at Il Mulino Las Vegas. When we were ready to order, I had decided to get the mushroom ravioli. At the last minute I asked the waiter about a special he had mentioned.  The waiter proceeded to tell me about this amazing special including Parpadelle and white truffles.  The description of the meal went on for about 4 min. I decided I would try it and the waiter asked if I would like a small or large and proceeded to explain the small was very small.  I went with the large.  The meal came out, I ate my pasta which was OK, tasted like a fettuccini alfredo, and then the bill came.  I almost fell off my chair when we saw how much my meal was.  My pasta dish, which I declined to take the left overs (mistake), ended up costing $160 dollars! We were shocked. My son and husbands meals were around $50 each.  The mushroom ravioli (which was also a special)  I had originally decided on was $50. To find out that my meal was $160 was an absolute shock and I feel like I was grossly deceived by your restaurant.  When the average price on the menu is $40, it is your responsibility to inform your customers the cost of a meal quadruple the price. When I called the manager just to inform her that she should really tell the other patrons when a special is so expensive, she told me "it's a special" in the same sentence as telling me that the other specials were only around $60.  I gave Il Mulino a fair chance to redeem themselves for deceiving me and they failed to have any remorse over the situation.

PjAEMv4mP_9xsXzFW9zSqQ.text: What a disappointment! The starters of thinly-sliced zucchini and the garlic toast were soaked in oil. The breaded veal was quite nice, but the salad accompaniment had too much vinegar. The pasta was supposed to have a wine sauce, but it was a soup with wine. Il Mulino doesn't compare to Scarpetta, which is fantastic.

n84RXlPR8_Xdxt41ZzNjfA.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! Fantastic service, ambiance and food! The complimentary openers are delicious - the zucchini is like no where else! My favorite food items are the fettuccini alfredo  and the clams casino. My only complaint is that after we ate the freebies and each had a pasta appetizer we were so full we wanted to share an entree and I thought they turned their nose up a bit about that. But we did it anyway.

ugv1qgCxSn12NZaodq6b2Q.text: We visited a few years ago and were unimpressed.  We decided to give it a try again this year and were again disappointed.  Everything from a rude hostess to bad service topped with food that was mediocre at best.  The fried zucchini was doused with oil, the bruscetta was soggy, the sides were overpowered with what tasted like pre-jarred garlic. We were a group of 12 and not one of us was satisfied. Once the dinner was over, we waited at least 20 minutes for dessert to arrive with all incorrect coffee orders.  Certainly not what we expected on Christmas Eve.

TVu-9iXakpbDxyyaTI-rHQ.text: Seriously overpriced poor Italian food.  I'm fully aware that Il Mulino is a lettuce entertain you restaurant, and typically their restaurants are reasonably priced showcasing pretty solid food.    My hubby ordered a veal dish that he was pretty satisfied with.  I love the massive block of parm they bring to the table. I ordered the lobster ravioli that I was told is made in house.  There is no way in hell these ravioli's were made in house.  And if I am wrong, they should be ashamed of the quality and the taste.  They were VERY fishy tasting and the pasta was mushy.  Never mind the fact that these ravioli's came with a $50.00 price tag, I wouldn't pay $10.00 for these.   To top off this travesty, they give you house made grappa.  Nothing enjoyable about it.  Light some jet fuel on fire and drink that.  It's the same effect.

AGRCZJddLMkK1E-ybA1x4g.text: This is a beautifully appointed restaurant about as far from the taxi drop-off through the Forum shops that you can get!  By the time we got there, my feet were killing me and I was nearly perspiring and very parched.  The first contact is a guy with a huge chunk of parmesan from which he cuts off a portion for everyone.  Then comes a plate of bruschetta, mussels, breads, toasts, zucchini plate, salami, etc.  Warning: what kind of water do you want?  tap, still, sparkling, mineral?  We got still.  The 4 of us were charged $16.  It was good water.  Tea is $5.50.  Berrata salad $30.  Ravioli with champagne black truffle oil is $50.  2 pieces of caprese salad $26.  Split a carbonara and were glad we did because we were so full from everything else.  It wasn't that great though.  No peas in it; only onions.  They offer several specialty cocktails but they are all $15-18.  They do offer complimentary grappa at the end, if you can take moonshine!    So, the prices are outrageous but the food is very good.

pMyau3cbBdanIlkmvxDdsg.text: Only One Drawback!  Dine here without hesitation - across-the-board - the food is excellent and well-portioned - the service detailed and attentive - and the atmosphere is charming and intimate.  The only drawback is the pricey wine list. No matter what you choose - you're going to get gouged - and gouged hard. The mark-up here is extraordinarily high. Especially for the easy-to-find-anywhere simple Italian wines.  So since you're going to get gouged - because you are going to dine here - at least make your choice of wine interesting.

kP5DSrFzFd7yD42Du4NWBQ.text: I did not eat here, but stopped in for drinks after dinner . Our bartender  Robert was friendly and engaging.  They have a nice balcony area with a great view.   I have heard good things about the food, but have not tried it myself.

xKs3wHanIzhRxV2INhlKSQ.text: I went here recently ... they just moved some operations west from their amazing restaurant in New York (ilmulinonewyork.jp) .. we had a private room for 8... amazing cuisine.. including sicilian lobster, tri colore pasta, rack of lamb with 8 ribs! 28 ounce steak (a good meal to split), veal scallopini, ... incredible presentation on the food. Tremendous wine list. This is a fine dining experience! The service was fantastic except they forgot to actually prepare my meal... so they only get 4 stars, b*tches! (we were all so hammered by that point that I just split someone else's meal, it was cool) Extra pricey here.. but if you've just hit it big at the Craps table... check this place out!

OgFMeErJh1kPYA7I_yLsRg.text: My friends had been to this restaurant the previous year and had raved about it all year long. This year we made reservations for one of their birthdays. She was very excited, recounting the details from the previous year.  We arrived on time and were seated on the patio as requested. It was a very nice night and just captured the essence of Las Vegas. They immediately brought appetizers of fried zucchini and garlic breads to the table, as well as carved pieces off a very large chunk of parmesan. These were all very delicious. I had a wonderful arugula salad, and my wife had the prosciutto and cheese appetizer that was magnificent. For the main course I had the lemon veal. It was mediocre at best. My wife had the ravioli that we all agreed was no better than the Costco bulk ravioli (which is still good). During the course of the meal I had to ask several times to have my water refilled (this is not usually a big deal, but when they charge thirteen dollars for a bottle of water, I shouldn't have to keep reminding them that I'm thirsty). After bringing us our meals and making a quick trip around the table, our entire wait staff disappeared for over half an hour. Leaving our party and another couple alone on the patio. Going through the wine list, the waiter was continuously pushing a bottle that we weren't interested in. I checked on my phone and found that this bottle that they attempted to sell us for $215 retails at Vons for $22. Needless to say we didn't choose that one. We did choose a bottle that was good (I can't quite remember the label, but it paired very well). By the time we had finished, we were unsatisfied with the restaurant and went elsewhere for dessert.  No part of the restaurant, the food, or the service was awful. However, the combination of those when compared to the amount of money being spent made it a bad experience. We spent over $150 per person. For that amount of money I expect exceptional service and incredible food. I experienced neither mediocre of both. If you have money to waste, give it a try. But if you want a great high class meal, look elsewhere.

kIqYvcU-PZIhNUDwKECYjQ.text: I have been coming to Las Vegas for years, and last year we went to this restaurant for the first time.  We went back again on our latest visit a couple of  months ago. I had made a reservation for 8:30PM, and called at 5 to see if they could seat us earlier, and they were so accommodating they found us a space at 6:30.  I can't tell you how much we love this restaurant.  the staff is very professional and polite.  the appetizers they bring out while you are looking at the menu is enough to fill you up.  They give you a chunk of aged parmesan cheese, salami, bruschetta, and this fried spicy zucchini that is to die for.  I always eat way too much before I have even ordered.  the pasta dishes are huge, fresh and some are prepared at a table by the front door so you can watch. There is not a dish I wouldn't want to try, and unfortunately I can only order one entree.  The desserts are also amazing.  Please don't miss eating here if you come to Las Vegas, I have been to dozens of high end restaurants here and this is one of the best you will find.  I am going back in December, and will make my reservation well in advance this time!  Buon Appetito!

nKK7HLbpGoSCnbh4-sNWEw.text: This place is hands down the best Italian restaurant I've ever had the pleasure of eating at.  It was a class act from start to finish.  Tuxedo clad waiters seated us promptly upon arriving and brought a round of appetizers shortly there after including aged parmesen cheese cut directly from the biggest wedge I have ever seen. We also ordered a fantastic eggplant appetizer that was a special for the day. I enjoyed the porcini mushroom ravioli with a champagne truffle sauce as my entree and it was amazing. We ended our lunch with the tiramisu and the tartufo. Both were excellent. Afterwards we were offered complimentary grapa. I can't wait to return!

sAA3xQwZ8OBfhQDpA0dbGg.text: Not too ecstatic about this place.  We were there fairly late in the evening on a Sunday, place was packed.  With the starters and cocktails we were off to a fantastic start.  My girlfriend had the carpaccio, I had the spinach salad.  We loved these. However, for entrees both of us were disappointed.  The lobster ravioli was fairly light and ok tasting but nothing special.  My girlfriend said it tasted exactly like the lobster ravioli we get from Costco, definitely nothing to write home about.  I had the Dover sole special. The preparation and smells coming from this were amazing.  My grumble here was the prep was done the other side of the room, table side would have been memorable.  The fish was mushy, not firm and delicate, as I was expecting.  As well it had very little taste and too many bones.  The wine selection/service by the sommelier was a disappointment to say the least.  Overall compared to other fine italian restaurants I have eaten at(Cafe Juanita, Bartolotta etc) this one is low on the list from this experience.

xgQxe9rtF2lWcP3yMgk8Og.text: Just an incredible dining experience. I was very impressed being an Italo-American and used to the best italian food. Can't wait to try the NY spot.

riWOAcd7Ye0hntcBhr6rBg.text: We had an absolutely delightful dinner.  The food was delicious, the service impeccable, and the atmosphere warm and inviting.  As soon as you're seated, delicious tidbits start appearing on your table.  Can't recommend it highly enough.

xprp8YM6gAUs9NVDj3hqhw.text: Great restaurant.  Unless you get an expensive bottle of wine, the price is reasonable as well.  Everything from meat, seafood, pastas, and appetizers are all great.  I had the luxury of decanting my bottle of wine after a win at the tables.  They will do it with a nice bottle of wine.  Although...the 'nice' means expensive and expensive at a restaurant means x4 wine shops.  However, if you are on a trip to impress a lady or with good company, and have some cash to burn, it's worth it.

XDqQ4Z5hY9K5VvE9dhB9fQ.text: Myself and a party of 10 others had dinner here last weekend. The reservations were made by a hotel concierge while we were at the pool so no research was done prior to this.   I would say the things to note are this: 1. the parm cheese and appetizers they bring out are complimentary and delicious 2. the wine list is quite pricey 3. they ask you if you'd like bottled water or sparkling water upon sitting down - THIS IS NOT FREE - we got charged for 8 bottles of water at $8 a pop and never did we see them opening the bottles at the table which leads to a suspicion that they might be getting filled up in the back  w/ a lesser quality bottled water (hopefully I am wrong). Curious if there is a free tap water option. I recommend asking. 4. there are a ton of specials the waiter rattles off that are not on the menu so bring your listening ears 5. the food prices were reasonable - $20-$40 range for most 6. there's plenty of food to share a meal with someone, especially after all the appetizers 7. I ordered Spezzatino di Pollo alla Romana - I was not impressed. The flavors were so-so and the artichoke pieces still had a good enough portion of the leaf on them that they were inedible as served. I spent at least 5 minutes trying to chew the first piece I mistakenly put in my mouth because I didn't want to spit it into my napkin.  I wouldn't go back again on my own, but would not be upset if someone else took me there.

7Ij5JmHuM-LQxT7bZ-FFDg.text: Yet another Las Vegas incarnation of a "big name" restaurant that is all name and little game. My wife and I and our friend are all business exex in our 50's and were in Vegas for business. We reserved a table via Open Table (hey maitre d, shouldn't' that have been a clue that we were not a group of dimwits from some small town who think Michelin stars have something to do with tires?) We arrived promptly for our 8pm table, dressed in fashionable (read as expensive) jeans and such and of course my wife was flashing her 5 carat canary diamond ring. The hostess greeted us and noted that she would ask the maitre de what table to seat us at. He gave us the once over and she lead us to table 23, which is a four top in the middle of the room, which was about 2/3 full. There was a nice table against a window that was much more private and the hostess was taken a bit aback when we asked for it. My wife commented that we did not appreciate being given a crappy table, but that's Vegas: lots of ass, but little class. When we got to the table we wanted, the hostess had the lack if insight to comment that some people ask for tables in the middle of the room. Sure they do, just like people assigned to aisle seats on their flights ask for middle seats. The hostess did seat us and in the midst of her all attitude, no gratitude hissy fit, I told her that "we did not just get of the bus from Omaha and we expect the same level of service as your NY location".   So, big deal, they give you some "free" apps: nice sliced zucchini, a chunk of decent Parmesan, bread and some bruschetta. The drink taker had almost no clue about the wines by the glass other than genius remarks like "it's tart" or "it's light". Somehow, he kept steering us to the pricier wines. BTW, their wines were $14-$27 per glass. I settled for a $16 Sauv Blanc that was marginal. I then ordered a $14 Chianti that was equally average. Overpriced wine is another clue that a restaurant is all about money, not honey.   This part is the worst. My wife and friend asked if a single Caesar was large enough to split and asked if they could split a half order of pasta. Waiter: "why yes, of course"..... Check comes and these thieves charged for 1 1/2 salads and for a full order of pasta. Liars!  Next one really pissed me off. My wife and I wanted to share a chicken entree, but the waiter, I mean thief, said that it was a small portion, so I ordered another entree for me. Guess what? The dish was more than adequately large for sharing. Liars! And guess what else? Both her bird dish and mine were marginal as in dry and salty. But then I guess most of their customers were raised on Burger King and Mickey D's so they think dry, salty polity is the bomb. Of course, we didn't do our job and send our dishes back. My policy is often to take the route of why make a bad experience worse.   Bottom line: eat the apps and feign illness.... Leave a tip to cover their trouble and go elsewhere.

P_XmqPoQUjE0yDCTCwM2nQ.text: I was on the fence for a 3 star verse 4 star review here. It really was a wonderful meal and dining experience so I went for the 4 stars. The only thing is how overpriced it is. I ate alone, for lunch, on a Tuesday while shopping at The Forum Shops in Caesars. I literally could have made a meal out of the "starters" they give you - fried zuchini, wedge of pamasan cheese, garlic bread and sticks, and brushetta and salami. All of that was so tasty. Because all of that came with my meal I didn't mind that my lunch entree was $36. I definitely think that is overpriced though. It was paparadelle in Bolognese sauce, very tasty! I was also a tad annoyed that I was charged $7 for water and then I asked for an iced tea and that was $8. Also, when I went to leave the tip, on the receipt it had a spot for a tip and then also a tip for the table "Captain" - I never heard of that before. So I wound up giving both of them a tip and my grand total for lunch, just for me by myself was $71! It was good and the service was wonderful so I can't complain. Plus I did want t o splurge on something nice. I probably won't go back next time I am there though because I think that you can get just as good food for less. Plus I hate that $7 water tactic.

bICM0OLO1Id981yCFaGizA.text: Had dinner there two nights ago and was looking at the reviews today.  I understand where people are coming from and I'm at a disadvantage because I don't have too many other Vegas restaurants to compare it too.  It is a fairly upscale place in the Forum Shops of Caesar's Hotel.  The service is top flight.  The moment you sit down they are on you with fresh parmesan cheese, garlic bread, sliced salami and fried zucchini.  I had dover sole in butter and lemon sauce that was very good.  They present it to you at the table before they debone it and serve it.  Fancy, I guess, but hardly necessary.  It was way better than the dover sole at the Caesar's buffet I had the next night.  My wife had a baseball cut filet mignon that was good but a little overcooked.  I can't really blame the restaurant.  I keep trying to tell my wife they need to be medium rare to medium at most and she insists on telling them medium well which usually ends up being well.  This is a sure way to kill a great piece of beef.  The caesar salad was ok and the wine, while good, was overpriced.  My wife ordered a tartufo for dessert which we shared.  Now I'll claim ignorance about what a tartufo is.  What they served us was like a giant bon bon, cut into fourths, arranged on a plate with whipped cream and those little cookies that are shaped like pencils.  Anyway, whatever it was it was pretty good.  We finished the evening with something called lemoncello which I've never had before.  Another couple with us were from New York and the wife was an Italian New Yorker.  She said it was a licor made from lemons and vodka and was traditionally served at the end of an Italian meal in New York.  So there you have it.  The meal ran about $200/person but we had three bottles of wine.  Still, everything in the place is a la carte and it's not for those on a budget.  I enjoyed my meal but it sounds like most  reviewers felt the same as I did about the place.

MB6LviQoibqxLi01k7vWyg.text: Skip it. Really not worth it. Over attentive but inefficient service. Yeah, I know. Sounds weird, but it was. Waiter even passed a bigoted slur on his staff. Manager tried to bail us out from of mess of problems. AND, got really sick within an hour.

3B0khGI6jMDRRqtaHZV4Pg.text: Solid dinner here on our last night in Vegas. I've never been to the NY location so this was a real treat. As with most Vegas restaurants, the atmosphere is lacking but here the food and service were pretty top notch.  We were seated and given some yummy complimentary apps- a nice change of pace from most dinners now where you get charged just for a bread basket!   We ordered: An appetizer special- figs stuffed with cheese, wrapped in prosciutto w/ a balsamic glaze- super tasty!  Their signature Ravioli stuffed with mushrooms in a creamy truffle sauce. Yum! Totally delicious. $50 was a bit insane but I'm glad I indulged this once  Their special Lobster Ravioli- good, nothing too amazing, I've had comparable ravioli elsewhere so not work the $48  The Tartufo desert-good, simple chocolate & vanilla ice cream sphere with a hard chocolate shell and whipped cream.  Not sure I'd go again because of the price but I'm glad I experienced it once. This is a "can't go wrong" Italian spot if you're ok with the price point. Also, once thing to note that was odd is that when the bill came there were 2 lines for tip- one for the Captain's Tip (basically our main waiter) and then a separate generic tip. There was no explanation given so I took the tip I wanted to give and split it 50/50 on each line. This kinda rubbed me the wrong way. Was the other tip for the busboys and other servers who came with the drinks, appetizers, etc? My husband referenced a Curb Your Enthusiasm episode where something very similar happened with Larry and I immediately related.

UOxAjlYwrVclJ8ouNePa-g.text: The food was good. Not great. The service, especially before your "real food" is awesome. After, however, it was a mix of hit and miss. Then the check comes. Your waiter, or as they call it, the captain, is added and called out for a special tip??? For telling us the specials. I guess I'm too much if a pushover as I fell for it, but immediately felt violated.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5wYOS60DkjI8NcGW9P2wzQ.text: I only have one quarrel... They don't allow outside wines. I thought it was strange, even without considering a corkage fee.  However, it was phenomenal. I couldn't been more impressed with the service and the food. There was multiple complementary items - starters, dessert wine, dessert, and champagne.   We ordered the beef carpaccio, the artichoke hearts, and caprese to start. I would highly recommend the carpaccio then the caprese. I didn't care much for the artichoke hearts with bacon - I feel like it wasn't incredibly impressive on taste and hitting multiple flavors of the tongue.   For an entree, I ordered the saltimbocca. It was a toss up between that and the lobster ravioli with a truffle sauce, which my friend ordered. Both the saltimbocca and the ravioli were phenomenal. Probably the best saltimbocca I've ever had, and I've had a lot of saltimbocca.   As far as the price is concerned, I felt the wine is overpriced, but I didn't have a problem spending $130 for a bottle of The Prisoner, which you can get in the store for $40. And overall price - no problem with at all. It was less than 100 bucks a person, which is pretty good, in my opinion.   Overall, great place. Don't take your own wine. Enjoy the service, it's nearly impeccable. Cheers!

-3kVuVKC5MJtzK9rwBTwmA.text: This place is INCREDIBLE!   If you enjoy the full dining experience, you will really enjoy II Mulino New York. When you sit down they bring around this giant block of parmesan and give each person at the table a piece. Then they take your cocktail order without giving you menus. They also bring you delicious bread and different assortments of appetizers. This is ALL before bringing you the menu. You get to relax and socialize with friends/family before you start thinking about what you are having for dinner, this is so different from what many of us are used to.  The staff was amazing, very attentive, funny and knowledgeable. The food was great, and the limoncello was one of the best I have ever had (house made)

JVeXIYJdzZKNB6S_q89Klg.text: As long as you are prepared to pay, you will not be disappointed in anything! Service is outstanding! Table captain was excellent at making suggestions. My Dover sole was amazing and my husband loved the veal piccata. Each of us started with a salad (I had the Caesar and he tried the spinach). We thought they were great. You must try the cannoli for dessert!! It's impossible to leave hungry!

9_-F4TdYhmhGUlmv6xmgmA.text: I have been to a lot of restaurants in Las Vegas. I have been to a lot of Italian restaurants all over the world. I have to say that this was one of the most pleasant experiences I've encountered in a long time. The service from start to finish is impeccable, and the complementary dishes, bread, cheese that they continue to bring to your table while you make your decisions was incredible.  I had the veal marsala which melted in my mouth, my friends had different pasta dishes which they both enjoyed as well. We shared a trio of dessert which was enough for three of us to split and be very satisfied. They also have an extensive wine list which will please leave in the most discerning wine drinker. I will be back here often, and recommend to colleagues and friends without a doubt.

J3nD72LnMS1FXES7Ha8DZw.text: Easily the best italian food I've had outside of Italy. The service is outstanding. You have the captain (the dapper older gentleman whose name escapes me) who rattles off a few dozen mouth watering "specials", a waiter who is especially attentive and the best when it comes to dessert and the bus boys that make sure your water is filled to the top every time you take a sip.   I've been to this restaurant a few times and each time I leave feeling satisfied and happy. They have a full bar and good italian wine selection. They bring to your table an assortment of "goodies" courtesy of the chef. You always get a chunk of delicious parmesan cheese and a basket of warm tasty soft and crispy bread. This time they added lightly fried zucchini and garlic bread. This is all before you've even seen the menu.  We started with this shrimp and crabmeat rolled in eggplant and it was outstanding. I had tried it before and insisted we order it since the spouse wasn't with me last time. Amazing. Even if you're not an eggplant fan. The captain explained that since they cook the eggplant twice (first fried - then baked) it takes away the bitterness of the eggplant. The spouse got the ravioli special with mushrooms and truffle sauce. It was amazing. I tried the chicken with asparagus, mushrooms, artichoke (hold the peas) and it was heavenly. My all time favorite though is the pasta with braised short rib which wasn't a special this trip or on the menu. I guess I could have asked if they could have prepared it for me but I wanted to venture out and try something new.  We got this orange thing for dessert. The waiter went and selected all this amazing looking fruit and assembled it right in front of us. Poured a healthy amount of liquor over the whole thing. Delicious.  Overall, it's a must try if you are anywhere in Vegas. You'll be glad you did. Make a reservation as the place is relatively small and in high demand.

yp78P6KQ3LiK_0L3t9x8gA.text: Every time its amazing food, tradicional service, elegant, and amazing pastas , papardelli a bolonhese, stuffed ravioli, eggplant parmigiana. Oh my good!

S4miHdah8L9miZ5XWDVRgQ.text: This place is too stuffy and formal for Vegas.  I went here to dine with a few close friends last time I was in Vegas and we just felt uncomfortable the entire time.    My friend decided to wear a polo shirt and shorts which apparently is a huge No-No; the hostess gave us a stern warning and told us that normally we would not be allowed to enter - but she made an exception this time.  She should've added that along with the one-time exception, the wait staff would up their game accordingly, to make the dining experience that much more uncomfortable.   We were seated, at which point we met the most bizarre waiter I have ever encountered.  He had the personality of a finely polished ball of Italian marble and seemed entirely unable to relate to any type of human experience.  His main goals in life seemed to be to bask in the glory of a 200 lb wheel of Parmesan cheese that he brought to our table; and get us out of the restaurant as soon as possible.  Our waiter asked for our drink order immediately and either did not understand the concept of a drink menu and/or was extremely put out by having to bring it to us before we decided on drinks.  Based on his.. personality? I think it was more the former.    I'll add one quick thought on the food:  Good but not worth the prices they were charging - especially with this incredibly bizarre service and stuffy environment.  Also, I guess my veal marsala was "too refined" for a side of noodles or any other type of side dish accompaniment.    I should add that Il Mulino also has "captains" which apparently are some type of waiter team leader.  Captains also fully expect a tip - as seen by a tip line for both our waiter and the captain.  Good luck on how to tip in his fashion as we had no idea.  I would only recommend this place to amateur social scientists on the off chance that you might get our waiter.  Watching him interact with humans -  as if it was the first time ever for him - was a truly unique experience.

K1vul0flxaC_of89xtSTlA.text: Amazing! Service and food were excellent. Honestly, I always passed by this place and thought it looked small, must not be that special. But went here for date night the other day and oh my goodness I was amazed. So romantic! As soon as we walked in, the decor was exquisite, each table had a single fresh red rose and a real candle that illuminated the dimly lit room. Each time I passed by a server/runner they always said "Bellisma, please, bellisma!" which I only could imagine was an endearing/polite term. Everybody was so nice and genuine and I loved the Capitan! It is very unique how the Capitan delivers the specials verbally and he was so charismatic. The view was stunning and I have never had Ossobucco taste as good as theirs in my life.. It was even better than my mother's ossobucco, and that says a lot. Price was cheaper than I had thought, we also had the chocolate cake with coffee and it tasted extremely rich but the texture was so light and airy... I bit into it and I would order it a thousand times again. The oysters were fair, good but not extraordinary compared to others I have had. We also got the pasta with clams, scallops, octopus... I forgot what it was called but that tasted great! The sauce was very light but flavorful enough, there were more than enough seafood too. I hate when there is never enough seafood but they were so generous with it. At the end, they brought us at grapa (if I spelled that correct) and I thought that was really unique as well, it helped with the digestion so we did not feel too full when leaving. I loved the overall ambiance, so romantic and professional and the food matched my 5 star rating as well!

c1AymQPlzsl9q-VLXJ3sFw.text: The restaurant is located in Caesar's Palace and has a nice decor. My wife and I had dinner reservations at 6:00pm on February 17, 2018 and arrived timely.  We were seated promptly. We told our waiter, immediately upon sitting down at the table, we had 7:30pm tickets for Elton John concert - also at Caesar's Palace. We were clear that we did not have time to dilly dally. The waiter did not concern himself with our time constraints. He took an exceptionally long time before taking our dinner order and did not bring our food to the table until 7:20pm, despite our repeated requests that he speed things up, so we would not be rushed eating. We only had a minute or two to eat before having to leave for the concert and wound up leaving most of our dinner on our plates. What we ate tasted good, but the overall dining experience was sub par. Later in the evening, I called the restaurant and spoke to the manager about our experience. She told me over and over that our waiter has worked for the restaurant for 13 years and has a good reputation. She also told me the restaurant was extremely busy this evening and that's just the way it goes on busy nights. Plan accordingly if you plan to dine here.

bf7Q5Lh4GxvALiDvtsLWGA.text: I had no idea this place was even here until I was looking for a new Italian place in Vegas.  3rd floor of the Forum shops at Ceasars ( the only place that has managed to survive here is Sushi Roku- its not a prime location) What a great find! This place means to feed you from the moment you walk in as several complimentary appetizers are served upon being seated. The menu is extensive and there is also a list of running specials not on the menu  ( the mushroom ravioli was on the specials and was wonderful)  Service was great and mindful without being disruptive to the meal. Will be back for sure

Q_7QzNKKXkN374nrJ37hww.text: This place is a HUGE rip off! They are a little overpriced to begin with but not unusual for Vegas. We live in Fairfield County in Connecticut and we eat at some of the best restaurants around. I am Italian and know good Italian food. That being said, this place is average as far as Italian food. The veal oso bucco was a little dry. The risotto was pretty good. My wife's ravioli were good. The bigger issue is the cost. These dishes were both specials and the prices were not revealed when the waiter gave them to us. I never expected them to be priced so much higher than anything else on the menu. $50 for porcini mushroom ravioli???? $60 for veal??? This was crazy! You should never charge that much more for specials and not disclose it. Ravioli are never that much with lobster meat let alone mushrooms! Stay away from these jokers.

VPoB7gdoem82onGEXkg-rQ.text: This was my second visit to Il Mulino in 3 months, and I had a much better time this visit than my first, notably because of the service - the food was perfection both times. Our Captain the first time was unfriendly and pretentious. This time, our Captain - Wabi? - was extremely friendly and personable, as was Peter our main waiter and the additional staff that presented and cleared dishes.  My recommendation is to pay attention to the (very long) list of the day's specials and order from that menu because the dishes are more unique than the regular menu, which has your basic Italian staples. The list that the Captain rattles off is a little hard to remember, but if you have a good one, he'll repeat it. Also enjoy the starters of freshly grated Parmesano, bruchetta, and antipasti, but try not to fill up as much as you'd love to. I'm not a wine drinker, so I recommend the Lucrezia Borgia cocktail. I've had excellent Pappardelle with cinghiale, arugula salad, burrata, and eggplant with risotto dishes here. Absolutely every dish has been amazing, although the portions are HUGE. I wish I lived in LV so I could take my pasta home for later. :(   My mother was celebrating her 70th birthday and specifically asked to dine here, and they were so very nice to her and brought her a dessert (fabulous as well!) They also typically have complimentary Grappa but this night had housemade Limoncello that I actually enjoyed more than that I've had in Sorrento.  This experience redeemed Il Mulino for me, and I'll absolutely, 100% return the next time I'm in town, although I still think asking for a separate Captain's tip is absurd.

0Ver4jBgK1mfLTZH8k-RRw.text: I love this restaurant. You're full before you even order your appetizers. Staff is wonderful and the food and wine always on point.

UjON_-0ajtMJsx1Ws5HiEQ.text: We booked this restaurant for our anniversary celebration in Vegas based on the reviews here. And seriously. It didn't disappoint. In fact, it surpassed all of our expectations.   First, the ambiance is perfect for a romanic dinner. The decor has a sort of old world feel that makes it seem like you've been transported to Italy. The lighting is dim, not too dark where you can't see your food or your date, but just enough to set the mood. As soon as you sit down, you are greeted with food. A big hunk of cheese, salami and some fried zucchini. I didn't tell my husband about this part ahead of time and he was super excited. Next came the bread and a taste of the most delicious bruschetta we'd ever had. I wanted to eat it all but I didn't want to fill up before even ordering my main.   We both settled on pasta with vodka sauce. My husband got the lobster ravioli and it was filled with huge chunks of lobster. It was so delicious. I got the gnocchi and had a religious experience while eating it. They were perfectly delicious little pillows of yumminess (yes, that is a technical term).   I didn't think we'd have any room for dessert, but I couldn't turn down a cannoli.  I love cannoli. While we were eating our dessert, the waiter came by and gave us a sample of grappa. Not for the faint of heart, grappa was described as Italian moonshine. And that's the best way to describe it. They say it helps with digestion so I gave it a try. While I can't speak to that, it certainly helped end dinner with a bang.  The service was also impeccable from start to finish. I highly recommend Il Mulino if you are in Vegas for a special occassion and don't feel like fancy French food or a giant steak.

uZtMqmcl0bT19nKkBPk7sg.text: Delicious! It has everything you want in a great Italian restaurant. The wine list is fantastic, the meal, and desserts are wonderful. The service is impeccable. I've been here a couple of times and I have never been disappointed. My favorite was when they brought out the giant wheel of cheese and chiseled a few fresh pieces off...loved everything about this place!

H_L6Dkowohost_N9NyJi6A.text: I really enjoyed my porchini mushroom ravioli, they were delicious. My mother-in-law's lobster ravioli were also very good. My husband liked his langustinos from a special menu, but said next time he would order my porchini mushroom ravioli. My father-in-law's osso bucco was good, but I had better in other restaurants. Unfortunately, his side dish - saffron risotto was badly overcooked (Gordon Ramsey would throw it in the face of whoever cooked it). Besides, nobody told us that it would be saffron risotto -- not all people like it, and it is important to highlight that it is not just a risotto, but heavily infused saffron risotto.   My sister-in-law's special order was delicious! She got herself veal marsala with some linguini. Pasta was cooked perfectly and veal was very tender, covered with tasty mushroom sauce. Strawberry mojito ($15) was very nicely made. You could feel fresh fruits with mint and quality rum.The drink was so good that I ordered it again, and if we stayed longer I would order third without any hesitation.  Now, the negatives. Do we have to sit and listen for 10 minutes while the "captain" is listing all the specials they have? Honestly, I have never had to sit through such a long list of specials, it was a little bit ridiculous. If you have that many specials, please print them out on a separate piece of paper, and if someone want a more thorough description the "captain" can verbalize it. Do not bring any free dishes if they are not good. With a bill of over $700 for 5 people without any appetizers I expect better than oily zucchini. Cheese was good (more of it please), brushetta was decent, but cold cuts and zucchini were not good at all. Just skip mediocre free food, do not even serve it.   I would definitely return, but be very careful with what I order. Go for their specialty, do not experiment too much.

_BRM7nW7O3X49lSoUmS6Ew.text: You have to either visit Vegas or New York to experience the best foodie experience of your life . It is hard to imagine we would not have partaken in this opulent dining experience had we not signed up for the owners' meeting at the Marriott Grand Chateau .  Fortunately , the staff graciously excused our ordinary dress code.  A reservation is a must- we dined early at 5 pm . The atmosphere was intimate and intoxicating at times . The captain and his staff, including Ciro, Tremente, Edwardo, Suarez, Tyler, Scott and Denis presented us with unexpected , delicious treasures throughout the meal, including chunks of fresh parmesan cheese, cold sauteed zucchini, bruschetta, to a variety of baked breads and capping off the evening with a white raisin brandy tasting .  The captain introduced many lovely specials and highlighted his favorites from the main and theatre menu .  Our taste buds were popping all night and all four of us agreed that this was our most favorite dining experience in years.  It is literally tucked away on the third floor in the Forum of Caesars so many may miss this amazing foodie experience . The beverages were superb including my Aprel spritzer and my husband's Meiomi Pinot Noir. I rate them a 5 star plus +

DsJqaflBNV0i6FHXCJmzmw.text: This is, undoubtedly, the best Italian restaurant I've ever enjoyed and I've enjoyed many.  I would be surprised if you could find better or more authentic Italian cuisine in Italy.  The food is matched by the service.  With some good wine and an appropriate gratuity, you'll be north of $100/person.  And, it's worth it!

Pxvh3Elzs_cFlkyE-IfjxQ.text: The experience is wonderful and the food is unbelievable.  Great evening and great service.

KYyDBkvVY69Ne3L-_rpziQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place and make it a point to get dinner here every time I'm in Vegas. Il Mulino never fails to deliver an absolutely delicious and memorable evening and last night was no exception.  To start, as soon as you're seated, they bring out they bring out a selection of delicious breads along with a huge wedge of cheese from which they'll cut you a piece. The breads are so yummy - perhaps due in part to the high oil content, but if you're eating here, you've pretty much written off trying to be healthy at least for 1 meal, so just enjoy it :) Next up is some bruschetta (I'm veggie, but if you're not, it typically comes with mussels), fried zuchini and salami (again if you're not veggie). All of this, before you even order! To be honest, I was pretty full before I even looked at a menu!  We got the special mushroom ravioli in champagne cream sauce. Best sauce I've ever had, bar none. I'd almost go back to Vegas just for this sauce. The capellini with vodka sauce was almost equally delicious.  We were celebrating a birthday (which I had noted on my OpenTable reservation), so they brought us out a cannoli with a candle (on the house) and sang. It was really sweet of them to do this and the cannoli was to die for.  Oh, and did I mention the drinks are great too? Amazing wine selection and they make a really delicious sangria.  Overall, if you're willing to throw calorie counting out the window (after all, you're in Vegas), definitely go here!

wcu1Ewrqom3TVzdLGTEZ2w.text: Simply delicious !!!   They feed you a small meal of cheeses, zucchini, meats and bread before you even look at the menu. Then everything on the menu melts in your mouth.   Favorites of mine include   1. Chicken Parm  2. Chicken in white sauce with mushrooms  3. Veal Parm   The service is unmatched by any restaurant I have dined in !!!   IL Molino is a must do !!!

TlyN1oig50Io0aeA4OMCKw.text: I know this is a few weeks since I was there but I had to state that this is truly the finest Italian Resturaunt outside of Sicily -- hate to say it-- but this is better than any place I've eaten in Italy. They've brought Italy to Las Vegas!! The service is second to none! Alisha Rosinek is the Maitre D and is simply amazing. Our Captain was Daniel and Peter and John were part of the serving team. There is only one place to eat while in Las Vegas  and it's right in the shops at Cesar's  Make reservations and come hungry- you won't be dissatisfied in any way!!!

rUiEFajtdfJM_6t1v3BQRg.text: A friend raved  about the Miami location and I didn't get a chance to check it out a few months ago.    So I made sure to add it to my list while in Vegas. I came here for dinner on New Year's day with my boyfriend.  And what an incredible dinner it was!   The restaurant definitely is romantic and upscale, the service was excellent, and the food was some of the best Italian I've ever had.  Our waiter rattled off all these different options for almost 5 minutes, that by the time he handed us menus we were utterly confused about what to order, and were trying to remember some of the off-menu options he mentioned.  We ended up both loving what ordered and though the meal was pricey, it was WELL worth it!  A great first meal to kick of 2016.  I will be back!

ZrLQ93Z5nWdny2vI4eNjbw.text: The ambience was elegant, and classic. We enjoy the food, wine selection and the  service was superb.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner with family, food and wine was amazing.

21KjGdfGeje94-9bqucc-A.text: Delicious!  The bf had to carbo load before his race so we decided to come to one of his favorite Italian restaurants.   We were given complimentary fried zucchini, garlic bread, bruschetta, and mussels. I could have done without any of these as my main dish was the star. The zucchini was very bland along with the mussels. The garlic bread was very oily and the bruschetta was just okay. I would recommend skipping these.  We ordered the caprese salad and it was magical. The mozzarella was sooo fresh and the tomato came out super chilled. The balsamic vinegar was phenomenal. Highly recommended!  I ordered the capellini and the bf ordered the bucatini. We both loved our dishes. I loved my sauce a little more because I prefer cream sauces. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and the sauce was well seasoned.   Service was good. Our waters were always full and the plates were cleared at the perfect time. Our server was a little persistent on drink ordering but I stuck with my water.   This place looks very romantical (yes I said romantical) when you step in, but you'll find that it gets loud in the dining room so you lose some of the magic.   I'll definitely be back!

q88kI-tLyoOcEFSm0kTdGg.text: This is perhaps the finest Italian food restaurant that I have ever eaten at. The service was impeccable. The food was absolutely delicious and the portions were very generous. We had two appetizers, chilled asparagus drizzled with balsamic vinegar, and eggplant stuffed with shrimp and crab and topped with tomato bechamel sauce which was simply out of this world. For the main course, we shared manicotti stuffed with spinach, ricotta, and mars Capone cheese with sides of spinach and broccoli. I don't know how one person could have eaten the whole thing. Even splitting the entre, we had leftovers, which we took with us and later gave to a homeless person who was hungry. We had no room leftover for dessert, but made room for a sinful chocolate souffle compliments of the house to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday weekend.  Considering everything, I felt the prices were quite reasonable. Will definitely return here in the future.

Wh05IEx-VEyFVfT59Uec6g.text: I had a 10PM reservation after a show (At Caesars). The restaurant called me at noon to confirm. I told them I was coming right after the show. The person said that they would note that on my reservation. We walked in at 10:15 only to be told that the last reservation is at 10. We were turned away at our 30th wedding anniversary! This restaurant should honor a reservation after a show, especially a show at Caesars! Never again!!

CnIBriVKz3u9SYx7jtco7w.text: Most amazing meal I've ever had... hands down, no contest.  The appetizers and wine selection blew my mind... then dinner arrived.

fjP2tvhvoKLicgJcFLCwPQ.text: Il Mulino Staple of NYC and My Hometown comesto Las Vegas in the new section of the forum shops on the North End of the Strip.  Everything is pretty much exactly like the originals with complimentary Cheese, Salami, spicy fried Zu chini, brushetta, various breas etc your suffed and you didn't start yet. 8 of us tonight so 3 bottles of wine are more than suffcient.  Tons of specials available but the boys whent for Standard fare.  Langostino speials were excellent - Meatball appetizer excellent - Linquini Carbonara SINFUL, Linguini Bolognese Killer,   Entrees various but standouts were Veal Fiorentino,  Linquini Frutte de Mare, Osso Bucco with Rissoto   Compliementary Lemoncello liquore served.  Service well simply stated AS GOOD AS IT GETS...  Pricey  Yea probably but all and all a fine dining experience from a name we have come to trust.

McW1dfgemCNTBVaO6IuPvA.text: The servers were very nice but the service was too too slow. The appetizers were the best part of the meal. The noise level was terrible...We were looking for a more romantic evening.

J_mfBrusV_UVq6_Yv4WWKQ.text: My brother recommend Il Mulino. My wife and I made dinner reservations for 12/3/16 and we were extremely impressed by everything Il Mulino had to offer.   The cheese was amazing. The different breads were amazing. The tomatoes are literally the best tomatoes we've ever eaten. The entree was very delicious - we both had the Lobster ravioli. Definitely one of my favorite dishes I've had - anywhere!   Now, let's talk about the service. My wife and I got caught up in watching how amazing the staff works together. It was like watching an orchestra perform. There was a moment when a staff member picked up an empty plate along with the tab from another table and when he was walking towards the back, he had the plate behind him. Another staff member walking towards his direction intercepted the plate so he could take care of the tab while the other member picked up plates from another table. I'll admit, I'm probably not explaining it that well, but it was a thing of beauty. It was just one example of how well the staff works together.  Another example is that not one time did my wife or I ask for anything. That's how attentive they were.   Next time we visit Vegas, we will make sure to come back.

9VCLqkcEUZMIcWl5fskQGw.text: Great experience! We loved the food and the service! Best Italian I've ever had hands down.

bbTDaH47rCJ6vMS4KDvBWg.text: It is not often that one gets to dine in a place where the service is flawless from start to finish. Il Mulino is such a place. Their attention to detail in every aspect of the experience is nothing short of perfection. During dinner, I inadvertently knocked my purse off of the chair, and before it hit the floor one of the staff was there to pick it up for me. The most excellent service in the world wouldn't be the same without the food to back it up, and I was delighted to find out everything we ordered was exquisite. In addition to what you order off the menu, diners are presented with complementary antipasti which begins with (my favorite!) a giant wheel of Parmesan cheese brought to the table, and a generous hunk of cheese is cut off just for you. It is quickly followed by heavenly garlic bread, focaccia bread, soft Italian bread, a plate of salami, and bruschetta (best ever!) with mussels (no shellfish for me, so I passed). Once we got around to ordering, we started with a Caesar salad, which we split. The dressing was perfect in flavor, without being overpowering. My husband ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo, and he didn't speak for the entire time he ate, which means it was amazing. I ordered the whole Branzini, which is cooked in rock salt, presented for viewing (impressive!), then deboned and served with a light lemon olive oil dressing. This was absolute perfection! Since we were celebrating my birthday, the staff surprised me with a birthday dessert (although I did not order one) and a lively Italian rendition of "Happy Birthday.". It was the flourless chocolate cake; never have I tasted a chocolate cake that amazing! For as long as I have known my husband, he has sung the praises of Il Mulino. I am much more of a foodie than he is, so I knew this must be something special if he was so excited about it. He and a friend have made an annual pilgrimage to Las Vegas for many years, and one of the biggest reasons is so they can dine at this restaurant together. Finally, I was able to join him! I can't wait until the next trip!! if it was possible to give 6 stars, I would do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Mulino New York - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock Salt Branzini. Crazy good!

GOm0m6bffzkfq8Yv1h3Cxg.text: To be completely honest, this place blew my socks off. This is the best Italian restaurant I have ever been to....ever. The food was cooked perfectly, the service was amazing, and the ambiance was spot on. I felt like I should have been celebrating a special occasion based on how fancy the place was. My only complaint would be the location; I swear it was like looking for the holy grail to find this place.

7lHaWkTa4L2_RDU87BAp3A.text: Outstanding evening at II Mulino - Las Vegas. The wine list is exceptional as is the food and impeccable service. A wonderful location for a special evening with family and friends. As good as their West 38th location in New York!

viMcCJxe_nZLjBGKLiXNkg.text: No need for a long review for this place. We have been here several times with friends over many years. When we want a special dinner in Las Vegas this is always our first choice.  The service is impeccable and the food is the best. Check this place out when you have something to celebrate!

DFtN0rLuKsroj94qRgoQVQ.text: The most amazing restaurant hands down!!!!! I can't really come here every day. By far my favorite restaurant ever. Thank you Alisha thank you Patrick and Raul and to the rest of the stuff that makes our dinner so beautiful and absolutely amazing. We love coming here.

g88eMA6ok_21yAxBl_Vlwg.text: Can't miss this spot when we go to Vegas. Incredible service and delicious food. If you're looking for a place to relax be sure to pace yourself for all the deliciousness coming your way.

vIIylGbtpouNGtgp-6hUmw.text: Every trip to Vegas I build in time for Il Mulino, I've never been disappointed with anything I've ever ordered. The food here is perfect. large portions, cooked to perfection, rich, savory and simply life's finest. The Tortellini soup, Carbonara and flowerless chocolate cake with a fine Italian white wine is a life affirming event.   Yes, it is expensive. Frankly, if you can't afford $100 per person (or much more depending on your wine and drink choice), don't come here. That simple. You have been warned. You get what you pay for. The food is the best but you pay a premium. I believe there is a Maggianos at Fashion Show mall if you want moderate priced blah psudo-Italian food. But remember, it's Vegas, on the strip, at Caesars, everything is expensive.   The service is impeccable. But this is a fine dining establishment, that does mean that there is a bit of institutional arrogance. If you are not accustomed to that, again Maggianos is right down the road.   There are con's here. The wine list is extensive, but even I find it to be a bit lopsided with big Italian reds when not much on the menu supports such belly busters. I would like to see their lighter red and white selection grow. The food is really heavy, and in the summer with 100+ degree heat even at night, it can be a little much to take if you are planning a long walk down the strip.   Both bartenders are top class. I do prefer my Manhattans served up and prefer not to have it shaken to death, but this is picky stuff.   All in all, the best Vegas has to offer.

m24YYUqgIlXQVRof6AnGfg.text: my gf and i went here for our second date.  in fact, we were "walk-ins" and were treated very well from the get-go.  since the second date ... we've been here at least ten times.  each time has been just as good as the last.  i read a review saying "pasta shouldn't be more than $20."  really?  which fly-over city are you from, man?  perhaps in your b- or c-city pasta doesn't cost over twenty dollars but in the "big cities," yes, you'll find pasta dishes that are much more.  i'm sure if you're expecting olive garden (which doesn't completely suck), then you're gonna be shocked when you get the check.  my gf and i have almost the exact same tastes and find that most plates are too big for either one of us ... so ... we split a lot of things.  we're not cheap; we're just not wasteful.  i've never had an over-charge experience here.  we love the paparadelle.  we love love love this white truffle ravioli.  dennis, the wine steward/captain, will not steer you wrong.  the wait staff is impeccable but i still miss our friend lino who's now working for one of the night clubs.  along with RM this is a place we CONTINUALLY look forward to eat and see our friends.

7fbkVgHijB-axm1YJRWYQQ.text: just like all of these reviews said, awesome restaurant! before you even sit down, there is someone standing there with a huge block of cheese waiting to cut off a chunk for you. once you sit down you are immediately brought three types of bread (garlic, italian, and some type of delicious fried bread), followed by bruchetta, shaved, fried zuccini, sliced salami, and a mussel. all of this before they even take your drink order! you could be full already!  we ordered calimari as an appetizer and it was very good... wasn't the best i've had but still good. my entree was veal stuffed canneloni that was delicious! everyone at our table loved their food.  the service is top notch. several folks wait on you hand and foot, and they probably brought me three different sets of silverware since they pick everything up rather than make you resuse them.   at the end of the dinner they bring you a free shot of grapa (spelling). it's an "italian moonshine" made from grapes. it supposedly helps with digestion.  defintely the best place i've eaten in vegas so far! go there!

QFLqLX2RrK12FPeOIVbc8Q.text: AWESOME AS ALWAYS!!! We went for my birthday and had a GREAT time! I had one of their specials, langostino over risotto. PERFECTO!  The Captain and the staff are always top notch! However it was the first time I saw them allow people in wearing jeans and very casual wear, kinda killed the high class feeling, reason for taking a star off. If I'm paying almost $200 for dinner, I'd prefer you keep the typical Vegas riff-raff out.  Can't wait to go back though!

4Gy8UlWgti1HNEI3rOrBpA.text: My husband and I walked in about 8:30 on a Wednesday night and asked for a table for 2.  The hostess was completely thrown that we had just walked in and didn't have a reservation.  As in, she really didn't know what to do.  As she sat there looking confused and looking around the restaurant, my husband suggested that we could grab a drink at the bar while she figured it out.  She looked relieved and went off to talk to a gentleman who worked there (we presumed about our seating).    Meanwhile husband ordered a martini, and I a glass of $18 wine.  At least it was a big pour.  The wine list was out of control expensive without being out of control excellent.  My baseline is Veuve Clicquot Yellow Label - in the local wine stores here, I can buy it retail for $35-40/bottle.  On this menu, it was $125.  After having a tremendous bottle of Rioja the night before at Stripsteak (at $85) that we were still reminiscing about while at the bar, we decided that by the glass was probably the best way to go.  After about 20 minutes, we determined that our previous night's meal was so good, that neither of us would be opposed to going back if we weren't going to be seated by the end our our drinks.  Ten minutes later, husband paid the bar tab, the hostess was nowhere to be seen, and we took off for another delicious steak down the strip.

9Ma0fhOLlaXb4Sn7eAecIw.text: Was just here last week at the request of a customer. Place is very $$$$ but Holy F*ck  Really Really Good! I'm italian and have had my fair share of good italian food, and can cook well myself. All I have to say is Go There! It's KILLER!  I had the Branzino (fish)...  Insane.

fUn6XdaCmFwEHSz5zcM34g.text: The good part about Il Mulino Italian restaurant is its wonderful location and charming atmosphere! Food is ok, really nothing special! Why? Because it's greasy, oily, heavy handed on sauces and either bland or not sophisticated enough which is not a good place to be considering all the great choices out there when it comes to Italian dining. When seated, the complementary parmiggiano, salami and a few other antipasti is a nice gesture but it's a bit old world and unnecessary if all you expect is exceptional service and cuisine which this place clearly can't provide. Some staff members are better then others especially the ones that are not italian! The ones that are Italian are way to proud of themselves and their attitude is a bit strange and unprofessional! Why? Because    our waiter for some reason had the audacity to grab the payed bill and check it right in front of us as we were still finishing our meal! Pretty embarrassing moment for this restaurant! By the way, I am an American citizen and was born and raised in Italy so for me to criticize the Italian staff isn't easy but I will this time because their attitude and manners is just pathetic. The favorable reviews posted are the reason I wanted to try Il Mulino and now that I have I am a little weary and unsure as to where these reviews are coming from! So, not the worst place in the world with a little luck but I will definitely never step foot here again.

syXSCZShLdimomsdLbBJ2Q.text: our team dined here at a recent sales meeting.  we almost didn't get seated because the reservation had been booked for the next night. the hostess was very defensive and accused us of making an error on our reservation.  luckily our manager saved the voicemail stating we were confirmed.  at that point, the maitre'd stepped in and gave us a very nice private room  the service was stellar. the food was stellar. two words. YUM. MEEE  the service and food do come at a cost, though.  our total bill for 11 was $2300!! i would normally give this type of place at least 4 stars but the interactoin with the hostess really tarnished my experience.

pxti6J8CQCCYSmyrV-kytQ.text: Bad reviews? What restaurant were these people at?  Il Mulino has Outstanding service, exquisite cuisine, and an impressive wine list making this authentic Italian restaurant a must experience.  From the small samplings delivered to table upon our being seated to dessert and everything in between, simply amazing. I had the Osso Bucco and my wife had shrimp with a mushroom risotto.  Everything was cooked perfectly and delicious.  For dessert? The best Tiramisu I've ever had.  This is not an inexpensive place to eat but it is well worth it.  Among the best meals I've had on any continent.

CQsuWRJIdY9E0sQJOnluLQ.text: I had dinner reservations for a party of five and none of us were disappointed. The evening we went on wasn't as busy as usual, therefore we had superb service. We tried a variety of dishes and decided to all share - or rather pick off of each other's plates, haha. From the pasta to the fish, to the wine and the cheese, we were satisfied. What stood out the most was the service.  They waited on us hand and foot which was really nice. We ordered everything from drinks to dessert with no complaints. They served parmesan cheese, garlic bread, small fried goodies, etc. I believe we even had a couple of complimentary dishes to try. It was a really nice dinner. I treated that evening and picked up the tab.. so for the 5 of us.. the bill was only $400.. It was worth it. I'd go back again and bring friends that have never been.. =)

MvE4MiB00mmURf8xl5Npbw.text: Appetizers that are served immediately (complimentary) were excellent, caesar salad had boxed croutons and not-so-fresh lettuce,  My husband got pounded veal chop (parm).  It was huge and quite good. He also got penne in a marina sauce which was excellent.  I ended up sharing his meal as mine was not that great.I got the flat pasta with bolognese sauce.  Complimentary cordial was tasteful and so was the wine.

Fwdazsx8nMqomsBGcRpWzA.text: I've been to Il Mulino in NYC many times and have never been disappointed.  I've eaten at this Il Mulino in Vegas a few times and always had a flawless experience until the other night.  Don't get me wrong, the food is always prepared and served as ordered and it's absolutely the highest quality.  My only issue was a rude comment the waiter made when one of my guests asked for another piece of parmesan cheese, which is basically a "no-charge" appetizer. A few minutes earlier, I had asked for another piece and the waiter cut two smaller pieces and put it on my plate.  When my guest asked for another piece, the waiter said "I just gave him two".  It was said rather rudely, not taking into account that it was also on my plate that was used for other appetizers as well.  That being said, the captain and the meal were on point but I don't think the experience was flawless.  Maybe they should have offered a paid option, which we wouldn't have minded.

5D1bEhyWpbptCHQehGgvAQ.text: We love this place. It was our second trip to Il Mulino after a two-year hiatus from Las Vegas. All the tasty nibbles they serve as soon as you sit down are great (parmesano reggiano, salumi, fried zucchini, bruschetta, fresh baked breads). It is expensive but we always feel we receive excellent service and delicious food in large portions. (We'll gladly spend the extra $100 on the tab to feel like we were tried like royalty and enjoyed more than enough food.) They never rush guests here too, which is nice. The ambiance is nice too. Of all the restaurants in Vegas to celebrate our wedding anniversary, we chose this one and it did not disappoint.

Cd2WJwRbDRibaaeQxQV3dg.text: If you want an honest review of an Italian restaurant ask an Italian...My wife and I have been going to Il Mulino N Y for many years and always look forward to our meal there..We were asked to recommend and book a restaurant for us and two other couples on a recent trip to Las Vegas. we were a bit apprehensive in selecting Il Mulino LV because we had never eaten at that location.....well, we went, and here's my impressions. first of all, let's get this part out of the way.....THE FOOD IS OFF THE CHARTS GOOD...Very authentic Italian, just like Grandpa made for Sunday Dinner....You've read descriptions of the food from other reviewers so I won't go into descriptions of that, suffice it to say, the food is peasant Italian served in a  gourmet style...pay no attention to the nay-sayers..didn't see an Italian name among them... difference between Il Mulino NY and LV atmosphere...NY restaurant has been around for a while and is a bit worn which,I feel, adds to the charm..The wait staff in NY is less stiff, Far more friendly...Back to LV, we were the first to arrived right at 5:00 PM....no big welcome, not even an enthusiastic hello..We ordered cocktails at the bar and enjoyed them on the patio overlooking the strip...No one came to get us when it was time for our reservation so I had to track someone down to take us to our table...Now, I want to regress a bit....I had brought a very good bottle of wine from my cellar to share with my friends....note, I never bring more than one bottle of wine to a restaurant..I walked in with the wine exposed, nothing was said until I went to the Maitre D' and asked that my wine be opened and decanted...he then advised me of their policy of no outside wine..I said sorry I didn't know...he did make an exception and allowed my wine with the understanding that there would be a corkage fee and that I would buy another bottle of wine...all this done in a scolding sort of way saying I should have called first about the wine policy...he's probably right about that but, a little respect....I was probably drinking wine before he was born..I was handed the wine list soon after being seated..I was hard pressed to find a decent wine for under $200.00...did find one but not until after the waiter's strong encourage to up-sell me...corkage fee $40.00, a bit much...all that said, service was great food was real..."You really need to go"

7_h5yQLp-G29MUEXQskSxQ.text: Our dinner started out on an impressive note with the yummy appetizers as mentioned by other reviewers--parmesan cheese chunks, thinly sliced fried zucchini, pepperoni, and hearty bread. We had to ask for the balsamic vinegar to mix with the olive oil already on the table. Then the head waiter rattled off a long list of specials for the night (as though we were going to remember any of them. Why not write them on a blackboard or print out a daily special menu?) Since we had reserved for the $50/p prix fixe sunset menu, 4-6PM, all the specials he mentioned didn't apply, and when we told him that, he totally lost interest in us.    There were ample choices on the prix fixe menu, so among 8 of us we ordered mussels, calamari fritti, cannelloni and tasted each others portions. I have to say not one of them stood out. Mussels were not plump and juicy; calamari was not light and crispy; cannelloni was not thin like a crepe. For the main dishes, among us we ordered porcini mushroom ravioli, salmon, steak in marinara sauce. The only happy diner was the one who ordered salmon which was moist on a bed of veggies. The ravioli was doughy and the filling was mushy; the beef was smothered in the sauce and too salty. We also ordered a bottle of red wine for $115 since the "house wine" by the glass would have cost $27 according to our waiter. Our bottle was "decanted" in a pitcher. I have never seen this done in any fine restaurant. But it went down smoothly and helped make the entrees more palatable. Dessert should have been the piece d' resistance with assortment of tiramisu, cheesecake, and chocolate cake. It came on a plate all mixed together and covered with whipped cream and ice cream--not at all appealing.     In summary, the pasta for the dishes we tasted seemed commercially-made and the sauces were too heavy, nothing like refined Italian cuisine. The dessert looked thrown on the platters. They wouldn't give us separate checks for four couples whereas all the other restaurants did so. On the plus side were the appetizers and the service waiters who were attentive and pleasant. The dining room is also very attractive with low noise level. I wouldn't return to this restaurant as there are so many better ones to choose from, even with the prix fixe menus. Other reviews for this 3 day Las Vegas eating trip to follow.

v_uTNyJ5yq2pDsRHl7drfQ.text: My husband and I ate here during our trip to Vegas and wow I thought that the mustroom black truffle ravioli was to die for! I absolutely loved it.  My hubby's dish was the lobster special and neither of us really cared for it.  The service was excellent though - real attentive, but with the price tag of the place (over $200 for dinner with drinks) I would have been surprised if it had been any other way.  We sat outside and had a nice view of the strip while we enjoyed our meal!

Q3RXDHTjMGm6X0CwMmQ3Dw.text: I go to Vegas twice a year and always take my clients to the this great spot. its a intimate place that is perfect for a date or anniversary, not so good if you want to slam some shots. The cheese is amazing, the chunks of reggiano are fresh and go perfect with the bread and a little red. Ive ordered everything from the sea bass to there pasta and there veal parm is insane. Its on the bone like a rib eye but its veal parm..  Good spot but pricey, recently dined with 9 guest and the bill was just short of 1500.  Buon appetit

VQS9FAYGfT7EVsj9e_ZOzg.text: Right when you walk in the service is amazing. My cousin loved the Gnocchi. It was very upscale and quiet. The meal was one of the best I've ever had. And the desert was fantastic! I wanted to try everything that was one the table because it looked so good. I took a few pictures of the desert and diner plates which i never really do. ***** Recommended for everyone! OH and try the Limoncello!

-6IFfyy27lJNrRHA0BvBSg.text: Outstanding. I'm reading some other reviews and scratching my head... I guess any place can have an off night but I can't imagine how you get Il Mulino to one star. A decidedly different experience than the typical LV restaurant in that it's quiet and refined. The service was impeccable and friendly; not condescending in any way shape or form. The food was outstanding in every way, from the appetizers they put on the table before you even look at the menu to the main course and awesome desert. If you think Olive Garden or Carraba's is Italian, don't waste your money here. If you want first rate house made food with awesome service, Il Mulino is for you.

crFi-Z2JHWIiC5h4oEz1uw.text: our hotel (ballys)  recommended it..   the restaurant is 'fancy,' has a romantic mood: dim lighting & candles, and also a nice little view.  the waiters were more than willing to serve us, they were so friendly (maybe TOO friendly, they were like flirting with us, it was sometimes uncomfortable).  they all seemed to be "italian."  but my friends and i are pretty sure that some of them were faking the italian accent. (haha)   we all ordered different pasta dishes.  i ordered from their "specials for the night" : mushroom and black truffle ravioli..which i couldn't finish, not because there was too much on my plate but because the black truffle was "how do you say," too rich. also my dish cost $50.00.  overall, the food was OKAY, the service was more than great, because they gave us free shots of GRAPPA and LEMON CELLO!!  atmosphere is for couples.  we all had a good time at Il Mulino because the waiters were entertaining us, but other than that.. i don't think I would go back there or recommend it.
